</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v</span><span class="lbl syntax">, <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  It must be amusingly written.</q></span></li>
   </ol>

</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">amusing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for amuse" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/017/01709/01709.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">amused</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for amuse" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/017/01701/01701.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="amuse_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>amuses</strong> you, it makes you want to laugh or smile.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The thought seemed to amuse him.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Their antics never fail to amuse.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="amuse_1.4" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>amuse</strong> <strong>yourself</strong>, you do something in order to pass the time and not become bored.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I need distractions. I need to amuse myself so I won't keep thinking about things.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Put a selection of baby toys in his cot to amuse him if he wakes early.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="amuse_1.7" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="amused#amused_1">amused</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="amusing#amusing_1">amusing</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>

    <a id="advert_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">advert<span class="pron">(<span class="underline"></span>dvt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for advert" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/008/00827/00827.mp3"></a>

<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">adverts</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for advert" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/008/00838/00838.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="advert_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>advert</strong> is an announcement in a newspaper, on television, or on a poster about something
               such as a product, event, or job.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I saw an advert for a job with a large engineering company.</q></span><div class="semantic">in AM, use <strong>ad</strong></div>
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="advert_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that an example of something is <strong>an</strong> <strong>advert</strong> <strong>for</strong> that thing in general, you mean that it shows how good that thing is.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  This courtroom battle has been a poor advert for English justice.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="advert_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. plural noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can use <strong>the adverts</strong> to refer to the interval in a commercial television programme, or between programmes,
               during which advertisements are shown.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>, <span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  After the adverts, the presenter tried to pretend that everything was back to normal.</q></span><div class="semantic">in AM, use <strong>commercial break</strong></div>
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="anticipate_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>anticipate</strong> an event, you realize in advance that it may happen and you are prepared for it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  At the time we couldn't have anticipated the result of our campaigning.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed that]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  It is anticipated that the equivalent of 192 full-time jobs will be lost.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> that]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Officials anticipate that rivalry between leaders of the various drug factions could
                  erupt into full scale war.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="anticipate_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>anticipate</strong> a question, request, or need, you do what is necessary or required before the question,
               request, or need occurs.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  What Jeff did was to anticipate my next question.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="anticipate_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>anticipate</strong> something, you do it, think it, or say it before someone else does.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  In the 50s, Rauschenberg anticipated the conceptual art movement of the 80s.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

It was awful.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Some of their offences are so awful they would chill the blood.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="awful_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span>

         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you look or feel <strong>awful</strong>, you look or feel ill.</span><span class="orth"><q>  I hardly slept at all and felt pretty awful.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. adjective</span>

   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can use <strong>awful</strong> with noun groups that refer to an amount in order to emphasize how large that amount
            is.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  I've got an awful lot of work to do.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">awfully</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/032/03298/03298.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [usu <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj/adv]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  Would you mind awfully waiting a bit, I'll be back right away.</q></span></li>

         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can use <strong>awful</strong> with adjectives that describe a quality in order to emphasize that particular quality.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">US</span>, <span class="lbl register">informal</span>, <span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  Gosh, you're awful pretty.</q></span></li>

   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>

   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">

A job that is <strong>awkward</strong> is difficult to do.</span><span class="orth"><q>  It was small but heavy enough to make it awkward to carry.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Full-size tripods can be awkward, especially if you're shooting a low-level subject.</q></span></li>

   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>awkward</strong> movement or position is uncomfortable or clumsy.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Amy made an awkward gesture with her hands.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">awkwardly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/033/03302/03302.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  He fell awkwardly and went down in agony clutching his right knee.</q></span></li>
   </ol>

   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone who feels <strong>awkward</strong> behaves in a shy or embarrassed way.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Women frequently say that they feel awkward taking the initiative in sex.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">awkwardly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/033/03302/03302.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  'This is Malcolm,' the girl said awkwardly, to fill the silence.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="awkward_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone is <strong>awkward</strong>, you are critical of them because you find them unreasonable and difficult to live
               with or deal with.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">disapproval</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  She's got to an age where she is being awkward.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone or something is <strong>absent</strong> <strong>from</strong> a place or situation where they should be or where they usually are, they are not
               there.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">from</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He has been absent from his desk for two weeks.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Any soldier failing to report would be considered absent without leave and punished
                  accordingly.</q></span></li>

      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="absent_1.10" class="hom">

      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that <strong>absent</strong> one thing, another thing will happen, you mean that if the first thing does not happen,

      </ol>

</span>)</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="basis_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something is done <strong>on</strong> a particular <strong>basis</strong>, it is done according to that method, system, or principle.</span><span class="orth"><q>  We're going to be meeting there on a regular basis.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  They want all groups to be treated on an equal basis.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  I've always worked on the basis that if I don't know anything technical I shan't be
                  any worse off.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="basis_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that you are acting <strong>on</strong> the <strong>basis</strong> <strong>of</strong> something, you are giving that as the reason for your action.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  McGregor must remain confined, on the basis of the medical reports we have received.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="basis_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>basis</strong> of something is its starting point or an important part of it from which it can be
               further developed.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Both factions have broadly agreed that the U.N. plan is a possible basis for negotiation.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the sub-atomic particles that form the basis of nearly all matter on earth.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="basis_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>basis</strong> for something is a fact or argument that you can use to prove or justify it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...Japan's attempt to secure the legal basis to send troops overseas.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  This is a common fallacy which has no basis in fact.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>

      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>appeal</strong> <strong>to</strong> someone <strong>to</strong> do something, you make a serious and urgent request to them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to/for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The Prime Minister appealed to young people to use their vote.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He will appeal to the state for an extension of unemployment benefits.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The United Nations has appealed for help from the international community.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="appeal_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>appeal</strong> is a serious and urgent request.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Romania's government issued a last-minute appeal to him to call off his trip.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="appeal_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>appeal</strong> is an attempt to raise money for a charity or for a good cause.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...an appeal to save a library containing priceless manuscripts.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="appeal_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>appeal</strong> <strong>to</strong> someone in authority against a decision, you formally ask them to change it. In British
               English, you <strong>appeal against</strong> something. In American English, you <strong>appeal</strong> something.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">against</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He said they would appeal against the decision.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  We intend to appeal the verdict.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Maguire has appealed to the Supreme Court to stop her extradition.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="appeal_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>appeal</strong> is a formal request for a decision to be changed.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">against</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Heath's appeal against the sentence was later successful.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The jury agreed with her, but she lost the case on appeal.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="appeal_1.16" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="court-of-appeal#court-of-appeal_1">Court of Appeal</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="appeal_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>appeals</strong> <strong>to</strong> you, you find it attractive or interesting.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  On the other hand, the idea appealed to him.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="appeal_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>appeal</strong> of something is a quality that it has which people find attractive or interesting.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Its new title was meant to give the party greater public appeal.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="appeal_1.21" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="sex-appeal#sex-appeal_1">sex appeal</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="appeal_1.22" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="appealing#appealing_1">appealing</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="amuse_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">amuse<span class="pron">(mj<span class="underline">u</span>z<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for amuse" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/017/01700/01700.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">amuses</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for amuse" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/017/01708/01708.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">amusing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for amuse" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/017/01709/01709.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">amused</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for amuse" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/017/01701/01701.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="amuse_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>amuses</strong> you, it makes you want to laugh or smile.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The thought seemed to amuse him.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Their antics never fail to amuse.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="amuse_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>amuse</strong> <strong>yourself</strong>, you do something in order to pass the time and not become bored.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I need distractions. I need to amuse myself so I won't keep thinking about things.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Put a selection of baby toys in his cot to amuse him if he wakes early.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="amuse_1.7" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="amused#amused_1">amused</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="amusing#amusing_1">amusing</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="beneath_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">beneath<span class="pron">(bn<span class="underline">i</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for beneath" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/046/04631/04631.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="beneath_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. preposition</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Something that is <strong>beneath</strong> another thing is under the other thing.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She could see the muscles of his shoulders beneath his T-shirt.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  She found pleasure in sitting beneath the trees.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the frozen grass crunching beneath his feet.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Beneath</strong> is also an adverb.</span><span class="orth"><q>  On a shelf beneath he spotted a photo album.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="beneath_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. preposition</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you talk about what is <strong>beneath</strong> the surface of something, you are talking about the aspects of it which are hidden
               or not obvious.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...emotional strains beneath the surface.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Beneath the festive mood there is an underlying apprehension.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="beneath_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. preposition</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone or something is <strong>beneath</strong> you, you feel that they are not good enough for you or not suitable for you.</span><span class="orth"><q>  They decided she was marrying beneath her.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Many find themselves having to take jobs far beneath them.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="behalf_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">behalf<span class="pron">(bh<span class="underline"></span>f<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for behalf" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/044/04487/04487.mp3"></a>
</span></span><span class="pron">; -h<span class="underline"></span>f)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="behalf_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you do something <strong>on</strong> someone's <strong>behalf</strong>, you do it for that person as their representative. The form <strong>in</strong> someone's <strong>behalf</strong> is also used, mainly in American English.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She made an emotional public appeal on her son's behalf.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Secret Service officer Robin Thompson spoke on behalf of his colleagues.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="behalf_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you feel, for example, embarrassed or angry <strong>on</strong> someone's <strong>behalf</strong>, you feel embarrassed or angry for them.</span><span class="orth"><q>  'What do you mean?' I asked, offended on Liddie's behalf.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="assure_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">assure<span class="pron">(<span class="underline"></span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for assure" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/028/02862/02862.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">assures</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for assure" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/028/02866/02866.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">assuring</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for assure" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/028/02867/02867.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">assured</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for assure" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/028/02863/02863.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="assure_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>assure</strong> someone <strong>that</strong> something is true or will happen, you tell them that it is definitely true or will
               definitely happen, often in order to make them less worried.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n that]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He hastened to assure me that there was nothing traumatic to report.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n with quote]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  'Are you sure the raft is safe?' she asked anxiously. 'Couldn't be safer,' Max assured
                  her confidently.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Government officials recently assured Hindus of protection.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="assure_1.5" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="assured#assured_1">assured</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="assure_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>assure</strong> someone <strong>of</strong> something means to make certain that they will get it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Last night's resounding victory over Birmingham City has virtually assured them of
                  promotion.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Ways must be found to assure our children a decent start in life.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="assure_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You use phrases such as <strong>I can assure you</strong> or <strong>let me assure you</strong> to emphasize the truth of what you are saying.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  I can assure you that the animals are well cared for.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="bend_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">bend<span class="pron">(b<span class="underline">e</span>nd<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bend" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/046/04622/04622.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">bends</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bend" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/046/04629/04629.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">bending</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bend" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/046/04628/04628.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">bent</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bend" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/046/04654/04654.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="bend_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>bend</strong>, you move the top part of your body downwards and forwards. Plants and trees also
               <strong>bend</strong>.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I bent over and kissed her cheek.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She bent and picked up a plastic bucket.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She was bent over the sink washing the dishes.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bend_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>bend</strong> your head, you move your head forwards and downwards.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Rick appeared, bending his head a little to clear the top of the door.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>bend</strong> a part of your body such as your arm or leg, or when it <strong>bends</strong>, you change its position so that it is no longer straight.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  These cruel devices are designed to stop prisoners bending their legs.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  As you walk faster, you will find the arms bend naturally and more quickly.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">bent</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/046/04654/04654.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adjective</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  Keep your knees slightly bent.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>bend</strong> something that is flat or straight, you use force to make it curved or to put an
            angle in it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Bend the bar into a horseshoe.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She'd cut a jagged hole in the tin, bending a knife in the process.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">bent</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/046/04654/04654.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adjective</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a length of bent wire.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="bend_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When a road, beam of light, or other long thin thing <strong>bends</strong>, or when something <strong>bends</strong> it, it changes direction to form a curve or angle.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The road bent slightly to the right.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Glass bends light of different colours by different amounts.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bend_1.20" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>bend</strong> in a road, pipe, or other long thin object is a curve or angle in it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The crash occurred on a sharp bend.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bend_1.22" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>bends</strong> <strong>to</strong> your wishes, they believe or do something different, usually when they do not want
               to.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Congress has to bend to his will.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Do you think she's likely to bend on her attitude to Europe?</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bend_1.25" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>bend</strong> rules or laws, you interpret them in a way that allows you to do something they would
               not normally allow you to do.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A minority of officers were prepared to bend the rules.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bend_1.27" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>bend</strong> the truth or <strong>bend</strong> the facts, you say something that is not exactly true.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Sometimes we bend the truth a little in order to spare them the pain of the real facts.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bend_1.29" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="bent#bent_1">bent</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="hairpin-bend#hairpin-bend_1">hairpin bend</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="bend_1.30" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone <strong>is bending over backwards</strong> <strong>to</strong> be helpful or kind, you are emphasizing that they are trying very hard to be helpful
               or kind.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  People are bending over backwards to please customers.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bend_1.32" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">12. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone or something <strong>drives you round the bend</strong>, you mean that you dislike them and they annoy or upset you very much.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>, <span class="lbl register">informal</span>, <span class="lbl pragmatics">feelings</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  And can you make that tea before your fidgeting drives me completely round the bend.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="betting_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">betting<span class="pron">(b<span class="underline">e</span>t<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for betting" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/047/04753/04753.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="betting_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say <strong>the betting is</strong> that something will happen or is true, you are suggesting that it is very likely
               to happen or to be true.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The betting is that the experience will make Japan more competitive still.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="bet_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">bet<span class="pron">(b<span class="underline">e</span>t<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bet" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/047/04725/04725.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">bets</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bet" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/047/04745/04745.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">betting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bet" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/047/04753/04753.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div class="semantic">The form <strong>bet</strong> is used in the present tense and is the past tense and past participle.
   </div>
   <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
   </h4>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>bet</strong> <strong>on</strong> the result of a horse race, football game, or other event, you give someone a sum
            of money which they give you back with extra money if the result is what you predicted,
            or which they keep if it is not.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Jockeys are forbidden to bet on the outcome of races.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> amount +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I bet 10 on a horse called Premonition.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n amount]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He bet them 500 they would lose.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Bet</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Do you always have a bet on the Grand National?</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">betting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/047/04753/04753.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...his thousand-pound fine for illegal betting.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...betting shops.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="bet_1.9" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>bet</strong> is a sum of money which you give to someone when you bet.</span><span class="orth"><q>  You can put a bet on almost anything these days.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bet_1.11" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>is betting</strong> that something will happen, they are hoping or expecting that it will happen.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">journalism</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> that]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The party is betting that the presidential race will turn into a battle for younger
                  voters.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  People were betting on a further easing of credit conditions.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bet_1.14" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="betting#betting_1">betting</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="bet_1.15" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You use expressions such as '<strong>I bet</strong>', '<strong>I'll bet</strong>', and '<strong>you can bet</strong>' to indicate that you are sure something is true.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  I bet you were good at games when you were at school.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  I'll bet they'll taste out of this world.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bet_1.18" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you tell someone that something is a <strong>good bet</strong>, you are suggesting that it is the thing or course of action that they should choose.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  Your best bet is to choose a guest house.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bet_1.20" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that it is <strong>a good bet</strong> or <strong>a safe bet</strong> that something is true or will happen, you are saying that it is extremely likely
               to be true or to happen.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  It is a safe bet that the current owners will not sell.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bet_1.22" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>hedge</strong> your <strong>bets</strong>, you follow two courses of action to avoid making a decision between two things because
               you cannot decide which one is right.</span><span class="orth"><q>  NASA is hedging its bets and adopting both strategies.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bet_1.24" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You use <strong>I bet</strong> or <strong>I'll bet</strong> in reply to a statement to show that you agree with it or that you expected it to
               be true, usually when you are annoyed or amused by it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>, <span class="lbl register">spoken</span>, <span class="lbl pragmatics">feelings</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">PHR</span> that]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  'I'd like to ask you something,' I said. 'I bet you would,' she grinned.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bet_1.26" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can use <strong>my bet is</strong> or <strong>it's my bet</strong> to give your personal opinion about something, when you are fairly sure that you
               are right.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  My bet is that next year will be different.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  It's my bet that he's the guy behind this killing.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bet_1.29" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say <strong>don't bet on</strong> something or <strong>I wouldn't bet on</strong> something, you mean that you do not think that something is true or will happen.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>, <span class="lbl register">spoken</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  'We'll never get a table in there''Don't bet on it.'</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bet_1.31" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">12. convention</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you reply '<strong>Do you want to bet?</strong>' or '<strong>Want a bet?</strong>' to someone, you mean you are certain that what they have said is wrong.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>, <span class="lbl register">spoken</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  'Money can't buy happiness''Want to bet?'</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bet_1.33" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">13. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You use '<strong>You bet</strong>' or '<strong>you bet your life</strong>' to say yes in an emphatic way or to emphasize a reply or statement.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>, <span class="lbl register">spoken</span>, <span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  'It's settled, then?''You bet.'</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  'Are you afraid of snakes?''You bet your life I'm afraid of snakes.'</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="blonde_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">blonde<span class="pron">(bl<span class="underline"></span>nd<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for blonde" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/053/05369/05369.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">blondes</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for blonde" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/053/05373/05373.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">blonder</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for blonde" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/053/05372/05372.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">blondest</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for blonde" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/680/68077/68077.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">The form <strong>blonde</strong> is usually used to refer to women, and <strong>blond</strong> to refer to men.
   </div>
   <div id="blonde_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. colour</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A woman who has <strong>blonde</strong> hair has pale-coloured hair. Blonde hair can be very light brown or light yellow.
               The form <strong>blond</strong> is used when describing men.</span><span class="orth"><q>  There were two little girls, one Asian and one with blonde hair.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The baby had blond curls.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="blonde_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone who is <strong>blonde</strong> has blonde hair.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He was blonder than his brother.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the striking blond actor.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="blonde_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>blonde</strong> is a woman who has blonde hair.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="belt_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">belt<span class="pron">(b<span class="underline">e</span>lt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for belt" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/045/04599/04599.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">belts</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for belt" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/046/04606/04606.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">belting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for belt" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/046/04605/04605.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">belted</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for belt" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/046/04602/04602.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="belt_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>belt</strong> is a strip of leather or cloth that you fasten round your waist.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He wore a belt with a large brass buckle.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="belt_1.3" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="safety-belt#safety-belt_1">safety belt</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="seat-belt#seat-belt_1">seat belt</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="belt_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>belt</strong> in a machine is a circular strip of rubber that is used to drive moving parts or
               to move objects along.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The turning disc is connected by a drive belt to an electric motor.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="belt_1.6" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="conveyor-belt#conveyor-belt_1">conveyor belt</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="fan-belt#fan-belt_1">fan belt</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="belt_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>belt</strong> of land or sea is a long, narrow area of it that has some special feature.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Miners in Zambia's northern copper belt have gone on strike.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="belt_1.9" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="bible-belt#bible-belt_1">Bible Belt</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="commuter-belt#commuter-belt_1">commuter belt</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="green-belt#green-belt_1">green belt</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="belt_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>belts</strong> you, they hit you very hard.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  'Is it right she belted old George in the gut?' she asked.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Belt</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Father would give you a belt over the head with the scrubbing brush.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="belt_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>belt</strong> somewhere, you move or travel there very fast.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  We belted down Iveagh Parade to where the motor was.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="belt_1.15" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="belted#belted_1">belted</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="belt_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Something that is <strong>below the belt</strong> is cruel and unfair.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Do you think it's a bit below the belt what they're doing?</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...this kind of below-the-belt discrimination.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="belt_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you have to <strong>tighten</strong> your <strong>belt</strong>, you have to spend less money and manage without things because you have less money
               than you used to have.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Clearly, if you are spending more than your income, you'll need to tighten your belt.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="belt_1.21" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">12. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you have something <strong>under</strong> your <strong>belt</strong>, you have already achieved it or done it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Clare is now a full-time author with six books, including four novels, under her belt.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="belt-out#belt-out_1">belt out</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="bid_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">bid<span cd="yes" class="homnum">1</span><span class="pron">(b<span class="underline"></span>d<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bid1" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/048/04812/04812.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span><span class="lbl misc"> (attempting or offering)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">bids</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bid1" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/048/04826/04826.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">bidding</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bid1" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/048/04818/04818.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div class="semantic">The form <strong>bid</strong> is used in the present tense and is the past tense and past participle.
   </div>
   <div id="bid_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>bid</strong> <strong>for</strong> something or a <strong>bid</strong> <strong>to</strong> do something is an attempt to obtain it or do it.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">journalism</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...Sydney's successful bid for the 2000 Olympic Games.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The Government has already closed down two newspapers in a bid to silence its critics.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bid_1.4" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>bid</strong> is an offer to pay a particular amount of money for something that is being sold.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Hanson made an agreed takeover bid of 351 million.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bid_1.6" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>bid</strong> <strong>for</strong> something or <strong>bid</strong> <strong>to</strong> do something, you try to obtain it or do it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Singapore Airlines is rumoured to be bidding for a management contract to run both
                  airports.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> to-inf]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I don't think she is bidding to be Prime Minister again.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
   </h4>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>bid</strong> <strong>for</strong> something that is being sold, you offer to pay a particular amount of money for it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She decided to bid for a Georgian dressing table.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The bank announced its intention to bid.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He certainly wasn't going to bid $18 billion for this company.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">bidding</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/048/04818/04818.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  The bidding starts at 2 million.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
</div></div>
<div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="bid_2"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">bid<span cd="yes" class="homnum">2</span><span class="pron">(b<span class="underline"></span>d<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bid2" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/048/04812/04812.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span><span class="lbl misc"> (saying something)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">bids</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bid2" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/048/04826/04826.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">bidding</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bid2" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/048/04818/04818.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">bade</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bid2" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/629/62918/62918.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bid2" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/629/62919/62919.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">bidden</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bid2" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/048/04814/04814.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div class="semantic">American English sometimes uses the form <strong>bid</strong> for the past tense.
   </div>
   <div id="bid_2.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>bid</strong> someone farewell, you say goodbye to them. If you <strong>bid</strong> them goodnight, you say goodnight to them.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She bade farewell to her son.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I bade her goodnight.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bid_2.4" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="bidding#bidding_1">bidding</a></span></span></div>

         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>beats</strong> a person <strong>up</strong>, they hit or kick the person many times.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n <span class="smallcaps">P</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Then they actually beat her up as well.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> <span class="smallcaps">P</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The government supporters are beating up anyone they suspect of favouring the demonstrators.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. phrasal verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>beat</strong> <strong>yourself</strong> <strong>up</strong> about something, you worry about it a lot or blame yourself for it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n <span class="smallcaps">P</span> +  <em class="hi">about</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Tell them you don't want to do it any more. Don't beat yourself up about it.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n <span class="smallcaps">P</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I don't beat myself up. I don't deal with things I can't handle.</q></span></li>

</span> ( <span class="infl">beatings-up</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for beating-up" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/042/04269/04269.mp3"></a>
</span>)<span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">countable noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  There had been no violence, no beatings-up until then.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
