    <a id="bitter_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">bitter<span class="pron">(b<span class="underline"></span>t<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bitter" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/050/05073/05073.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">bitterest</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bitter" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/050/05074/05074.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">bitters</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for bitter" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/050/05077/05077.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In a <strong>bitter</strong> argument or conflict, people argue very angrily or fight very fiercely.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the scene of bitter fighting during the Second World War.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a bitter attack on the Government's failure to support manufacturing.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">bitterly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/050/05075/05075.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [usu <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v</span><span class="lbl syntax">, oft <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  Any such thing would be bitterly opposed by most of the world's democracies.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a bitterly fought football match.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">bitterness</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/050/05076/05076.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The rift within the organization reflects the growing bitterness of the dispute.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone is <strong>bitter</strong> after a disappointing experience or after being treated unfairly, they continue to
            feel angry about it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She is said to be very bitter about the way she was sacked.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  His long life was marked by bitter personal and political memories.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">bitterly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/050/05075/05075.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [usu <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v</span><span class="lbl syntax">, oft <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  'And he sure didn't help us,' Grant said bitterly.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the party bureaucrats who bitterly resented their loss of power.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">bitterness</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/050/05076/05076.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  I still feel bitterness and anger towards the person who knocked me down.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>bitter</strong> experience makes you feel very disappointed. You can also use <strong>bitter</strong> to emphasize feelings of disappointment.</span><span class="orth"><q>  I think the decision was a bitter blow from which he never quite recovered.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The statement was greeted with bitter disappointment by many of the other delegates.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">bitterly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/050/05075/05075.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj</span><span class="lbl syntax">, <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  I was bitterly disappointed to have lost yet another race so near the finish.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Bitter</strong> weather, or a <strong>bitter</strong> wind, is extremely cold.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Outside, a bitter east wind was accompanied by flurries of snow.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">bitterly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/050/05075/05075.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  It's been bitterly cold here in Moscow.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="bitter_1.26" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>bitter</strong> taste is sharp, not sweet, and often slightly unpleasant.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The leaves taste rather bitter.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bitter_1.28" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Bitter</strong> is a kind of beer that is light brown in colour.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  ...a pint of bitter.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bitter_1.30" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that you will continue doing something <strong>to the bitter end</strong>, especially something difficult or unpleasant, you are emphasizing that you will
               continue doing it until it is completely finished.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  The guerrillas would fight to the bitter end, he said, in order to achieve their main
                  goal.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="bitter_1.32" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="pill#pill_1">a bitter pill</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>

</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">blowing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for blow1" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/054/05474/05474.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">blew</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for blow1" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/052/05285/05285.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">blown</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for blow1" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/054/05477/05477.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div class="semantic">Please look at categories  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="blow#blow_1"><sup>1</sup>12</a></span></span>- <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="blow#blow_1"><sup>1</sup>18</a></span></span> to see if the expression you are looking for is shown under another headword.
   </div>
   <div id="blow_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When a wind or breeze <strong>blows</strong>, the air moves.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  We woke to find a gale blowing outside.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="blow_1.3" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If the wind <strong>blows</strong> something somewhere or if it <strong>blows</strong> there, the wind moves it there.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n with adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Strong winds blew away most of the dust.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Her cap fell off in the street and blew away.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The bushes and trees were blowing in the wind.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="blow_1.7" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>blow</strong>, you send out a stream of air from your mouth.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Danny rubbed his arms and blew on his fingers to warm them.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Take a deep breath and blow.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="blow_1.10" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>blow</strong> something somewhere, you move it by sending out a stream of air from your mouth.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n with adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He picked up his mug and blew off the steam.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="blow_1.12" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>blow</strong> bubbles or smoke rings, you make them by blowing air out of your mouth through liquid
               or smoke.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He blew a ring of blue smoke.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="blow_1.14" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When a whistle or horn <strong>blows</strong> or someone <strong>blows</strong> it, they make a sound by blowing into it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The whistle blew and the train slid forward.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A guard was blowing his whistle.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="blow_1.17" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>blow</strong> your nose, you force air out of it through your nostrils in order to clear it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He took out a handkerchief and blew his nose.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="blow_1.19" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>blow</strong> something <strong>out</strong>, <strong>off</strong>, or <strong>away</strong> means to remove or destroy it violently with an explosion.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n with adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The can exploded, wrecking the kitchen and bathroom and blowing out windows.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Rival gunmen blew the city to bits.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="blow_1.22" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that something <strong>blows</strong> an event, situation, or argument into a particular extreme state, especially an uncertain
               or unpleasant state, you mean that it causes it to be in that state.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Someone took an inappropriate use of words on my part and tried to blow it into a
                  major controversy.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="blow_1.24" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>blow</strong> a large amount of money, you spend it quickly on luxuries.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  My brother lent me some money and I went and blew the lot.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="blow_1.26" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>blow</strong> a chance or attempt to do something, you make a mistake which wastes the chance or
               causes the attempt to fail.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He has almost certainly blown his chance of touring India this winter.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the high-risk world of real estate, where one careless word could blow a whole
                  deal.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>  <em class="hi">it</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Oh you fool! You've blown it!</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="blow_1.30" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="fullblown#fullblown_1">full-blown</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="overblown#overblown_1">overblown</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="blow_1.31" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="cobweb#cobweb_1">to blow away the cobwebs</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="blow_1.32" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="cover#cover_1">to blow someone's cover</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="blow_1.33" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="hot#hot_1">blow hot and cold</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="blow_1.34" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="kiss#kiss_1">to blow a kiss</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="blow_1.35" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="top#top_1">to blow your top</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="blow_1.36" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="whistle#whistle_1">blow the whistle</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="blow-away#blow-away_1">blow away</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="blow-out#blow-out_1">blow out</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="blow-over#blow-over_1">blow over</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="blow-up#blow-up_1">blow up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="blow_2"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">blow<span class="homnum" cd="yes">2</span><span class="pron">(bl<span class="underline">o</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for blow2" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/054/05464/05464.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span><span class="lbl misc"> (noun uses)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">blows</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for blow2" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/054/05480/05480.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="blow_2.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone receives a <strong>blow</strong>, they are hit with a fist or weapon.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to/on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He went off to hospital after a blow to the face.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="blow_2.3" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something that happens is a <strong>blow</strong> <strong>to</strong> someone or something, it is very upsetting, disappointing, or damaging to them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  That ruling comes as a blow to environmentalists.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His death dealt a severe blow to the army's morale.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="blow_2.6" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If two people or groups <strong>come to blows</strong>, they start fighting.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The representatives almost came to blows at a meeting.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="burnt_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">burnt<span class="pron">(b<span class="underline"></span>nt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for burnt" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07139/07139.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="burnt_1.1" class="hom"><span class="gramGrp"></span><ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Burnt</strong> is a past tense and past participle of  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="burn#burn_1">burn</a></span></span>.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="burn_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">burn<span class="pron">(b<span class="underline"></span>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for burn" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07123/07123.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">burns</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for burn" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07138/07138.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">burning</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for burn" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07132/07132.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">burned</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for burn" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07128/07128.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">burnt</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for burn" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07139/07139.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div class="semantic">The past tense and past participle is <strong>burned</strong> in American English, and <strong>burned</strong> or <strong>burnt</strong> in British English.
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If there is a fire or a flame somewhere, you say that there is a fire or flame <strong>burning</strong> there.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Fires were burning out of control in the center of the city.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  There was a fire burning in the large fireplace.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
   </h4>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>is burning</strong>, it is on fire.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  When I arrived one of the vehicles was still burning.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ing]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  That boy was rescued from a burning house.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">burning</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07132/07132.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  When we arrived in our village there was a terrible smell of burning.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
   </h4>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>burn</strong> something, you destroy or damage it with fire.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Protesters set cars on fire and burned a building.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Coal fell out of the fire, and burned the carpet.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">burning</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07132/07132.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The French government has criticized the burning of a U.S. flag outside the American
               Embassy.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="burn_1.14" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>burn</strong> a fuel or if it <strong>burns</strong>, it is used to produce heat, light, or energy.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The power stations burn coal from the Ruhr region.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Manufacturers are working with new fuels to find one that burns more cleanly than
                  petrol.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
   </h4>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>burn</strong> something that you are cooking or if it <strong>burns</strong>, you spoil it by using too much heat or cooking it for too long.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I burnt the toast.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Watch them carefully as they finish cooking because they can burn easily.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">burnt</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07139/07139.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adjective</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the smell of burnt toast.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="burn_1.22" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>burn</strong> part of your body, <strong>burn</strong> <strong>yourself</strong>, or <strong>are burnt</strong>, you are injured by fire or by something very hot.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Take care not to burn your fingers.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  If you are badly burnt, seek medical attention.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl]</span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Burn</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She suffered appalling burns to her back.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.26" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>is burnt</strong> or <strong>burnt</strong> to death, they are killed by fire.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">as</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Women were burned as witches in the middle ages.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  At least 80 people were burnt to death when their bus caught fire.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.29" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a light <strong>is burning</strong>, it is shining.</span> (<span class="lbl register">literary</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The building was darkened except for a single light burning in a third-story window.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.31" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If your face <strong>is burning</strong>, it is red because you are embarrassed or upset.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Liz's face was burning.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.33" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>are burning</strong> <strong>with</strong> an emotion or <strong>are burning</strong> <strong>to</strong> do something, you feel that emotion or the desire to do that thing very strongly.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The young boy was burning with a fierce ambition.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> to-inf]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Dan burned to know what the reason could be.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.36" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>burn</strong> or get <strong>burned</strong> in the sun, the sun makes your skin become red and sore.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Build up your tan slowly and don't allow your skin to burn.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Summer sun can burn fair skin in minutes.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.39" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">12. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a part of your body <strong>burns</strong> or if something <strong>burns</strong> it, it has a painful, hot or stinging feeling.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  My eyes burn from staring at the needle.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His face was burning with cold.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...delicious Indian recipes which won't burn your throat.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.43" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">13. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>burn</strong> a CD-ROM means to write or copy data onto it.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">computing</span>, <span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  You can use this software to burn custom compilations of your favorite tunes.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.45" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="burning#burning_1">burning</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="burn_1.46" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="candle#candle_1">burn the candle at both ends</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="burn_1.47" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="finger#finger_1">to get your fingers burned</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="burn_1.48" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="ground#ground_1">to burn something to the ground</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="burn_1.49" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="midnight#midnight_1">burn the midnight oil</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="burn_1.50" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="money#money_1">have money to burn</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="burn-down#burn-down_1">burn down</a></span></span></li>
