<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="burn_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">burn<span class="pron">(b<span class="underline"></span>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for burn" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07123/07123.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">burns</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for burn" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07138/07138.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">burning</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for burn" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07132/07132.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">burned</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for burn" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07128/07128.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">burnt</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for burn" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07139/07139.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">The past tense and past participle is <strong>burned</strong> in American English, and <strong>burned</strong> or <strong>burnt</strong> in British English.
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If there is a fire or a flame somewhere, you say that there is a fire or flame <strong>burning</strong> there.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Fires were burning out of control in the center of the city.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  There was a fire burning in the large fireplace.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>is burning</strong>, it is on fire.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  When I arrived one of the vehicles was still burning.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ing]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  That boy was rescued from a burning house.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">burning</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07132/07132.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  When we arrived in our village there was a terrible smell of burning.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>burn</strong> something, you destroy or damage it with fire.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Protesters set cars on fire and burned a building.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Coal fell out of the fire, and burned the carpet.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">burning</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07132/07132.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The French government has criticized the burning of a U.S. flag outside the American
               Embassy.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="burn_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>burn</strong> a fuel or if it <strong>burns</strong>, it is used to produce heat, light, or energy.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The power stations burn coal from the Ruhr region.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Manufacturers are working with new fuels to find one that burns more cleanly than
                  petrol.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>burn</strong> something that you are cooking or if it <strong>burns</strong>, you spoil it by using too much heat or cooking it for too long.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I burnt the toast.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Watch them carefully as they finish cooking because they can burn easily.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">burnt</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/071/07139/07139.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adjective</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the smell of burnt toast.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="burn_1.22" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>burn</strong> part of your body, <strong>burn</strong> <strong>yourself</strong>, or <strong>are burnt</strong>, you are injured by fire or by something very hot.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Take care not to burn your fingers.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  If you are badly burnt, seek medical attention.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl]</span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Burn</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She suffered appalling burns to her back.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.26" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>is burnt</strong> or <strong>burnt</strong> to death, they are killed by fire.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">as</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Women were burned as witches in the middle ages.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  At least 80 people were burnt to death when their bus caught fire.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.29" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a light <strong>is burning</strong>, it is shining.</span> (<span class="lbl register">literary</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The building was darkened except for a single light burning in a third-story window.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.31" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If your face <strong>is burning</strong>, it is red because you are embarrassed or upset.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Liz's face was burning.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.33" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>are burning</strong> <strong>with</strong> an emotion or <strong>are burning</strong> <strong>to</strong> do something, you feel that emotion or the desire to do that thing very strongly.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The young boy was burning with a fierce ambition.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> to-inf]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Dan burned to know what the reason could be.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.36" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>burn</strong> or get <strong>burned</strong> in the sun, the sun makes your skin become red and sore.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Build up your tan slowly and don't allow your skin to burn.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Summer sun can burn fair skin in minutes.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.39" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">12. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a part of your body <strong>burns</strong> or if something <strong>burns</strong> it, it has a painful, hot or stinging feeling.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  My eyes burn from staring at the needle.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His face was burning with cold.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...delicious Indian recipes which won't burn your throat.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.43" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">13. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>burn</strong> a CD-ROM means to write or copy data onto it.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">computing</span>, <span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  You can use this software to burn custom compilations of your favorite tunes.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="burn_1.45" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="burning#burning_1">burning</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="burn_1.46" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="candle#candle_1">burn the candle at both ends</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="burn_1.47" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="finger#finger_1">to get your fingers burned</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="burn_1.48" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="ground#ground_1">to burn something to the ground</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="burn_1.49" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="midnight#midnight_1">burn the midnight oil</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="burn_1.50" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="money#money_1">have money to burn</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="burn-down#burn-down_1">burn down</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="burn-off#burn-off_1">burn off</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="burn-out#burn-out_1">burn out</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="burn-up#burn-up_1">burn up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="cardboard_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">cardboard<span class="pron">(k<span class="underline"></span>dbd<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for cardboard" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/078/07893/07893.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="cardboard_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Cardboard</strong> is thick, stiff paper that is used, for example, to make boxes and models.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a cardboard box.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a life-size cardboard cut-out of a police officer.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="rug_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">rug<span class="pron">(r<span class="underline"></span>g<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rug" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/474/47439/47439.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">rugs</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rug" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/474/47445/47445.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="rug_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>rug</strong> is a piece of thick material that you put on a floor. It is like a carpet but covers
               a smaller area.</span><span class="orth"><q>  A Persian rug covered the hardwood floors.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rug_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>rug</strong> is a small blanket which you use to cover your shoulders or your knees to keep them
               warm.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">mainly British</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  The old lady was seated in her chair at the window, a rug over her knees.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rug_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>pulls the rug from under</strong> a person or thing or <strong>pulls the rug from under</strong> someone's <strong>feet</strong>, they stop giving their help or support.</span><span class="orth"><q>  If the banks opt to pull the rug from under the ill-fated project, it will go into
                  liquidation.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rug_1.7" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="sweep#sweep_1">to sweep something under the rug</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="cap_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">cap<span class="pron">(k<span class="underline"></span>p<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for cap" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/077/07743/07743.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">caps</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for cap" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/077/07796/07796.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">capping</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for cap" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/077/07787/07787.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">capped</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for cap" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/077/07786/07786.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="cap_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>cap</strong> is a soft, flat hat with a curved part at the front which is called a peak. Caps
               are usually worn by men and boys.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a dark-blue baseball cap.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cap_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>cap</strong> is a special hat which is worn as part of a uniform.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a frontier guard in olive-grey uniform and a peaked cap.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cap_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a sports player <strong>is capped</strong>, they are chosen to represent their country in a team game such as football, rugby,
               or cricket.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Rees, 32, has been capped for England 23 times.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...England's most capped rugby union player.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cap_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a sports player represents their country in a team game such as football, rugby,
               or cricket, you can say that they have been awarded a <strong>cap</strong>.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Mark Davis will win his first cap for Wales in Sunday's Test match against Australia.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cap_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If the government <strong>caps</strong> an organization, council, or budget, it limits the amount of money that the organization
               or council is allowed to spend, or limits the size of the budget.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The Secretary of State for Environment has the power to cap councils which spend excessively.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cap_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>cap</strong> of a bottle is its lid.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She unscrewed the cap of her water bottle and gave him a drink.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cap_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>cap</strong> is a circular rubber device that a woman places inside her vagina to prevent herself
               from becoming pregnant.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>)
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cap_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone says that a good or bad event <strong>caps</strong> a series of events, they mean it is the final event in the series, and the other
               events were also good or bad.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">journalism</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The unrest capped a weekend of right-wing attacks on foreigners.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cap_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone's teeth <strong>are capped</strong>, covers are fixed over them so that they look better.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He suddenly smiled, revealing teeth that had recently been capped.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">have</em> n <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I had my teeth capped.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cap_1.20" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="ice-cap#ice-cap_1">ice cap</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="capable_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">capable<span class="pron">(k<span class="underline">e</span>pb<sup></sup>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for capable" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/077/07746/07746.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="capable_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a person or thing is <strong>capable of</strong> doing something, they have the ability to do it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He appeared hardly capable of conducting a coherent conversation.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The kitchen is capable of catering for several hundred people.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone who is <strong>capable</strong> has the skill or qualities necessary to do a particular thing well, or is able to
            do most things well.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She's a very capable speaker.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Her husband was such a fine, capable man.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">capably</span> <span class="orth"><span class="pron">(k<span class="underline">e</span>pbli<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/077/07747/07747.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  Happily it was all dealt with very capably by the police and security people.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="carpet_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">carpet<span class="pron">(k<span class="underline"></span>pt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for carpet" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/080/08000/08000.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">carpets</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for carpet" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/080/08008/08008.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">carpeting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for carpet" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/080/08007/08007.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">carpeted</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for carpet" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/080/08006/08006.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="carpet_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>carpet</strong> is a thick covering of soft material which is laid over a floor or a staircase.</span><span class="orth"><q>  They put down wooden boards, and laid new carpets on top.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the stain on our living-room carpet.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="carpet_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a floor or a room <strong>is carpeted</strong>, a carpet is laid on the floor.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The room had been carpeted and the windows glazed with coloured glass.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The main gaming room was thickly carpeted.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="carpet_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>carpet</strong> <strong>of</strong> something such as leaves or plants is a layer of them which covers the ground.</span> (<span class="lbl register">literary</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The carpet of leaves in my yard became more and more noticeable.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="carpet_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If the ground <strong>is carpeted</strong> <strong>with</strong> something such as leaves or plants, it is completely covered by them.</span> (<span class="lbl register">literary</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The ground was thickly carpeted with pine needles.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="carpet_1.11" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="carpeting#carpeting_1">carpeting</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="red-carpet#red-carpet_1">red carpet</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="carpet_1.12" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="sweep#sweep_1">to sweep something under the carpet</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="cheek_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">cheek<span class="pron">(t<span class="underline">i</span>k<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for cheek" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/089/08941/08941.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">cheeks</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for cheek" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/089/08948/08948.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Your <strong>cheeks</strong> are the sides of your face below your eyes.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Tears were running down her cheeks.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  She kissed him lightly on both cheeks.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">-cheeked</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/089/08944/08944.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">combining form</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...rosy-cheeked children.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="cheek_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You say that someone has a <strong>cheek</strong> when you are annoyed or shocked at something unreasonable that they have done.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  I'm amazed they had the cheek to ask in the first place.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  I still think it's a bit of a cheek sending a voucher rather than a refund.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The cheek of it, lying to me like that!</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cheek_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>turn the other cheek</strong> when someone harms or insults you, you do not harm or insult them in return.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cheek_1.11" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="jowl#jowl_1">cheek by jowl</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="chamber_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">chamber<span class="pron">(t<span class="underline">e</span>mb<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for chamber" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/086/08660/08660.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">chambers</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for chamber" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/086/08671/08671.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="chamber_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>chamber</strong> is a large room, especially one that is used for formal meetings.</span><span class="orth"><q>  We are going to make sure we are in the council chamber every time he speaks.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="chamber_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can refer to a country's parliament or to one section of it as a <strong>chamber</strong>.</span><span class="orth"><q>  More than 80 parties are contesting seats in the two-chamber parliament.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Signor Amato's government has only a 16-seat majority in the Chamber of Deputies.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="chamber_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>chamber</strong> is a room designed and equipped for a particular purpose.</span><span class="orth"><q>  For many, the dentist's surgery remains a torture chamber.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="chamber_1.8" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="gas-chamber#gas-chamber_1">gas chamber</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="cast_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">cast<span class="pron">(k<span class="underline"></span>st<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for cast" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/081/08144/08144.mp3"></a>
</span></span><span class="pron">; k<span class="underline"></span>st)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">casts</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for cast" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/081/08182/08182.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">casting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for cast" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/081/08164/08164.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">The form <strong>cast</strong> is used in the present tense and is the past tense and past participle.
   </div>
   <div id="cast_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>cast</strong> of a play or film is all the people who act in it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The show is very amusing and the cast are very good.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>cast</strong> an actor <strong>in</strong> a play or film means to choose them to act a particular role in it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">in/as</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The world premiere of Harold Pinter's new play casts Ian Holm in the lead role.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">as</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He was cast as a college professor.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He had no trouble casting the movie.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">casting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/081/08164/08164.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">N</span> n]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the casting director of Ealing film studios.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="cast_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>cast</strong> someone <strong>in</strong> a particular way or <strong>as</strong> a particular thing means to describe them in that way or suggest they are that thing.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">as</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Democrats have been worried about being cast as the party of the poor.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl +  <em class="hi">as</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Holland would never dare cast himself as a virtuoso pianist.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also +  <em class="hi">in</em>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cast_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>cast</strong> your eyes or <strong>cast</strong> a look in a particular direction, you look quickly in that direction.</span> (<span class="lbl register">written</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He cast a stern glance at the two men.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I cast my eyes down briefly.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The maid, casting black looks, hurried out.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n n]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cast_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>casts</strong> a light or shadow somewhere, it causes it to appear there.</span> (<span class="lbl register">written</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The moon cast a bright light over the yard.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They flew in over the beach, casting a huge shadow.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cast_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>cast</strong> doubt <strong>on</strong> something means to cause people to be unsure about it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Last night a top criminal psychologist cast doubt on the theory.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cast_1.21" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>cast</strong> your vote in an election, you vote.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  About ninety-five per cent of those who cast their votes approve the new constitution.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Gaviria had been widely expected to obtain well over half the votes cast.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cast_1.24" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>cast</strong> something or someone somewhere means to throw them there.</span> (<span class="lbl register">literary</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Any true lover casting a pin into the fountain and gazing into it will see his or
                  her future partner.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">have</em> n <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  John had Maude and her son cast into a dungeon.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cast_1.27" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>cast</strong> an object means to make it by pouring a liquid such as hot metal into a specially
               shaped container and leaving it there until it becomes hard.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">in</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...sculptures cast in bronze.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n  <em class="hi">in</em> n, <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cast_1.29" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>cast</strong> is a model that has been made by pouring a liquid such as plaster or hot metal onto
               something or into something, so that when it hardens it has the same shape as that
               thing.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  An orthodontist took a cast of the inside of Billy's mouth.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cast_1.31" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">

      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cast_1.32" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="casting#casting_1">casting</a></span></span></div>

</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">ceilings</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for ceiling" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/084/08420/08420.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="ceiling_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>ceiling</strong> is the horizontal surface that forms the top part or roof inside a room.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The rooms were spacious, with tall windows and high ceilings.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The study was lined from floor to ceiling on every wall with bookcases.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="ceiling_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>

         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>ceiling</strong> <strong>on</strong> something such as prices or wages is an official upper limit that cannot be broken.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...an informal agreement to put a ceiling on salaries.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The agreement sets the ceiling of twenty-two-point-five million barrels a day on OPEC
                  production.</q></span></li>

    <a id="commission_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">commission<span class="pron">(km<span class="underline"></span><sup></sup>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for commission" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/107/10775/10775.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">commissions</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for commission" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/107/10781/10781.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">commissioning</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for commission" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/107/10780/10780.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">commissioned</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for commission" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/107/10777/10777.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="commission_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>commission</strong> something or <strong>commission</strong> someone <strong>to</strong> do something, you formally arrange for someone to do a piece of work for you.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The Ministry of Agriculture commissioned a study into low-input farming.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n to-inf]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  You can commission them to paint something especially for you.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...specially commissioned reports.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Commission</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He approached John Wexley with a commission to write the screenplay of the film.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="commission_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>commission</strong> is a piece of work that someone is asked to do and is paid for.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Just a few days ago, I finished a commission.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="commission_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Commission</strong> is a sum of money paid to a salesperson for every sale that he or she makes. If a
               salesperson is paid <strong>on</strong> <strong>commission</strong>, the amount they receive depends on the amount they sell.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The salesmen work on commission only.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  He also got a commission for bringing in new clients.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="commission_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a bank or other company charges <strong>commission</strong>, they charge a fee for providing a service, for example for exchanging money or issuing
               an insurance policy.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">business</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  Sellers pay a fixed commission fee.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="commission_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>commission</strong> is a group of people who have been appointed to find out about something or to control
               something.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The authorities have been asked to set up a commission to investigate the murders.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the Press Complaints Commission.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="commission_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a member of the armed forces receives a <strong>commission</strong>, he or she becomes an officer.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">as</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He accepted a commission as a naval officer.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="commission_1.18" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something, for example a ship or a piece of equipment, is <strong>out of commission</strong>, it is broken and cannot be used until it is repaired.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The operator expects the ship to be out of commission until the end of September.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="commission_1.20" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="high-commission#high-commission_1">High Commission</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>

<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="committee_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>committee</strong> is a group of people who meet to make decisions or plans for a larger group or organization
               that they represent.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a committee of ministers.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...an elected Management Committee who serve the Association on a voluntary basis.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

    <a id="commitment_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">commitment<span class="pron">(km<span class="underline"></span>tmnt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for commitment" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/107/10783/10783.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">commitments</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for commitment" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/107/10784/10784.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="commitment_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Commitment</strong> is a strong belief in an idea or system.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...commitment to the ideals of Bolshevism.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="commitment_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>commitment</strong> is something which regularly takes up some of your time because of an agreement you
               have made or because of responsibilities that you have.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Work commitments forced her to uproot herself and her son from Reykjavik.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="commitment_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you make a <strong>commitment</strong> <strong>to</strong> do something, you promise that you will do it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  We made a commitment to keep working together.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They made a commitment to peace.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="commitment_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Commitment</strong> is the process of officially sending someone to a prison or to hospital.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">US</span>)
            <div class="semantic">in BRIT, use <strong>committal</strong></div>
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
