    <a id="collapse_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">collapse<span class="pron">(kl<span class="underline"></span>ps<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for collapse" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/104/10415/10415.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">collapses</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for collapse" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/104/10417/10417.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">collapsing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for collapse" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/104/10419/10419.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">collapsed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for collapse" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/104/10416/10416.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="collapse_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a building or other structure <strong>collapses</strong>, it falls down very suddenly.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A section of the Bay Bridge had collapsed.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ing]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Most of the deaths were caused by landslides and collapsing buildings.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Collapse</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Governor Deukmejian called for an inquiry into the freeway's collapse.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="collapse_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something, for example a system or institution, <strong>collapses</strong>, it fails or comes to an end completely and suddenly.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His business empire collapsed under a massive burden of debt.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ing]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The rural people have been impoverished by a collapsing economy.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Collapse</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The coup's collapse has speeded up the drive to independence.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Their economy is teetering on the brink of collapse.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="collapse_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>collapse</strong>, you suddenly faint or fall down because you are very ill or weak.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He collapsed following a vigorous exercise session at his home.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Collapse</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  A few days after his collapse he was sitting up in bed.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="collapse_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>collapse</strong> onto something, you sit or lie down suddenly because you are very tired.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She arrived home exhausted and barely capable of showering before collapsing on her
                  bed.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="commit_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">commit<span class="pron">(km<span class="underline"></span>t<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for commit" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/107/10782/10782.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">commits</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for commit" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/107/10785/10785.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">committing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for commit" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/107/10791/10791.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">committed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for commit" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/107/10788/10788.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="commit_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>commits</strong> a crime or a sin, they do something illegal or bad.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I have never committed any crime.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  This is a man who has committed murder.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="commit_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>commits</strong> <strong>suicide</strong>, they deliberately kill themselves.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  There are unconfirmed reports he tried to commit suicide.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="commit_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>commit</strong> money or resources <strong>to</strong> something, you decide to use them for a particular purpose.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to/for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They called on Western nations to commit more money to the poorest nations.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He should not commit American troops without the full consent of Congress.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>commit</strong> <strong>yourself to</strong> something, you say that you will definitely do it. If you <strong>commit</strong> <strong>yourself to</strong> someone, you decide that you want to have a long-term relationship with them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I would advise people to think very carefully about committing themselves to working
               Sundays.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I'd like a friendship that might lead to something deeper, but I wouldn't want to
               commit myself too soon.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  You don't have to commit to anything over the phone.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">committed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/107/10788/10788.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adjective</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He said the government remained committed to peace.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a committed socialist.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="commit_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you do not want to <strong>commit</strong> <strong>yourself on</strong> something, you do not want to say what you really think about it or what you are
               going to do.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  It isn't their diplomatic style to commit themselves on such a delicate issue.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She didn't want to commit herself one way or the other.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="commit_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>is committed</strong> <strong>to</strong> a hospital, prison, or other institution, they are officially sent there for a period
               of time.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Arthur's drinking caused him to be committed to a psychiatric hospital.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also  <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="commit_1.21" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In the British legal system, if someone <strong>is committed for trial</strong>, they are sent by magistrates to stand trial in a crown court.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He is expected to be committed for trial at Liverpool Crown Court.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="commit_1.23" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>commit</strong> something <strong>to</strong> paper or <strong>to</strong> writing, you record it by writing it down. If you <strong>commit</strong> something <strong>to</strong> memory, you learn it so that you will remember it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She had not committed anything to paper about it.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I'll repeat that so you can commit it to memory.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="concern_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">concern<span class="pron">(kns<span class="underline"></span>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for concern" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/111/11151/11151.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">concerns</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for concern" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/111/11154/11154.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">concerning</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for concern" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/111/11153/11153.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">concerned</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for concern" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/111/11152/11152.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="concern_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Concern</strong> is worry about a situation.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">about</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The group has expressed concern about reports of political violence in Africa.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">over</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The move follows growing public concern over the spread of the disease.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  There is no cause for concern.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>concerns</strong> you, it worries you.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The growing number of people seeking refuge in Thailand is beginning to concern Western
               aid agencies.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n that]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  It concerned her that Bess was developing a crush on Max.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">concerned</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/111/11152/11152.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adjective</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [usu v-link <span class="smallcaps">ADJ</span></span><span class="lbl syntax">, <span class="smallcaps">ADJ</span> that]</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  We're naturally concerned for our daughter's safety.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Academics and employers are deeply concerned that students are not sufficiently prepared
               mathematically for university courses.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a phone call from a concerned neighbor.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also +  <em class="hi">about</em>]</span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="concern_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>concern</strong> is a fact or situation that worries you.</span><span class="orth"><q>  His concern was that people would know that he was responsible.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Unemployment was the electorate's main concern.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="concern_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone's <strong>concern</strong> <strong>with</strong> something is their feeling that it is important.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a story that illustrates how dangerous excessive concern with safety can be.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="concern_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone's <strong>concerns</strong> are the things that they consider to be important.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Feminism must address issues beyond the concerns of middle-class whites.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="concern_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Concern</strong> <strong>for</strong> someone is a feeling that you want them to be happy, safe, and well. If you do something
               out of <strong>concern</strong> <strong>for</strong> someone, you do it because you want them to be happy, safe, and well.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Without her care and concern, he had no chance at all.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He had only gone along out of concern for his two grandsons.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>concern</strong> <strong>yourself with</strong> something, you give it attention because you think that it is important.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I didn't concern myself with politics.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">concerned</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/111/11152/11152.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adjective</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [v-link <span class="smallcaps">ADJ</span>  <em class="hi">with</em> n]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  The agency is more concerned with making arty ads than understanding its clients'
               businesses.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something such as a book or a piece of information <strong>concerns</strong> a particular subject, it is about that subject.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The bulk of the book concerns Sandy's two middle-aged children.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Chapter 2 concerns itself with the methodological difficulties.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">concerned</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/111/11152/11152.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adjective</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [v-link <span class="smallcaps">ADJ</span>  <em class="hi">with</em> n]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  Randolph's work was exclusively concerned with the effects of pollution on health.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a situation, event, or activity <strong>concerns</strong> you, it affects or involves you.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  It was just a little unfinished business from my past, and it doesn't concern you
               at all.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">concerned</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/111/11152/11152.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adjective</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [n <span class="smallcaps">ADJ</span>]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  It's a very stressful situation for everyone concerned.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">in</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I believe he was concerned in all those matters you mention.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="concern_1.36" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a situation or problem is your <strong>concern</strong>, it is something that you have a duty or responsibility to be involved with.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The technical aspects were the concern of the Army.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  I would be glad to get rid of them myself. But that is not our concern.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="concern_1.39" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can refer to a company or business as a <strong>concern</strong>, usually when you are describing what type of company or business it is.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>, <span class="lbl subj">business</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  If not a large concern, Queensbury Nursery was at least a successful one.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="concern_1.41" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">12. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can say '<strong>as far as</strong> I'm <strong>concerned</strong>' to indicate that you are giving your own opinion.</span><span class="orth"><q>  As far as I'm concerned the officials incited the fight.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="concern_1.43" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">13. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can say <strong>as far as</strong> something <strong>is concerned</strong> to indicate the subject that you are talking about.</span><span class="orth"><q>  As far as starting a family is concerned, the trend is for women having their children
                  later in life.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="concern_1.45" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">14. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a company is a <strong>going concern</strong>, it is actually doing business, rather than having stopped trading or not yet having
               started trading.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">business</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  The receivers will always prefer to sell a business as a going concern.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="concern_1.47" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">15. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something is <strong>of concern</strong> <strong>to</strong> someone, they find it worrying and unsatisfactory.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Any injury to a child is a cause of great concern to us.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The survey's findings are a matter of great concern.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="concern_1.50" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">16. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something is <strong>of concern</strong> <strong>to</strong> you, it is important to you.</span><span class="orth"><q>  How they are paid should be of little concern to the bank as long as they are paid.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="concert_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">concert<span class="pron">(k<span class="underline"></span>nst<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for concert" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/111/11155/11155.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">concerts</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for concert" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/111/11165/11165.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="concert_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>concert</strong> is a performance of music.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a short concert of piano music.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  I've been to plenty of live rock concerts.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a new concert hall.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="concert_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a musician or group of musicians appears <strong>in concert</strong>, they are giving a live performance.</span><span class="orth"><q>  I want people to remember Elvis in concert.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="congress_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">congress<span class="pron">(k<span class="underline"></span>gres<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for congress" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/114/11435/11435.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">congresses</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for congress" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/114/11436/11436.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="congress_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>congress</strong> is a large meeting that is held to discuss ideas and policies.</span><span class="orth"><q>  A lot has changed after the party congress.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="congress_2"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">Congress<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/114/11434/11434.mp3"></a>
</span></h2>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="congress_2.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">proper noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Congress</strong> is the elected group of politicians that is responsible for making the law in the
               United States. It consists of two parts: the House of Representatives and the Senate.</span><span class="orth"><q>  We want to cooperate with both the administration and Congress.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="conventional_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">conventional<span class="pron">(knv<span class="underline">e</span>nn<sup></sup>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for conventional" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/119/11955/11955.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone who is <strong>conventional</strong> has behaviour or opinions that are ordinary and normal.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a respectable married woman with conventional opinions.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">conventionally</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/119/11956/11956.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [usu <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  People still wore their hair short and dressed conventionally.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>conventional</strong> method or product is one that is usually used or that has been in use for a long
            time.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the risks and drawbacks of conventional family planning methods.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  These discs hold more than 400 times as much information as a conventional computer
               floppy disk.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">conventionally</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/119/11956/11956.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  Organically-grown produce does not differ greatly in appearance from conventionally-grown
               crops.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="conventional_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Conventional</strong> weapons and wars do not involve nuclear explosives.</span><span class="orth"><q>  We must reduce the danger of war by controlling nuclear, chemical and conventional
                  arms.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="conventional_1.12" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="wisdom#wisdom_1">conventional wisdom</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="confine_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">confine<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/113/11343/11343.mp3"></a>
</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">confines</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">confining</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for confine" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/113/11348/11348.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">confined</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for confine" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/113/11344/11344.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">The verb is pronounced <span class="pron">(knf<span class="underline">a</span>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/636/63666/63666.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span>. The noun <strong>confines</strong> is pronounced <span class="pron">(k<span class="underline"></span>nfanz<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/636/63667/63667.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span>.
   </div>
   <div id="confine_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>confine</strong> something <strong>to</strong> a particular place or group means to prevent it from spreading beyond that place
               or group.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Health officials have successfully confined the epidemic to the Tabatinga area.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The U.S. will soon be taking steps to confine the conflict.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="confine_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>confine</strong> <strong>yourself</strong> or your activities <strong>to</strong> something, you do only that thing and are involved with nothing else.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He did not confine himself to the one language.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His genius was not confined to the decoration of buildings.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="confine_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>is confined to</strong> a mental institution, prison, or other place, they are sent there and are not allowed
               to leave for a period of time.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The woman will be confined to a mental institution.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="confine_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. plural noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Something that is within the <strong>confines</strong> <strong>of</strong> an area or place is within the boundaries enclosing it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The movie is set entirely within the confines of the abandoned factory.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="confine_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. plural noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>confines</strong> <strong>of</strong> a situation, system, or activity are the limits or restrictions it involves.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...away from the confines of the British class system.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I can't stand the confines of this marriage.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="convention_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">convention<span class="pron">(knv<span class="underline">e</span>n<sup></sup>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for convention" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/119/11954/11954.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">conventions</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for convention" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/119/11959/11959.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="convention_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>convention</strong> is a way of behaving that is considered to be correct or polite by most people in
               a society.</span><span class="orth"><q>  It's just a social convention that men don't wear skirts.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Despite her wish to defy convention, she had become pregnant and married at 21.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="convention_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In art, literature, or the theatre, a <strong>convention</strong> is a traditional method or style.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the stylistic conventions of Egyptian art.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="convention_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>convention</strong> is an official agreement between countries or groups of people.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the U.N. convention on climate change.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the Geneva convention.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="convention_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>convention</strong> is a large meeting of an organization or political group.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the annual convention of the Society of Professional Journalists.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the Republican convention.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="conscious_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">conscious<span class="pron">(k<span class="underline"></span>ns<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for conscious" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/115/11531/11531.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="conscious_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are <strong>conscious</strong> <strong>of</strong> something, you notice it or realize that it is happening.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She was very conscious of Max studying her.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Conscious that he was becoming light-headed again, he went over to the window.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="conscious_1.4" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are <strong>conscious</strong> <strong>of</strong> something, you think about it a lot, especially because you are unhappy about it
               or because you think it is important.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I'm very conscious of my weight.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
   </h4>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>conscious</strong> decision or action is made or done deliberately with you giving your full attention
            to it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  I don't think we ever made a conscious decision to have a big family.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Make a conscious effort to relax your muscles.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">consciously</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/115/11532/11532.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  Sophie was not consciously seeking a replacement after her father died.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="conscious_1.11" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. adjective</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone who is <strong>conscious</strong> is awake rather than asleep or unconscious.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She was fully conscious all the time and knew what was going on.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. adjective</span> 
   </h4>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Conscious</strong> memories or thoughts are ones that you are aware of.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He had no conscious memory of his four-week stay in hospital.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">consciously</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/115/11532/11532.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v</span><span class="lbl syntax">, <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  Most people cannot consciously remember much before the ages of 5 to 7 years.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
</div></div>
<div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="conscious_2"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">-conscious<span class="pron">(k<span class="underline"></span>ns<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for -conscious" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/115/11530/11530.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="conscious_2.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">combining form</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>-conscious</strong> combines with words such as 'health', 'fashion', 'politically', and 'environmentally'
               to form adjectives which describe someone who believes that the aspect of life indicated
               is important.</span><span class="orth"><q>  We're all becoming increasingly health-conscious these days.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="contrast_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">contrast</h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">contrasts</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">contrasting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for contrast" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/118/11880/11880.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">contrasted</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for contrast" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/118/11879/11879.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">The noun is pronounced <span class="pron">(k<span class="underline"></span>ntrst<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/637/63706/63706.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span><span class="pron">(-trst)</span>. The verb is pronounced <span class="pron">(kntr<span class="underline"></span>st<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/637/63708/63708.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span><span class="pron">(-tr<span class="underline"></span>st)</span>.
   </div>
   <div id="contrast_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>contrast</strong> is a great difference between two or more things which is clear when you compare
               them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">between</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the contrast between town and country.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The two visitors provided a startling contrast in appearance.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Silk was used with wool for contrast.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="contrast_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You say <strong>by contrast</strong> or <strong>in contrast</strong>, or <strong>in contrast to</strong> something, to show that you are mentioning a very different situation from the one
               you have just mentioned.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The private sector, by contrast, has plenty of money to spend.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  In contrast, the lives of girls in well-to-do families were often very sheltered.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  In contrast to similar services in France and Germany, Intercity rolling stock is
                  very rarely idle.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="contrast_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If one thing is <strong>in contrast</strong> <strong>to</strong> another, it is very different from it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  His public statements have always been in marked contrast to those of his son.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="contrast_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If one thing is a <strong>contrast</strong> <strong>to</strong> another, it is very different from it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The boy's room is a complete contrast to the guest room.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a country of great contrasts.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="contrast_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>contrast</strong> one thing <strong>with</strong> another, you point out or consider the differences between those things.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She contrasted the situation then with the present crisis.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  In this section we contrast four possible broad approaches.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="contrast_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If one thing <strong>contrasts</strong> <strong>with</strong> another, it is very different from it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Johnson's easy charm contrasted sharply with the prickliness of his boss.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ing]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Paint the wall in a contrasting colour.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="contrast_1.20" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Contrast</strong> is the degree of difference between the darker and lighter parts of a photograph,
               television picture, or painting.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="cracked_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">cracked<span class="pron">(kr<span class="underline"></span>kt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for cracked" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/127/12756/12756.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="cracked_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An object that is <strong>cracked</strong> has lines on its surface because it is damaged.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The ceiling was grey and cracked.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a cracked mirror.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="cracked_1.4" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>cracked</strong> voice or a <strong>cracked</strong> musical note sounds rough and unsteady.</span><span class="orth"><q>  When he spoke, his voice was hoarse and cracked.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="crack_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">crack<span class="homnum" cd="yes">1</span><span class="pron">(kr<span class="underline"></span>k<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for crack1" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/127/12749/12749.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span><span class="lbl misc"> (verb uses)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">cracks</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for crack1" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/127/12767/12767.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">cracking</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for crack1" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/127/12759/12759.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">cracked</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for crack1" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/127/12756/12756.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="crack_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something hard <strong>cracks</strong>, or if you <strong>crack</strong> it, it becomes slightly damaged, with lines appearing on its surface.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A gas main had cracked under my neighbour's garage and gas had seeped into our homes.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Remove the dish from the oven, crack the salt crust and you will find the skin just
                  peels off the fish.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="crack_1.4" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>cracks</strong>, or if you <strong>crack</strong> it, it makes a sharp sound like the sound of a piece of wood breaking.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Thunder cracked in the sky.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He cracked his fingers nervously.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="crack_1.7" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>crack</strong> a hard part of your body, such as your knee or your head, you hurt it by accidentally
               hitting it hard against something.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He cracked his head on the pavement and was knocked cold.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="crack_1.9" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>crack</strong> something that has a shell, such as an egg or a nut, you break the shell in order
               to reach the inside part.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Crack the eggs into a bowl.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="crack_1.11" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>crack</strong> a problem or a code, you solve it, especially after a lot of thought.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He has finally cracked the system after years of painstaking research.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="crack_1.13" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>cracks</strong>, they lose control of their emotions or actions because they are under a lot of pressure.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She's calm and strong, and she is just not going to crack.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="crack_1.15" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If your voice <strong>cracks</strong> when you are speaking or singing, it changes in pitch because you are feeling a strong
               emotion.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Her voice cracked and she began to cry.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="crack_1.17" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>crack</strong> a joke, you tell it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He cracked jokes and talked about beer and girls.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="crack_1.19" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="cracked#cracked_1">cracked</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="cracking#cracking_1">cracking</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="crack_1.20" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that something is <strong>not all it's cracked up to be</strong>, you mean that it is not as good as other people have said it is.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  Package holidays are not always all they're cracked up to be.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="crack-down#crack-down_1">crack down</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="crack-on#crack-on_1">crack on</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="crack-up#crack-up_1">crack up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>

      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>criterion</strong> is a factor on which you judge or decide something.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The most important criterion for entry is that applicants must design and make their

    <a id="crush_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">crush<span class="pron">(kr<span class="underline"></span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for crush" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/133/13343/13343.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">crushes</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for crush" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/133/13347/13347.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">crushing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for crush" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/133/13348/13348.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">crushed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for crush" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/133/13344/13344.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="crush_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>crush</strong> something means to press it very hard so that its shape is destroyed or so that it
               breaks into pieces.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Andrew crushed his empty can.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Peel and crush the garlic.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...crushed ice.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>crush</strong> a protest or movement, or a group of opponents, means to defeat it completely, usually
            by force.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The military operation was the first step in a plan to crush the uprising.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">crushing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/133/13348/13348.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the violent crushing of anti-government demonstrations.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="crush_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>are crushed</strong> by something, it upsets you a great deal.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Listen to criticism but don't be crushed by it.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="crush_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>are crushed</strong> against someone or something, you are pushed or pressed against them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  We were at the front, crushed against the stage.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="crush_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>crush</strong> is a crowd of people close together, in which it is difficult to move.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Franklin and his thirteen-year-old son somehow got separated in the crush.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="crush_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you have a <strong>crush</strong> <strong>on</strong> someone, you are in love with them but do not have a relationship with them.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She had a crush on you, you know.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

    <a id="curb_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">curb<span class="pron">(k<span class="underline"></span>b<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for curb" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/135/13522/13522.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">curbs</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for curb" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/135/13525/13525.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">curbing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for curb" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/135/13524/13524.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">curbed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for curb" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/135/13523/13523.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="curb_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>curb</strong> something, you control it and keep it within limits.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...advertisements aimed at curbing the spread of Aids.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Inflation needs to be curbed in Russia.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Curb</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He called for much stricter curbs on immigration.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="curb_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>curb</strong> an emotion or your behaviour, you keep it under control.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He curbed his temper.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="curb_1.7" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="kerb#kerb_1">kerb</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>

    <a id="curl_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">curl<span class="pron">(k<span class="underline"></span>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for curl" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/135/13546/13546.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">curls</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for curl" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/135/13558/13558.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">curling</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for curl" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/135/13557/13557.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">curled</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for curl" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/135/13548/13548.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="curl_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you have <strong>curls</strong>, your hair is in the form of tight curves and spirals.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the little girl with blonde curls.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="curl_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If your hair has <strong>curl</strong>, it is full of curls.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Dry curly hair naturally for maximum curl and shine.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="curl_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If your hair <strong>curls</strong> or if you <strong>curl</strong> it, it is full of curls.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She has hair that refuses to curl.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Maria had curled her hair for the event.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Afro hair is short and tightly curled.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="curl_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>curl</strong> <strong>of</strong> something is a piece or quantity of it that is curved or spiral in shape.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A thin curl of smoke rose from a rusty stove.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...curls of lemon peel.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="curl_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If your toes, fingers, or other parts of your body <strong>curl</strong>, or if you <strong>curl</strong> them, they form a curved or round shape.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His fingers curled gently round her wrist.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Raise one foot, curl the toes and point the foot downwards.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She sat with her legs curled under her.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span></span><span class="lbl syntax">, <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="curl_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>curls</strong> somewhere, or if you <strong>curl</strong> it there, it moves there in a spiral or curve.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Smoke was curling up the chimney.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He curled the ball into the net.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="curl_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a person or animal <strong>curls into</strong> a ball, they move into a position in which their body makes a rounded shape.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">into</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He wanted to curl into a tiny ball.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The kitten was curled on a cushion on the sofa.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Curl up</strong> means the same as  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="curl#curl_1">curl</a></span></span>.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> <span class="smallcaps">P</span> +  <em class="hi">into</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  In colder weather, your cat will curl up into a tight, heat-conserving ball.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> <span class="smallcaps">P</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She curled up next to him.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed <span class="smallcaps">P</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He was asleep there, curled up in the fetal position.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="curl_1.25" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When a leaf, a piece of paper, or another flat object <strong>curls</strong>, its edges bend towards the centre.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The rose leaves have curled because of an attack by grubs.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Curl up</strong> means the same as  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="curl#curl_1">curl</a></span></span>.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> <span class="smallcaps">P</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The corners of the lino were curling up.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="curl-up#curl-up_1">curl up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
