<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">curtains</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for curtain" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/136/13603/13603.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="curtain_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Curtains</strong> are large pieces of material which you hang from the top of a window.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">mainly British</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  Her bedroom curtains were drawn.</q></span><div class="semantic">in AM, usually use <strong>drapes</strong></div>
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="curtain_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Curtains</strong> are pieces of very thin material which you hang in front of windows in order to prevent
               people from seeing in.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">US</span>)
            <div class="semantic">in BRIT, use <strong>net curtains</strong></div>
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="curtain_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In a theatre, <strong>the curtain</strong> is the large piece of material that hangs in front of the stage until a performance
               begins.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The curtain rises toward the end of the Prelude.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="curtain_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can refer to something as a <strong>curtain</strong> when it is thick and difficult to see through or get past.</span> (<span class="lbl register">literary</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Something dark disappeared behind the curtain of leaves.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="curtain_1.8" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="iron-curtain#iron-curtain_1">Iron Curtain</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="curtain_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>brings down the curtain on</strong> an event or situation, it causes or marks the end of it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  management changes that will finally bring down the curtain on Lord Forte's extraordinary
                  working life</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Something that is <strong>damp</strong> is slightly wet.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Her hair was still damp.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  She wiped the table with a damp cloth.</q></span></li>

</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">decaying</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for decay" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/142/14212/14212.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">decayed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for decay" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/142/14211/14211.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When something such as a dead body, a dead plant, or a tooth <strong>decays</strong>, it is gradually destroyed by a natural process.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The bodies buried in the fine ash slowly decayed.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ing]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The ground was scattered with decaying leaves.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Decay</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  When not removed, plaque causes tooth decay and gum disease.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">decayed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/142/14211/14211.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adjective</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...decayed teeth.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="decay_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something such as a society, system, or institution <strong>decays</strong>, it gradually becomes weaker or its condition gets worse.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Popular cinema seems to have decayed.</q></span></li>

      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Something that is <strong>delicate</strong> is small and beautifully shaped.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He had delicate hands.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">delicately</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/146/14640/14640.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj/-ed]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  She was a shy, delicately pretty girl with enormous blue eyes.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Something that is <strong>delicate</strong> has a colour, taste, or smell which is pleasant and not strong or intense.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Young haricot beans have a tender texture and a delicate, subtle flavour.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">delicately</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/146/14640/14640.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> -ed/adj]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a soup delicately flavoured with nutmeg.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="delicate_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something is <strong>delicate</strong>, it is easy to harm, damage, or break, and needs to be handled or treated carefully.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Although the coral looks hard, it is very delicate.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="delicate_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone who is <strong>delicate</strong> is not healthy and strong, and becomes ill easily.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She was physically delicate and psychologically unstable.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You use <strong>delicate</strong> to describe a situation, problem, matter, or discussion that needs to be dealt with
            carefully and sensitively in order to avoid upsetting things or offending people.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The European members are afraid of upsetting the delicate balance of political interests.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">delicately</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/146/14640/14640.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a delicately-worded memo.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>delicate</strong> task, movement, action, or product needs or shows great skill and attention to detail.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a long and delicate operation carried out at a hospital in Florence.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">delicately</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/146/14640/14640.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the delicately embroidered sheets.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
</div></div>

   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="devote_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>devote</strong> yourself, your time, or your energy <strong>to</strong> something, you spend all or most of your time or energy on it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He decided to devote the rest of his life to scientific investigation.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Considerable resources have been devoted to proving him a liar.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She gladly gave up her part-time job to devote herself entirely to her art.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="devote_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>devote</strong> a particular proportion of a piece of writing or a speech <strong>to</strong> a particular subject, you deal with the subject in that amount of space or time.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He devoted a major section of his massive report to an analysis of U.S. aircraft design.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>

      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you feel or show <strong>disapproval</strong> of something or someone, you feel or show that you do not approve of them.</span><span class="orth"><q>  His action had been greeted with almost universal disapproval.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also +  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span></li>

      or thing you are talking about. An example of a word with this label is  <em class="hi">infantile.</em></div>

<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">disapproves</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for disapprove" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/157/15785/15785.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">disapproving</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for disapprove" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/157/15786/15786.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">disapproved</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for disapprove" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/157/15784/15784.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="disapprove_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>disapprove</strong> <strong>of</strong> something or someone, you feel or show that you do not like them or do not approve
               of them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Most people disapprove of such violent tactics.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The Prime Minister made it clear that he disapproved.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="dissolve_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">dissolve<span class="pron">(dz<span class="underline"></span>lv<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for dissolve" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/163/16337/16337.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">dissolves</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for dissolve" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/163/16340/16340.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">dissolving</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for dissolve" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/163/16341/16341.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">dissolved</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for dissolve" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/163/16339/16339.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="dissolve_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a substance <strong>dissolves</strong> in liquid or if you <strong>dissolve</strong> it, it becomes mixed with the liquid and disappears.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Heat gently until the sugar dissolves.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Dissolve the salt in a little boiled water.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="dissolve_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When an organization or institution <strong>is dissolved</strong>, it is officially ended or broken up.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The committee has been dissolved.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The King agreed to dissolve the present commission.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="dissolve_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When a parliament <strong>is dissolved</strong>, it is formally ended, so that elections for a new parliament can be held.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The present assembly will be dissolved on April 30th.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Kaifu threatened to dissolve the Parliament and call an election.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="dissolve_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When a marriage or business arrangement <strong>is dissolved</strong>, it is officially ended.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The marriage was dissolved in 1976.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="dissolve_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something such as a problem or feeling <strong>dissolves</strong> or <strong>is dissolved</strong>, it becomes weaker and disappears.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His new-found optimism dissolved.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Lenny still could not dissolve the nagging lump of tension in his chest.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="dissolve-into#dissolve-into_1">dissolve into</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="soluble_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">soluble<span class="pron">(s<span class="underline"></span>ljb<sup></sup>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for soluble" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/520/52023/52023.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="soluble_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A substance that is <strong>soluble</strong> will dissolve in a liquid.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Uranium is soluble in sea water.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="soluble_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. combining form</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something is <strong>water-soluble</strong> or <strong>fat-soluble</strong>, it will dissolve in water or in fat.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The red dye on the leather is water-soluble.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...fat-soluble vitamins.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="dump_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">dump<span class="pron">(d<span class="underline"></span>mp<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for dump" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/175/17506/17506.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">dumps</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for dump" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/175/17517/17517.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">dumping</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for dump" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/175/17512/17512.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">dumped</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for dump" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/175/17509/17509.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="dump_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>dump</strong> something somewhere, you put it or unload it there quickly and carelessly.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  We dumped our bags at the nearby Grand Hotel and hurried towards the market.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>is dumped</strong> somewhere, it is put or left there because it is no longer wanted or needed.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The getaway car was dumped near a motorway tunnel.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The government declared that it did not dump radioactive waste at sea.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">dumping</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/175/17512/17512.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  German law forbids the dumping of hazardous waste on German soil.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="dump_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>dump</strong> is a place where rubbish is left, for example on open ground outside a town.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...companies that bring their rubbish straight to the dump.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="dump_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that a place is a <strong>dump</strong>, you think it is ugly and unpleasant to live in or visit.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>, <span class="lbl pragmatics">disapproval</span>)
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="dump_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>dump</strong> something such as an idea, policy, or practice means to stop supporting or using
               it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Ministers believed it was vital to dump the poll tax before the election.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="dump_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a firm or company <strong>dumps</strong> goods, it sells large quantities of them at prices far below their real value, usually
               in another country, in order to gain a bigger market share or to keep prices high
               in the home market.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">business</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  It produces more than it needs, then dumps its surplus onto the world market.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="dump_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>dump</strong> someone, you end your relationship with them.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I thought he was going to dump me for another girl.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="dump_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>dump</strong> computer data or memory means to copy it from one storage system onto another, such
               as from disk to magnetic tape.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">computing</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">into</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  All the data is then dumped into the main computer.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="dump_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>dump</strong> is a list of the data that is stored in a computer's memory at a particular time.
               <strong>Dumps</strong> are often used by computer programmers to find out what is causing a problem with
               a program.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">computing</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  ...a screen dump.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="drum_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">drum<span class="pron">(dr<span class="underline"></span>m<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for drum" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/173/17359/17359.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">drums</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for drum" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/173/17377/17377.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">drumming</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for drum" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/173/17376/17376.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">drummed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for drum" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/173/17373/17373.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="drum_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>drum</strong> is a musical instrument consisting of a skin stretched tightly over a round frame.
               You play a drum by beating it with sticks or with your hands.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="drum_1.2" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>drum</strong> is a large cylindrical container which is used to store fuel or other substances.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...an oil drum.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="drum_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>drums</strong> <strong>on</strong> a surface, or if you <strong>drum</strong> something <strong>on</strong> a surface, it hits it regularly, making a continuous beating sound.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">on/against</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He drummed his fingers on the leather top of his desk.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Rain drummed on the roof of the car.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="drum_1.7" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="drumming#drumming_1">drumming</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="drum_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>beats the drum</strong> or <strong>bangs the drum</strong> <strong>for</strong> something, they support it strongly.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="drum-into#drum-into_1">drum into</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="drum-out#drum-out_1">drum out</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="drum-up#drum-up_1">drum up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="elegant_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">elegant<span class="pron">(<span class="underline">e</span>lgnt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for elegant" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/181/18122/18122.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you describe a person or thing as <strong>elegant</strong>, you mean that they are pleasing and graceful in appearance or style.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Patricia looked beautiful and elegant as always.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...an elegant restaurant.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">elegance</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/181/18121/18121.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...Princess Grace's understated elegance.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">elegantly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/181/18123/18123.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a tall, elegantly dressed man with a mustache.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you describe a piece of writing, an idea, or a plan as <strong>elegant</strong>, you mean that it is simple, clear, and clever.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The document impressed me with its elegant simplicity.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">elegantly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/181/18123/18123.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...an elegantly simple idea.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="enormous_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">enormous<span class="pron">(n<span class="underline"></span>ms<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for enormous" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/186/18697/18697.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="enormous_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Something that is <strong>enormous</strong> is extremely large in size or amount.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The main bedroom is enormous.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  There is, of course, an enormous amount to see.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can use <strong>enormous</strong> to emphasize the great degree or extent of something.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  It was an enormous disappointment.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">enormously</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/186/18698/18698.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj</span><span class="lbl syntax">, <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  This book was enormously influential.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="inquiry_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">inquiry<span class="pron">(nkw<span class="underline">a</span>ri<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for inquiry" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/287/28786/28786.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">inquiries</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for inquiry" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/287/28783/28783.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">The spelling <strong>enquiry</strong> is also used. <strong>Inquiry</strong> is sometimes pronounced <span class="pron">(<span class="underline"></span>kwri<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/7/704/70488/70488.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span> in American English.
   </div>
   <div id="inquiry_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>inquiry</strong> is a question which you ask in order to get some information.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He made some inquiries and discovered she had gone to the Continent.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="inquiry_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>inquiry</strong> is an official investigation.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">into</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The Democratic Party has called for an independent inquiry into the incident.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="inquiry_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Inquiry</strong> is the process of asking about or investigating something in order to find out more
               about it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The investigation has suddenly switched to a new line of inquiry.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="inquiry_1.7" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="court-of-inquiry#court-of-inquiry_1">court of inquiry</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>

    <a id="entitle_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">entitle<span class="pron">(nt<span class="underline">a</span>t<sup></sup>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for entitle" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/188/18812/18812.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">entitles</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for entitle" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/188/18816/18816.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">entitling</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for entitle" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/188/18817/18817.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">entitled</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for entitle" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/188/18813/18813.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="entitle_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>are entitled</strong> <strong>to</strong> something, you have the right to have it or do it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  If the warranty is limited, the terms may entitle you to a replacement or refund.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n to-inf]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  There are 23 Clubs throughout the U.S., and your membership entitles you to enjoy
                  all of them.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="entitle_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If the title of something such as a book, film, or painting is, for example, 'Sunrise',
               you can say that it <strong>is entitled</strong> 'Sunrise'.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Chomsky's review is entitled 'Psychology and Ideology'.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed quote]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a performance entitled 'United States'.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

    <a id="envelope_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">envelope<span class="pron">(<span class="underline">e</span>nvlop<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for envelope" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/631/63114/63114.mp3"></a>
</span></span><span class="pron">; <span class="underline"></span>n-<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for envelope" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/631/63115/63115.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">envelopes</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for envelope" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/631/63116/63116.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for envelope" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/631/63117/63117.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="envelope_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>envelope</strong> is the rectangular paper cover in which you send a letter to someone through the
               post.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="envelope_1.2" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>pushes the envelope</strong>, they do something to a greater degree or in a more extreme way than it has ever
               been done before.</span><span class="orth"><q>  There's a valuable place for fashion and design that pushes the envelope a bit.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="equivalent_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">equivalent<span class="pron">(kw<span class="underline"></span>vlnt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for equivalent" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/190/19011/19011.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">equivalents</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for equivalent" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/190/19012/19012.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="equivalent_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If one amount or value is <strong>the</strong> <strong>equivalent</strong> <strong>of</strong> another, they are the same.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The equivalent of two tablespoons of polyunsaturated oils is ample each day.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Even the cheapest car costs the equivalent of 70 years' salary for a government worker.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Equivalent</strong> is also an adjective.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A unit is equivalent to a glass of wine or a single measure of spirits.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  They will react with hostility to the price rises and calls for equivalent wage increases
                  are bound to be heard.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="equivalent_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>equivalent</strong> of someone or something is a person or thing that has the same function in a different
               place, time, or system.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the civil administrator of the West Bank and his equivalent in Gaza.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the Red Cross emblem, and its equivalent in Muslim countries, the Red Crescent.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Equivalent</strong> is also an adjective.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a decrease of 10% in property investment compared with the equivalent period in
                  1991.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="equivalent_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can use <strong>equivalent</strong> to emphasize the great or severe effect of something.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His party has just suffered the equivalent of a near-fatal heart attack.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="examine_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">examine<span class="pron">(gz<span class="underline"></span>mn<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for examine" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/193/19399/19399.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">examines</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for examine" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/194/19405/19405.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">examining</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for examine" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/194/19406/19406.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">examined</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for examine" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/194/19400/19400.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>examine</strong> something, you look at it carefully.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He examined her passport and stamped it.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">examination</span> <span class="orth"><span class="pron">(gz<span class="underline"></span>mn<span class="underline">e</span><sup></sup>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/193/19397/19397.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></span> ( <span class="infl">examinations</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for examination" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/193/19398/19398.mp3"></a>
</span>)<span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">variable noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The Navy is to carry out an examination of the wreck tomorrow.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a doctor <strong>examines</strong> you, he or she looks at your body, feels it, or does simple tests in order to check
            how healthy you are.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Another doctor examined her and could still find nothing wrong.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">examination</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/193/19397/19397.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">variable noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  He was later discharged after an examination at Westminster Hospital.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If an idea, proposal, or plan <strong>is examined</strong>, it is considered very carefully.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The plans will be examined by E.U. environment ministers.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">examination</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/193/19397/19397.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">variable noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  The proposal requires careful examination and consideration.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="examine_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>are examined</strong>, you are given a formal test in order to show your knowledge of a subject.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">being</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...learning to cope with the pressures of being judged and examined by our teachers.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="exaggerate_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">exaggerate<span class="pron">(gz<span class="underline"></span>dret<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for exaggerate" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/193/19384/19384.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">exaggerates</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for exaggerate" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/193/19387/19387.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">exaggerating</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for exaggerate" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/193/19388/19388.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">exaggerated</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for exaggerate" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/193/19385/19385.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>exaggerate</strong>, you indicate that something is, for example, worse or more important than it really
            is.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He thinks I'm exaggerating.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Sheila admitted that she did sometimes exaggerate the demands of her job.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">exaggeration</span> <span class="orth"><span class="pron">(gz<span class="underline"></span>dr<span class="underline">e</span><sup></sup>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/193/19389/19389.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></span> ( <span class="infl">exaggerations</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for exaggeration" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/193/19390/19390.mp3"></a>
</span>)<span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">variable noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  Like many stories about him, it smacks of exaggeration.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  It would be an exaggeration to call the danger urgent.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="exaggerate_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>exaggerates</strong> a situation, quality, or feature, it makes the situation, quality, or feature appear
               greater, more obvious, or more important than it really is.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  These figures exaggerate the loss of competitiveness.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="extent_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">extent<span class="pron">(kst<span class="underline">e</span>nt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for extent" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/198/19865/19865.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="extent_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are talking about how great, important, or serious a difficulty or situation
               is, you can refer to <strong>the</strong> <strong>extent</strong> <strong>of</strong> it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The government itself has little information on the extent of industrial pollution.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The full extent of the losses was disclosed yesterday.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="extent_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>The</strong> <strong>extent</strong> <strong>of</strong> something is its length, area, or size.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Their commitment was only to maintain the extent of forests, not their biodiversity.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="extent_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You use expressions such as <strong>to a large extent</strong>, <strong>to some extent</strong>, or <strong>to a certain extent</strong> in order to indicate that something is partly true, but not entirely true.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">vagueness</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  It was and, to a large extent, still is a good show.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  To some extent this was the truth.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="extent_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You use expressions such as <strong>to what extent</strong>, <strong>to that extent</strong>, or <strong>to the extent that</strong> when you are discussing how true a statement is, or in what ways it is true.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">vagueness</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  It's still not clear to what extent this criticism is originating from within the
                  ruling party.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  To that extent they helped bring about their own destruction.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="extent_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You use expressions such as <strong>to the extent of</strong>, <strong>to the extent that</strong>, or <strong>to such an extent that</strong> in order to emphasize that a situation has reached a difficult, dangerous, or surprising
               stage.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  He said he didn't like the president, but not to the extent of wanting to kill him.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="extraordinary_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">extraordinary<span class="pron">(kstr<span class="underline"></span>dnri<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for extraordinary" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/199/19927/19927.mp3"></a>
</span></span><span class="pron">; <span class="lbl geo">US</span> -neri<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for extraordinary" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/687/68760/68760.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you describe something or someone as <strong>extraordinary</strong>, you mean that they have some extremely good or special quality.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">approval</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  We've made extraordinary progress as a society in that regard.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The task requires extraordinary patience and endurance.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Rozhdestvensky is an extraordinary musician.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">extraordinarily</span> <span class="orth"><span class="pron">(kstr<span class="underline"></span>dnrli<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/199/19926/19926.mp3"></a>
</span></span><span class="pron">; <span class="lbl geo">US</span> -nerli)</span></span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  She's extraordinarily disciplined.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you describe something as <strong>extraordinary</strong>, you mean that it is very unusual or surprising.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  What an extraordinary thing to happen!</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  His decision to hold talks is extraordinary because it could mean the real end of
               the war.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">extraordinarily</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/199/19926/19926.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj/adv]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  Apart from the hair, he looked extraordinarily unchanged.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Extraordinarily, the favourites for the title lie at the bottom of the table.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="extraordinary_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>extraordinary</strong> meeting is arranged specially to deal with a particular situation or problem, rather
               than happening regularly.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  ...at an extraordinary meeting of the sport's ruling body.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="faint_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">faint<span class="pron">(f<span class="underline">e</span>nt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for faint" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20147/20147.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">fainter</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for faint" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20149/20149.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">faintest</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for faint" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20150/20150.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">faints</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for faint" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20155/20155.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">fainting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for faint" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20152/20152.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">fainted</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for faint" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20148/20148.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>faint</strong> sound, colour, mark, feeling, or quality has very little strength or intensity.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He became aware of the soft, faint sounds of water dripping.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  He could see faint lines in her face.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  There was still the faint hope deep within him that she might never need to know.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">faintly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20153/20153.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [usu <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> after v</span><span class="lbl syntax">, oft <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  He was already asleep in the bed, which smelled faintly of mildew.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  She felt faintly ridiculous.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>faint</strong> attempt at something is one that is made without proper effort and with little enthusiasm.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Caroline made a faint attempt at a laugh.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  A faint smile crossed the Monsignor's face and faded quickly.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">faintly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20153/20153.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> after v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  John smiled faintly and shook his head.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="faint_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>faint</strong>, you lose consciousness for a short time, especially because you are hungry, or because
               of pain, heat, or shock.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She suddenly fell forward on to the table and fainted.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I thought he'd faint when I kissed him.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Faint</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She slumped to the ground in a faint.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="faint_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone who is <strong>faint</strong> feels weak and unsteady as if they are about to lose consciousness.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Other signs of angina are nausea, sweating, feeling faint and shortness of breath.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="faucet_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">faucet<span class="pron">(f<span class="underline"></span>st<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for faucet" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/647/64757/64757.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">faucets</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for faucet" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/647/64758/64758.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="faucet_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>faucet</strong> is a device that controls the flow of a liquid or gas from a pipe or container. Sinks
               and baths have faucets attached to them.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">US</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  She turned off the faucet and dried her hands.</q></span><div class="semantic">in BRIT, usually use <strong>tap</strong></div>
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="tap_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">tap<span class="pron">(t<span class="underline"></span>p<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for tap" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/558/55825/55825.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">taps</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for tap" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/558/55861/55861.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">tapping</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for tap" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/558/55860/55860.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">tapped</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for tap" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/558/55859/55859.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="tap_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>tap</strong> is a device that controls the flow of a liquid or gas from a pipe or container, for
               example on a sink.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">mainly British</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  She turned on the taps.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a cold-water tap.</q></span><div class="semantic">in AM, use <strong>faucet</strong></div>
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="tap_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>tap</strong> something, you hit it with a quick light blow or a series of quick light blows.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He tapped the table to still the shouts of protest.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Grace tapped on the bedroom door and went in.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Tap</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">on/at</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A tap on the door interrupted him and Sally Pierce came in.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="tap_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>tap</strong> your fingers or feet, you make a regular pattern of sound by hitting a surface lightly
               and repeatedly with them, especially while you are listening to music.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The song's so catchy it makes you bounce round the living room or tap your feet.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="tap_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>tap</strong> a resource or situation, you make use of it by getting from it something that you
               need or want.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He owes his election to having tapped deep public disillusion with professional politicians.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The company is tapping shareholders for 15.8 million.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">into</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The Campbell Soup Company says it will try to tap into Japan's rice market.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="tap_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>taps</strong> your telephone, they attach a special device to the line so that they can secretly
               listen to your conversations.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The government passed laws allowing the police to tap telephones.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Tap</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He assured MPs that ministers and MPs were not subjected to phone taps.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="tap_1.17" class="hom"><span class="gramGrp"></span><ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="phonetapping#phonetapping_1">phone-tapping</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="wiretap#wiretap_1">wiretap</a></span></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="tap_1.18" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If drinks are <strong>on tap</strong>, they come from a tap rather than from a bottle.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Filtered water is always on tap, making it very convenient to use.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="tap_1.20" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something is <strong>on tap</strong>, you can have as much of it as you want whenever you want.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  The advantage of group holidays is company on tap but time alone if you want it.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="federal_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">federal<span class="pron">(f<span class="underline">e</span>drl<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for federal" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/205/20556/20556.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">federals</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for federal" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/205/20561/20561.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="federal_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>federal</strong> country or system of government is one in which the different states or provinces
               of the country have important powers to make their own laws and decisions.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Five of the six provinces are to become autonomous regions in a new federal system
                  of government.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="federal_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Some people use <strong>federal</strong> to describe a system of government which they disapprove of, in which the different
               states or provinces are controlled by a strong central government.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">disapproval</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  He does not believe in a federal Europe with centralising powers.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
