      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Federal</strong> also means belonging or relating to the national government of a federal country
            rather than to one of the states within it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The federal government controls just 6% of the education budget.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a federal judge.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">federally</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/205/20560/20560.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> -ed]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...residents of public housing and federally subsidized apartments.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="federal_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Federals</strong> are the same as  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="fed#fed_1">feds</a></span></span>.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="fee_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">fee<span class="pron">(f<span class="underline">i</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for fee" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/205/20568/20568.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">fees</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for fee" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/205/20594/20594.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="fee_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>fee</strong> is a sum of money that you pay to be allowed to do something.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He hadn't paid his television licence fee.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="fee_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>fee</strong> is the amount of money that a person or organization is paid for a particular job
               or service that they provide.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Find out how much your surveyor's and solicitor's fees will be.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="fever_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">fever<span class="pron">(f<span class="underline">i</span>v<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for fever" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/207/20742/20742.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">fevers</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for fever" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/207/20747/20747.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="fever_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you have a <strong>fever</strong> when you are ill, your body temperature is higher than usual and your heart beats
               faster.</span><span class="orth"><q>  My Uncle Jim had a high fever.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Symptoms of the disease include fever and weight loss.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="fever_1.4" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="hay-fever#hay-fever_1">hay fever</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="rheumatic-fever#rheumatic-fever_1">rheumatic fever</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="scarlet-fever#scarlet-fever_1">scarlet fever</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="fever_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>fever</strong> is extreme excitement or nervousness about something.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Angie waited in a fever of excitement.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="enthusiasm_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">enthusiasm<span class="pron">(nj<span class="underline">u</span>zizm<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for enthusiasm" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/187/18794/18794.mp3"></a>
</span></span><span class="pron">; <span class="lbl geo">US</span> -<span class="underline">u</span>-<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for enthusiasm" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/687/68710/68710.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">enthusiasms</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for enthusiasm" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/187/18795/18795.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="enthusiasm_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Enthusiasm</strong> is great eagerness to be involved in a particular activity which you like and enjoy
               or which you think is important.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Their skill, enthusiasm and running has got them in the team.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="enthusiasm_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>enthusiasm</strong> is an activity or subject that interests you very much and that you spend a lot of
               time on.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Draw him out about his current enthusiasms and future plans.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="flow_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">flow<span class="pron">(fl<span class="underline">o</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for flow" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/216/21605/21605.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">flows</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for flow" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/216/21622/21622.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">flowing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for flow" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/216/21620/21620.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">flowed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for flow" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/216/21608/21608.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="flow_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a liquid, gas, or electrical current <strong>flows</strong> somewhere, it moves there steadily and continuously.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A stream flowed gently down into the valley.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The current flows into electric motors that drive the wheels.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...compressor stations that keep the gas flowing.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Flow</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  It works only in the veins, where the blood flow is slower.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="flow_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a number of people or things <strong>flow</strong> from one place to another, they move there steadily in large groups, usually without
               stopping.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Large numbers of refugees continue to flow from the troubled region into the no-man's
                  land.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Flow</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She watched the frantic flow of cars and buses along the street.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="flow_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If information or money <strong>flows</strong> somewhere, it moves freely between people or organizations.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A lot of this information flowed through other police departments.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  An interest rate reduction is needed to get more money flowing and create jobs.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Flow</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the opportunity to control the flow of information.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="flow_1.13" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="cash-flow#cash-flow_1">cash flow</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="flow_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone who is <strong>in full flow</strong> is talking easily and continuously and seems likely to go on talking for some time.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He had been replying for some 40 minutes already and was still in full flow.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="flow_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that an activity, or the person who is performing the activity, is <strong>in full flow</strong>, you mean that the activity has started and is being carried out with a great deal
               of energy and enthusiasm.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Lunch at Harry's Bar was in full flow when Irene made a splendid entrance.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="flow_1.18" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>go with the flow</strong>, you let things happen or let other people tell you what to do, rather than trying
               to control what happens yourself.</span><span class="orth"><q>  There's nothing I can do about the problem, so I might as well go with the flow.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="genuine_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">genuine<span class="pron">(d<span class="underline">e</span>njun<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for genuine" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/234/23466/23466.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="genuine_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Genuine</strong> is used to describe people and things that are exactly what they appear to be, and
               are not false or an imitation.</span><span class="orth"><q>  There was a risk of genuine refugees being returned to Vietnam.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...genuine leather.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  They're convinced the picture is genuine.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Genuine</strong> refers to things such as emotions that are real and not pretended.</span><span class="orth"><q>  There was genuine joy in this room.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  If this offer is genuine I will gladly accept it.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">genuinely</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/234/23467/23467.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  He was genuinely surprised.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">genuineness</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/234/23468/23468.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He needed at least three days to assess the genuineness of their intentions.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you describe a person as <strong>genuine</strong>, you approve of them because they are honest, truthful, and sincere in the way they
            live and in their relationships with other people.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">approval</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  She is very caring and very genuine.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">genuineness</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/234/23468/23468.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  I have no doubt about their genuineness.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="grain_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">grain<span class="pron">(gr<span class="underline">e</span>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for grain" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/242/24293/24293.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">grains</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for grain" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/242/24295/24295.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="grain_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>grain</strong> <strong>of</strong> wheat, rice, or other cereal crop is a seed from it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a grain of wheat.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...rice grains.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="grain_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Grain</strong> is a cereal crop, especially wheat or corn, that has been harvested and is used for
               food or in trade.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a bag of grain.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the best grains.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>grain of</strong> something such as sand or salt is a tiny hard piece of it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a grain of sand.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">-grained</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/242/24294/24294.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">combining form</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...coarse-grained salt.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="grain_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>grain of</strong> a quality is a very small amount of it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  There's more than a grain of truth in that.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. singular noun</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>The grain</strong> of a piece of wood is the direction of its fibres. You can also refer to the pattern
            of lines on the surface of the wood as <strong>the grain</strong>.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Brush the paint generously over the wood in the direction of the grain.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">-grained</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/242/24294/24294.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">combining form</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a hard, heavy, straight-grained wood.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="grain_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that an idea or action <strong>goes against the grain</strong>, you mean that it is very difficult for you to accept it or do it, because it conflicts
               with your previous ideas, beliefs, or principles.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Privatisation goes against the grain of their principle of opposition to private ownership
                  of industry.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="grant_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">grant<span class="pron">(gr<span class="underline"></span>nt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for grant" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/243/24367/24367.mp3"></a>
</span></span><span class="pron">; gr<span class="underline"></span>nt)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">grants</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for grant" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/243/24371/24371.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">granting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for grant" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/243/24369/24369.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">granted</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for grant" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/243/24368/24368.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="grant_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>grant</strong> is an amount of money that a government or other institution gives to an individual
               or to an organization for a particular purpose such as education or home improvements.</span><span class="orth"><q>  They'd got a special grant to encourage research.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Unfortunately, my application for a grant was rejected.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="grant_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone in authority <strong>grants</strong> you something, or if something <strong>is granted</strong> <strong>to</strong> you, you are allowed to have it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  France has agreed to grant him political asylum.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  It was a Labour government which granted independence to India and Pakistan.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Permission was granted a few weeks ago.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="grant_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>grant</strong> <strong>that</strong> something is true, you accept that it is true, even though your opinion about it
               does not change.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> that]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The magistrates granted that the charity was justified in bringing the action.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
      <div id="grant_1.10" class="hom">
         <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">phrase</span> 
         </h3>
         <ol class="sense_list level_0">
            <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You use '<strong>I grant you</strong>' or '<strong>I'll grant you</strong>' to say that you accept something is true, even though your opinion about it does
                  not change.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He took a risk, I'll grant you. But when you think about it, the risk was pretty small.</q></span></li>
         </ol>
      </div>
   </div>
   <div id="grant_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone <strong>takes</strong> you <strong>for granted</strong>, you are complaining that they benefit from your help, efforts, or presence without
               showing that they are grateful.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The officials felt taken for granted and grumbled loudly.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="grant_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>take</strong> something <strong>for granted</strong>, you believe that it is true or accept it as normal without thinking about it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  I was amazed that virtually all the things I took for granted up north just didn't
                  happen in London.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="grant_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>take it for granted</strong> <strong>that</strong> something is the case, you believe that it is true or you accept it as normal without
               thinking about it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He seemed to take it for granted that he should speak as a representative.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="grocery_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">grocery<span class="pron">(gr<span class="underline">o</span>sri<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for grocery" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/246/24654/24654.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">groceries</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for grocery" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/246/24652/24652.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="grocery_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>grocery</strong> or a <strong>grocery store</strong> is a grocer's shop.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">mainly US</span>)
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="grocery_1.2" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. plural noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Groceries</strong> are foods you buy at a grocer's or at a supermarket such as flour, sugar, and tinned
               foods.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="hairdresser_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">hairdresser<span class="pron">(h<span class="underline">e</span>dres<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for hairdresser" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/251/25118/25118.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">hairdressers</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for hairdresser" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/251/25119/25119.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="hairdresser_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>hairdresser</strong> is a person who cuts, colours, and arranges people's hair.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="hairdresser_1.2" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>hairdresser</strong> or a <strong>hairdresser's</strong> is a shop where a hairdresser works.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="faint_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">faint<span class="pron">(f<span class="underline">e</span>nt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for faint" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20147/20147.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">fainter</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for faint" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20149/20149.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">faintest</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for faint" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20150/20150.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">faints</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for faint" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20155/20155.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">fainting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for faint" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20152/20152.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">fainted</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for faint" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20148/20148.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>faint</strong> sound, colour, mark, feeling, or quality has very little strength or intensity.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He became aware of the soft, faint sounds of water dripping.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  He could see faint lines in her face.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  There was still the faint hope deep within him that she might never need to know.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">faintly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20153/20153.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [usu <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> after v</span><span class="lbl syntax">, oft <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  He was already asleep in the bed, which smelled faintly of mildew.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  She felt faintly ridiculous.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>faint</strong> attempt at something is one that is made without proper effort and with little enthusiasm.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Caroline made a faint attempt at a laugh.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  A faint smile crossed the Monsignor's face and faded quickly.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">faintly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/201/20153/20153.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> after v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  John smiled faintly and shook his head.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="faint_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>faint</strong>, you lose consciousness for a short time, especially because you are hungry, or because
               of pain, heat, or shock.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She suddenly fell forward on to the table and fainted.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I thought he'd faint when I kissed him.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Faint</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She slumped to the ground in a faint.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="faint_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone who is <strong>faint</strong> feels weak and unsteady as if they are about to lose consciousness.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Other signs of angina are nausea, sweating, feeling faint and shortness of breath.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="heel_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">heel<span class="pron">(h<span class="underline">i</span>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for heel" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/259/25934/25934.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">heels</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for heel" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/259/25938/25938.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="heel_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Your <strong>heel</strong> is the back part of your foot, just below your ankle.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="heel_1.2" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>heel</strong> of a shoe is the raised part on the bottom at the back.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the shoes with the high heels.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="heel_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. plural noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Heels</strong> are women's shoes that are raised very high at the back.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...two well-dressed ladies in high heels.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the old adage that you shouldn't wear heels with trousers.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="heel_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>heel</strong> of a sock or stocking is the part that covers your heel.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="heel_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>heel of</strong> your hand is the rounded pad at the bottom of your palm.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="heel_1.9" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="achilles-heel#achilles-heel_1">Achilles heel</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="heel_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>bring</strong> someone <strong>to heel</strong>, you force them to obey you.</span><span class="orth"><q>  It's still not clear how the president will use his power to bring the republics to
                  heel.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="heel_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>dig</strong> your <strong>heels in</strong> or <strong>dig in</strong> your <strong>heels</strong>, you refuse to do something such as change your opinions or plans, especially when
               someone is trying very hard to make you do so.</span><span class="orth"><q>  It was really the British who, by digging their heels in, prevented any last-minute
                  deal.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="heel_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that one event follows <strong>hard on the heels of</strong> another or <strong>hot on the heels of</strong> another, you mean that one happens very quickly or immediately after another.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Unfortunately, bad news has come hard on the heels of good.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="heel_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone is <strong>hot on</strong> your <strong>heels</strong>, you are emphasizing that they are chasing you and are not very far behind you.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  They sped through the American southwest with the law hot on their heels.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="heel_1.18" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are <strong>kicking</strong> your <strong>heels</strong>, you are having to wait around with nothing to do, so that you get bored or impatient.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>, <span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  The authorities wouldn't grant us permission to fly all the way down to San Francisco,
                  so I had to kick my heels at Tunis Airport.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="heel_1.20" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">12. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>turn on</strong> your <strong>heel</strong> or <strong>spin on</strong> your <strong>heel</strong>, you suddenly turn round, especially because you are angry or surprised.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He simply turned on his heel and walked away.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="heel_1.22" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="head#head_1">head over heels</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="heel_1.23" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="drag#drag_1">to drag your heels</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="hollow_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">hollow<span class="pron">(h<span class="underline"></span>lo<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for hollow" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/265/26545/26545.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">hollows</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for hollow" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/265/26550/26550.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">hollowing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for hollow" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/265/26548/26548.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">hollowed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for hollow" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/265/26547/26547.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="hollow_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Something that is <strong>hollow</strong> has a space inside it, as opposed to being solid all the way through.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a hollow tree.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a hollow cylinder.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="hollow_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A surface that is <strong>hollow</strong> curves inwards.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He looked young, dark and sharp-featured, with hollow cheeks.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="hollow_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>hollow</strong> is a hole inside a tree.</span><span class="orth"><q>  I made my home there, in the hollow of a dying elm.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="hollow_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>hollow</strong> is an area that is lower than the surrounding surface.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of/in/between</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Below him the town lay warm in the hollow of the hill.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you describe a statement, situation, or person as <strong>hollow</strong>, you mean they have no real value, worth, or effectiveness.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Any threat to bring in the police is a hollow one.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">hollowness</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/265/26549/26549.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  One month before the deadline we see the hollowness of these promises.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="hollow_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone gives a <strong>hollow</strong> laugh, they laugh in a way that shows that they do not really find something amusing.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Murray Pick's hollow laugh had no mirth in it.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="hollow_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>hollow</strong> sound is dull and echoing.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the hollow sound of a gunshot.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="hollow_1.18" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>is hollowed</strong>, its surface is made to curve inwards or downwards.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The mule's back was hollowed by the weight of its burden.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...her high, elegantly hollowed cheekbones.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="horn_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">horn<span class="pron">(h<span class="underline"></span>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for horn" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/267/26764/26764.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">horns</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for horn" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/267/26773/26773.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="horn_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> On a vehicle such as a car, the <strong>horn</strong> is the device that makes a loud noise as a signal or warning.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He sounded the car horn.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="horn_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>horns</strong> of an animal such as a cow or deer are the hard pointed things that grow from its
               head.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="horn_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Horn</strong> is the hard substance that the horns of animals are made of. Horn is sometimes used
               to make objects such as spoons, buttons, or ornaments.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="horn_1.5" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="hornrimmed#hornrimmed_1">horn-rimmed</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="horn_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>horn</strong> is a musical instrument of the brass family. It is a long circular metal tube, wide
               at one end, which you play by blowing.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="horn_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>horn</strong> is a simple musical instrument consisting of a metal tube that is wide at one end
               and narrow at the other. You play it by blowing into it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a hunting horn.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="horn_1.9" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="shoehorn#shoehorn_1">shoehorn</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="horn_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>blow</strong> your <strong>own horn</strong>, you boast about yourself.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">mainly US</span>)
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="horn_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If two people <strong>lock horns</strong>, they argue about something.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  During his six years in office, Seidman has often locked horns with lawmakers.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="horn_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are <strong>on the horns of a dilemma</strong>, you have to choose between two things, both of which are unpleasant or difficult.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The bird is caught on the horns of a dilemma. Should it attack the predator, even
                  though it then risks its own life? Or should it get out while the going is good?</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="horn_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>pulls in</strong> their <strong>horns</strong> or <strong>draws in</strong> their <strong>horns</strong>, they start behaving more cautiously than they did before, especially by spending
               less money.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Customers are drawing in their horns at a time of high interest rates.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="horn_1.17" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="bull#bull_1">take the bull by the horns</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>

    <a id="horror_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">horror<span class="pron">(h<span class="underline"></span>r<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for horror" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/267/26789/26789.mp3"></a>
</span></span><span class="pron">; <span class="lbl geo">US</span> h<span class="underline"></span>r-<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for horror" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/690/69013/69013.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">horrors</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for horror" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/267/26790/26790.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="horror_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Horror</strong> is a feeling of great shock, fear, and worry caused by something extremely unpleasant.</span><span class="orth"><q>  As I watched in horror the boat began to power away from me.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="horror_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you have a <strong>horror of</strong> something, you are afraid of it or dislike it very much.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...his horror of death.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="horror_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>horror</strong> <strong>of</strong> something, especially something that hurts people, is its very great unpleasantness.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the horror of this most bloody of civil wars.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="horror_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can refer to extremely unpleasant or frightening experiences as <strong>horrors</strong>.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Can you possibly imagine all the horrors we have undergone since I last wrote you?</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="horror_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>horror</strong> film or story is intended to be very frightening.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a psychological horror film.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="horror_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can refer to an account of a very unpleasant experience or event as a <strong>horror</strong> story.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a horror story about lost luggage while flying.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Hatred</strong> is an extremely strong feeling of dislike for someone or something.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of/for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Her hatred of them would never lead her to murder.</q></span></li>

</span></span><span class="pron">; <span class="lbl geo">US</span> -m<span class="underline"></span>r-<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for immoral" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/690/69062/69062.mp3"></a>

   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you describe someone or their behaviour as <strong>immoral</strong>, you believe that their behaviour is morally wrong.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">disapproval</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  ...those who think that birth control and abortion are immoral.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">immorality</span> <span class="orth"><span class="pron">(<span class="underline"></span>mr<span class="underline"></span>lti<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/276/27686/27686.mp3"></a>

   </ol>
