<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="implication_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">implication<span class="pron">(<span class="underline"></span>mplk<span class="underline">e</span><sup></sup>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for implication" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27825/27825.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">implications</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for implication" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27826/27826.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="implication_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>The</strong> <strong>implications</strong> <strong>of</strong> something are the things that are likely to happen as a result.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The Attorney General was aware of the political implications of his decision to prosecute.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The low level of current investment has serious implications for future economic growth.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="implication_1.4" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>The</strong> <strong>implication</strong> of a statement, event, or situation is what it implies or suggests is the case.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The implication was obvious: vote for us or it will be very embarrassing for you.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
      <div id="implication_1.6" class="hom">
         <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">phrase</span> 
         </h4>
         <ol class="sense_list level_0">
            <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that something is the case <strong>by implication</strong>, you mean that a statement, event, or situation implies that it is the case.</span><span class="orth"><q>  His authority and, by implication, that of his management team is under threat.</q></span></li>
         </ol>
      </div>
   </div>
   <div id="implication_1.8" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="implicate#implicate_1">implicate</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="implicate_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">implicate<span class="pron">(<span class="underline"></span>mplket<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for implicate" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27821/27821.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">implicates</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for implicate" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27823/27823.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">implicating</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for implicate" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27824/27824.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">implicated</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for implicate" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27822/27822.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
   </h4>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>implicate</strong> someone means to show or claim that they were involved in something wrong or criminal.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He was to resign when one of his own aides was implicated in a financial scandal.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He didn't find anything in the notebooks to implicate Stuart.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">implication</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27825/27825.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">in</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...his implication in a murder.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also +  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="implicate_1.6" class="hom"><span class="gramGrp"></span><ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="implicated#implicated_1">implicated</a></span></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="imply_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">imply<span class="pron">(mpl<span class="underline">a</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for imply" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27840/27840.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">implies</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for imply" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27830/27830.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">implying</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for imply" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27841/27841.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">implied</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for imply" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27829/27829.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="imply_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>imply</strong> <strong>that</strong> something is the case, you say something which indicates that it is the case in an
               indirect way.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> that]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  'Are you implying that I have something to do with those attacks?' she asked coldly.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She felt undermined by the implied criticism.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="imply_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If an event or situation <strong>implies</strong> that something is the case, it makes you think it likely that it is the case.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> that]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Exports in June rose 1.5%, implying that the economy was stronger than many investors
                  had realized.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A 'frontier-free' Europe implies a greatly increased market for all economic operators.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="impose_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">impose<span class="pron">(mp<span class="underline">o</span>z<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for impose" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27860/27860.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">imposes</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for impose" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27862/27862.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">imposing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for impose" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27863/27863.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">imposed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for impose" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27861/27861.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>impose</strong> something <strong>on</strong> people, you use your authority to force them to accept it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Britain imposed fines on airlines which bring in passengers without proper papers.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Many companies have imposed a pay freeze.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The conditions imposed on volunteers were stringent.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">imposition</span> <span class="orth"><span class="pron">(<span class="underline"></span>mpz<span class="underline"></span><sup></sup>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27864/27864.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the imposition of a ban on cycling in the city centre.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="impose_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>impose</strong> your opinions or beliefs <strong>on</strong> other people, you try and make people accept them as a rule or as a model to copy.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Parents of either sex should beware of imposing their own tastes on their children.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="impose_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>imposes</strong> strain, pressure, or suffering <strong>on</strong> someone, it causes them to experience it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The filming imposed an additional strain on her.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>imposes</strong> <strong>on</strong> you, they unreasonably expect you to do something for them which you do not want
            to do.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">on/upon</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I was afraid you'd simply feel we were imposing on you.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">imposition</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27864/27864.mp3"></a>
</span> ( <span class="infl">impositions</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for imposition" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/690/69064/69064.mp3"></a>
</span>)<span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">countable noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  I know this is an imposition. But please hear me out.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="impose_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>imposes</strong> <strong>themselves on</strong> you, they force you to accept their company although you may not want to.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I didn't want to impose myself on my married friends.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="inevitable_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">inevitable<span class="pron">(n<span class="underline">e</span>vtb<sup></sup>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for inevitable" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/284/28417/28417.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="inevitable_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something is <strong>inevitable</strong>, it is certain to happen and cannot be prevented or avoided.</span><span class="orth"><q>  If the case succeeds, it is inevitable that other trials will follow.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The defeat had inevitable consequences for British policy.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>The inevitable</strong> is something which is inevitable.</span><span class="orth"><q>  'It's just delaying the inevitable,' he said.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="infect_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">infect<span class="pron">(nf<span class="underline">e</span>kt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for infect" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/284/28452/28452.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">infects</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for infect" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/284/28459/28459.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">infecting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for infect" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/284/28454/28454.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">infected</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for infect" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/284/28453/28453.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>infect</strong> people, animals, or plants means to cause them to have a disease or illness.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A single mosquito can infect a large number of people.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...people infected with HIV.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">infection</span> <span class="orth"><span class="pron">(nf<span class="underline">e</span>k<sup></sup>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/284/28455/28455.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...plants that are resistant to infection.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="infect_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>infect</strong> a substance or area means to cause it to contain harmful germs or bacteria.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The birds infect the milk.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a virus which is spread mainly by infected blood.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="infect_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When people, places, or things <strong>are infected</strong> by a feeling or influence, it spreads to them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">by</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  For an instant I was infected by her fear.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He thought they might infect others with their bourgeois ideas.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His urge for revenge would never infect her.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="infect_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a virus <strong>infects</strong> a computer, it affects the computer by damaging or destroying programs.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">computing</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  This virus infected thousands of computers within days.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="institute_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">institute<span class="pron">(<span class="underline"></span>nsttjut<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for institute" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/289/28934/28934.mp3"></a>
</span></span><span class="pron">; <span class="lbl geo">US</span> -tut<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for institute" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/690/69092/69092.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">institutes</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for institute" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/289/28936/28936.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">instituting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for institute" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/289/28937/28937.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">instituted</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for institute" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/289/28935/28935.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="institute_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>institute</strong> is an organization set up to do a particular type of work, especially research or
               teaching. You can also use <strong>institute</strong> to refer to the building the organization occupies.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...an elite research institute devoted to computer software.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="institute_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>institute</strong> a system, rule, or course of action, you start it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="instrument_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">instrument<span class="pron">(<span class="underline"></span>nstrmnt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for instrument" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/289/28956/28956.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">instruments</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for instrument" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/289/28964/28964.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="instrument_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>instrument</strong> is a tool or device that is used to do a particular task, especially a scientific
               task.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...instruments for cleaning and polishing teeth.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The environment itself will at the same time be measured by about 60 scientific instruments.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="instrument_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A musical <strong>instrument</strong> is an object such as a piano, guitar, or flute, which you play in order to produce
               music.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Learning a musical instrument introduces a child to an understanding of music.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="instrument_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>instrument</strong> is a device that is used for making measurements of something such as speed, height,
               or sound, for example on a ship or plane or in a car.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...crucial instruments on the control panel.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="instrument_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Something that is an <strong>instrument</strong> for achieving a particular aim is used by people to achieve that aim.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The veto has been a traditional instrument of diplomacy for centuries.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="instrument_1.10" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="stringed-instrument#stringed-instrument_1">stringed instrument</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="wind-instrument#wind-instrument_1">wind instrument</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="initiative_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">initiative<span class="pron">(n<span class="underline"></span>tv<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for initiative" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/286/28676/28676.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">initiatives</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for initiative" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/286/28677/28677.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="initiative_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>initiative</strong> is an important act or statement that is intended to solve a problem.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Government initiatives to help young people have been inadequate.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  There's talk of a new peace initiative.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="initiative_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In a fight or contest, if you have <strong>the initiative</strong>, you are in a better position than your opponents to decide what to do next.</span><span class="orth"><q>  We have the initiative; we intend to keep it.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="initiative_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you have <strong>initiative</strong>, you have the ability to decide what to do next and to do it, without needing other
               people to tell you what to do.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She was disappointed by his lack of initiative.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="initiative_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>take the initiative</strong> in a situation, you are the first person to act, and are therefore able to control
               the situation.</span><span class="orth"><q>  We must take the initiative in the struggle to end the war.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="frame_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">frame<span class="pron">(fr<span class="underline">e</span>m<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for frame" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/223/22315/22315.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">frames</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for frame" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/223/22319/22319.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">framing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for frame" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/223/22326/22326.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">framed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for frame" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/223/22318/22318.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="frame_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>frame</strong> of a picture or mirror is the wood, metal, or plastic that is fitted around it, especially
               when it is displayed or hung on a wall.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Estelle kept a photograph of her mother in a silver frame on the kitchen mantelpiece.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a pair of picture frames.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="frame_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>frame</strong> of an object such as a building, chair, or window is the arrangement of wooden, metal,
               or plastic bars between which other material is fitted, and which give the object
               its strength and shape.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He supplied housebuilders with modern timber frames.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  We painted our table to match the window frame in the bedroom.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="frame_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>frames</strong> of a pair of glasses are all the metal or plastic parts of it, but not the lenses.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He was wearing new spectacles with gold wire frames.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="frame_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can refer to someone's body as their <strong>frame</strong>, especially when you are describing the general shape of their body.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Their belts are pulled tight against their bony frames.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="frame_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>frame</strong> of cinema film is one of the many separate photographs that it consists of.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Standard 8mm projects at 16 frames per second.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="frame_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When a picture or photograph <strong>is framed</strong>, it is put in a frame.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The picture is now ready to be mounted and framed.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  On the wall is a large framed photograph.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="frame_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If an object <strong>is framed</strong> by a particular thing, it is surrounded by that thing in a way that makes the object
               more striking or attractive to look at.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The swimming pool is framed by tropical gardens.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="frame_1.18" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>frames</strong> an innocent person, they make other people think that that person is guilty of a
               crime, by lying or inventing evidence.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I need to find out who tried to frame me.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="frame_1.20" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone is <strong>in the frame</strong> <strong>for</strong> something such as a job or position, they are being considered for it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  We need a win to keep us in the frame for the title.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="frame_1.22" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="cold-frame#cold-frame_1">cold frame</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="intent_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">intent<span class="pron">(nt<span class="underline">e</span>nt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for intent" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/290/29050/29050.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">intents</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for intent" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/290/29056/29056.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="intent_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are <strong>intent</strong> <strong>on</strong> doing something, you are eager and determined to do it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">on/upon</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The rebels are obviously intent on keeping up the pressure.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone does something in an <strong>intent</strong> way, they pay great attention to what they are doing.</span> (<span class="lbl register">written</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  She looked from one intent face to another.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">intently</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/290/29055/29055.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> after v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  He listened intently, then slammed down the phone.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="intent_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A person's <strong>intent</strong> is their intention to do something.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  ...a strong statement of intent on arms control.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="intent_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You say <strong>to all intents and purposes</strong> to suggest that a situation is not exactly as you describe it but the effect is the
               same as if it were.</span><span class="orth"><q>  To all intents and purposes he was my father.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="interior_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>interior</strong> of something is the inside part of it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The boat's interior badly needed painting.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="interior_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You use <strong>interior</strong> to describe something that is inside a building or vehicle.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The interior walls were painted green.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="interior_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>interior</strong> of a country or continent is the central area of it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The Yangzi river would give access to much of China's interior.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="interior_1.7" class="hom">

      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">

               law and order.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The French Interior Minister has intervened in a scandal over the role of a secret
                  police force.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="interior_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A country's minister or ministry of <strong>the interior</strong> deals with affairs within that country, such as law and order.</span><span class="orth"><q>  An official from the Ministry of the Interior said six people had died.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">interpreting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for interpret" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/292/29225/29225.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">interpreted</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for interpret" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/292/29222/29222.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="interpret_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>interpret</strong> something in a particular way, you decide that this is its meaning or significance.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">as</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The whole speech might well be interpreted as a coded message to the Americans.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The judge quite rightly says that he has to interpret the law as it's been passed.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Both approaches agree on what is depicted in the poem, but not on how it should be
                  interpreted.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="interpret_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>interpret</strong> what someone is saying, you translate it immediately into another language.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The chambermaid spoke little English, so her husband came with her to interpret.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Interpreters found they could not interpret half of what he said.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

   </ol>
   <div id="irritate_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span>

      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>irritates</strong> a part of your body, it causes it to itch or become sore.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Wear rubber gloves while chopping chillies as they can irritate the skin.</q></span></li>

    <a id="keen_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">keen<span class="pron">(k<span class="underline">i</span>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for keen" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/302/30252/30252.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">keener</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for keen" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/302/30254/30254.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">keenest</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for keen" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/302/30255/30255.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are <strong>keen</strong> <strong>on</strong> doing something, you very much want to do it. If you are <strong>keen</strong> <strong>that</strong> something should happen, you very much want it to happen.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">mainly British</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  You're not keen on going, are you?</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  I'm very keen that the European Union should be as open as possible to trade from
               Russia.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  She's still keen to keep in touch.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I am not keen for her to have a bicycle.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">keenness</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/302/30258/30258.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [oft <span class="smallcaps">N</span> to-inf]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...Doyle's keenness to please.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a keenness for the idea of a co-ordinated approach to development.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are <strong>keen on</strong> something, you like it a lot and are very enthusiastic about it.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">mainly British</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I got quite keen on the idea.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">keenness</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/302/30258/30258.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...his keenness for the arts.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="keen_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You use <strong>keen</strong> to indicate that someone has a lot of enthusiasm for a particular activity and spends
               a lot of time doing it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She was a keen amateur photographer.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you describe someone as <strong>keen</strong>, you mean that they have an enthusiastic nature and are interested in everything
            that they do.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He's a very keen student and works very hard.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">keenness</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/302/30258/30258.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the keenness of the students.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>keen</strong> interest or emotion is one that is very intense.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He had retained a keen interest in the progress of the work.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">keenly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/302/30257/30257.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj</span><span class="lbl syntax">, <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  She remained keenly interested in international affairs.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  This is a keenly awaited project.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="keen_1.24" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are a <strong>keen</strong> supporter of a cause, movement, or idea, you support it enthusiastically.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He's been a keen supporter of the Labour Party all his life.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone has a <strong>keen</strong> mind, you mean that they are very clever and aware of what is happening around them.</span><span class="orth"><q>  They described him as a man of keen intellect.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">keenly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/302/30257/30257.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj</span><span class="lbl syntax">, <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  They're keenly aware that whatever they decide will set a precedent.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you have a <strong>keen</strong> eye or ear, you are able to notice things that are difficult to detect.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...an amateur artist with a keen eye for detail.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">keenly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/302/30257/30257.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  Charles listened keenly.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>keen</strong> fight or competition is one in which the competitors are all trying very hard to
            win, and it is not easy to predict who will win.</span><span class="orth"><q>  There is expected to be a keen fight in the local elections.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">keenly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/302/30257/30257.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  The contest should be very keenly fought.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Keen</strong> prices are low and competitive.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">mainly British</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  The company negotiates very keen prices with their suppliers.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">keenly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/302/30257/30257.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> -ed]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  The shops also offer a keenly priced curtain-making service.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="keen_1.42" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone is <strong>mad keen</strong> <strong>on</strong> something, you are emphasizing that they are very enthusiastic about it.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>, <span class="lbl register">informal</span>, <span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  So you're not mad keen on science then?</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">implemented</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for implement" data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27818/27818.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">The verb is pronounced <span class="pron">(<span class="underline"></span>mplment<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/638/63868/63868.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span>. The noun is pronounced <span class="pron">(<span class="underline"></span>mplmnt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/638/63870/63870.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span>.
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>implement</strong> something such as a plan, you ensure that what has been planned is done.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The government promised to implement a new system to control financial loan institutions.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">implementation</span> <span class="orth"><span class="pron">(<span class="underline"></span>mplmnt<span class="underline">e</span><sup></sup>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/2/278/27817/27817.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Very little has been achieved in the implementation of the peace agreement signed
               last January.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="implement_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>implement</strong> is a tool or other piece of equipment.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  ...writing implements.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="leaf_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">leaf<span class="pron">(l<span class="underline">i</span>f<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for leaf" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/311/31157/31157.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">leaves</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for leaf" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/312/31241/31241.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">leafs</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for leaf" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/311/31167/31167.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">leafing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for leaf" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/311/31161/31161.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">leafed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for leaf" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/311/31160/31160.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="leaf_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>leaves</strong> of a tree or plant are the parts that are flat, thin, and usually green. Many trees
               and plants lose their leaves in the winter and grow new leaves in the spring.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  In the garden, the leaves of the horse chestnut had already fallen.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The Japanese maple that stands across the drive had just come into leaf.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="leaf_1.4" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="leaved#leaved_1">-leaved</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="leaf_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>leaf</strong> is one of the pieces of paper of which a book is made.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He flattened the wrappers and put them between the leaves of his book.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="leaf_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>take a leaf from</strong> someone's <strong>book</strong> you behave in the same way as them because you want to be like that person or as
               successful as they are.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Maybe we should take a leaf out of Branson's book. It's easy to see how he became
                  a billionaire.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="leaf_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that you are going to <strong>turn over a new leaf</strong>, you mean that you are going to start to behave in a better or more acceptable way.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He realized he was in the wrong and promised to turn over a new leaf.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="leaf-through#leaf-through_1">leaf through</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="lean_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">lean<span class="pron">(l<span class="underline">i</span>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for lean" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/311/31181/31181.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">leans</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for lean" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/311/31190/31190.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">leaning</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for lean" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/311/31188/31188.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">leaned</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for lean" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/311/31185/31185.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">leant</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for lean" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/311/31191/31191.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">leaner</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for lean" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/311/31186/31186.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">leanest</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for lean" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/311/31187/31187.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">American English uses the form <strong>leaned</strong> as the past tense and past participle. British English uses either <strong>leaned</strong> or <strong>leant</strong>.
   </div>
   <div id="lean_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>lean</strong> in a particular direction, you bend your body in that direction.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Eileen leaned across and opened the passenger door.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They stopped to lean over a gate.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="lean_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>lean</strong> <strong>on</strong> or <strong>against</strong> someone or something, you rest against them so that they partly support your weight.
               If you <strong>lean</strong> an object <strong>on</strong> or <strong>against</strong> something, you place the object so that it is partly supported by that thing.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She was feeling tired and was glad to lean against him.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Lean the plants against a wall and cover the roots with peat.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="lean_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you describe someone as <strong>lean</strong>, you mean that they are thin but look strong and healthy.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">approval</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  Like most athletes, she was lean and muscular.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  She watched the tall, lean figure step into the car.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="lean_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If meat is <strong>lean</strong>, it does not have very much fat.</span><span class="orth"><q>  It is a beautiful meat, very lean and tender.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="lean_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you describe an organization as <strong>lean</strong>, you mean that it has become more efficient and less wasteful by getting rid of staff,
               or by dropping projects which were unprofitable.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The value of the pound will force British companies to be leaner and fitter.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="lean_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you describe periods of time as <strong>lean</strong>, you mean that people have less of something such as money or are less successful
               than they used to be.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the lean years of the 1930s.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  With fewer tourists in town, the taxi trade is going through its leanest patch for
                  30 years.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="lean-on#lean-on_1">lean on</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="lean-towards#lean-towards_1">lean towards</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>

      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Leather</strong> is treated animal skin which is used for making shoes, clothes, bags, and furniture.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He wore a leather jacket and dark trousers.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...an impressive range of upholstered furniture, in a choice of fabrics and leathers.</q></span></li>

         </li>
      </ol>

   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="luggage_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. uncount noun</span>

      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Luggage</strong> is the suitcases and bags that you take with you when travel.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Leave your luggage in the hotel.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Each passenger was allowed two 30-kg pieces of luggage.</q></span></li>

   <div id="luggage_1.4" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="left-luggage#left-luggage_1">left luggage</a></span></span></div>
