    <a id="nest_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">nest<span class="pron">(n<span class="underline">e</span>st<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for nest" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/360/36028/36028.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">nests</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for nest" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/360/36038/36038.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">nesting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for nest" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/360/36032/36032.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">nested</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for nest" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/360/36031/36031.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="nest_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A bird's <strong>nest</strong> is the home that it makes to lay its eggs in.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I can see an eagle's nest on the rocks.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="nest_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When a bird <strong>nests</strong> somewhere, it builds a nest and settles there to lay its eggs.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Some species may nest in close proximity to each other.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ing]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...nesting sites.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="nest_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>nest</strong> is a home that a group of insects or other creatures make in order to live in and
               give birth to their young in.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">in</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Some solitary bees make their nests in burrows in the soil.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a rat's nest.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="nest_1.9" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="crows-nest#crows-nest_1">crow's nest</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="love-nest#love-nest_1">love nest</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="nest_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When children <strong>fly the nest</strong>, they leave their parents' home to live on their own.</span><span class="orth"><q>  When their children had flown the nest, he and his wife moved to a thatched cottage
                  in Dorset.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="nest_1.12" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="hornet#hornet_1">a hornet's nest</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="liability_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">liability<span class="pron">(l<span class="underline">a</span>b<span class="underline"></span>lti<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for liability" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/315/31507/31507.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">liabilities</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for liability" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/315/31506/31506.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="liability_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone or something is <strong>a</strong> <strong>liability</strong>, you mean that they cause a lot of problems or embarrassment.</span><span class="orth"><q>  As the president's prestige continues to fall, they're clearly beginning to consider
                  him a liability.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...what was once a vote catching policy, is now a political liability.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="liability_1.4" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A company's or organization's <strong>liabilities</strong> are the sums of money which it owes.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">business</span> (<span class="lbl subj">, or law</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  The company had assets of $138 million and liabilities of $120.5 million.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="liability_1.6" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="liable#liable_1">liable</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="liable_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">liable<span class="pron">(l<span class="underline">a</span>b<sup></sup>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for liable" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/315/31508/31508.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="liable_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When something <strong>is liable to</strong> happen, it is very likely to happen.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Only a small minority of the mentally ill are liable to harm themselves or others.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="liable_1.3" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If people or things are <strong>liable to</strong> something unpleasant, they are likely to experience it or do it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She will grow into a woman particularly liable to depression.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Steroids are used to reduce the inflammation, which makes the muscles of the airways
                  liable to constriction.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
   </h4>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are <strong>liable</strong> <strong>for</strong> something such as a debt, you are legally responsible for it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The airline's insurer is liable for damages to the victims' families.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  As the killings took place outside British jurisdiction, the Ministry of Defence could
               not be held liable.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">liability</span> <span class="orth"><span class="pron">(l<span class="underline">a</span>b<span class="underline"></span>lti<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/315/31507/31507.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  He is claiming damages from London Underground, which has admitted liability but disputes
               the amount of his claim.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="observation_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">observation<span class="pron">(<span class="underline"></span>bzv<span class="underline">e</span><sup></sup>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for observation" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/368/36858/36858.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">observations</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for observation" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/368/36860/36860.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="observation_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Observation</strong> is the action or process of carefully watching someone or something.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...careful observation of the movement of the planets.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  In hospital she'll be under observation all the time.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="observation_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>observation</strong> is something that you have learned by seeing or watching something and thinking about
               it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">about</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  This book contains observations about the causes of addictions.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="observation_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a person makes an <strong>observation</strong>, they make a comment about something or someone, usually as a result of watching
               how they behave.</span><span class="orth"><q>  'You're an obstinate man,' she said. 'Is that a criticism,' I said, 'or just an observation?'.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="observation_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Observation</strong> is the ability to pay a lot of attention to things and to notice more about them
               than most people do.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She has good powers of observation.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="occasion_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">occasion<span class="pron">(k<span class="underline">e</span><sup></sup>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for occasion" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/369/36920/36920.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">occasions</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for occasion" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/369/36925/36925.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="occasion_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>occasion</strong> is a time when something happens, or a case of it happening.</span><span class="orth"><q>  I often think fondly of an occasion some years ago at Covent Garden.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Mr Davis has been asked on a number of occasions.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="occasion_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>occasion</strong> is an important event, ceremony, or celebration.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Taking her with me on official occasions has been a challenge.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  It will be a unique family occasion.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="occasion_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> An <strong>occasion for</strong> doing something is an opportunity for doing it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  It is an occasion for all the family to celebrate.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  It is always an important occasion for setting out government policy.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="occasion_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>occasion</strong> something means to cause it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He argued that the release of hostages should not occasion a change in policy.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="occasion_1.12" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="sense-of-occasion#sense-of-occasion_1">sense of occasion</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="occasion_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>have occasion</strong> <strong>to</strong> do something, it is necessary for you to do it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  We have had occasion to deal with members of the group on a variety of charges.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="occasion_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something happens <strong>on occasion</strong>, it happens sometimes, but not very often.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He translated not only from the French but also, on occasion, from the Polish.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="occasion_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone <strong>rose to the occasion</strong>, you mean that they did what was necessary to successfully overcome a difficult situation.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Inverness, however, rose to the occasion in the second half, producing some of the
                  best football they have played for some time.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="opponent_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">opponent<span class="pron">(p<span class="underline">o</span>nnt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for opponent" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/374/37407/37407.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">opponents</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for opponent" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/374/37408/37408.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="opponent_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A politician's <strong>opponents</strong> are other politicians who belong to a different party or who have different aims
               or policies.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">in</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...Mr Kennedy's opponent in the leadership contest.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  He described the detention without trial of political opponents as a cowardly act.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="opponent_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In a sporting contest, your <strong>opponent</strong> is the person who is playing against you.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Norris twice knocked down his opponent in the early rounds of the fight.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="opponent_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>opponents</strong> <strong>of</strong> an idea or policy do not agree with it and do not want it to be carried out.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...opponents of the spread of nuclear weapons.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="opposition_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">opposition<span class="pron">(<span class="underline"></span>pz<span class="underline"></span><sup></sup>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for opposition" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/374/37426/37426.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">oppositions</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for opposition" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/374/37427/37427.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="opposition_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Opposition</strong> is strong, angry, or violent disagreement and disapproval.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The government is facing a new wave of opposition in the form of a student strike.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Much of the opposition to this plan has come from the media.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="opposition_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>The</strong> <strong>opposition</strong> is the political parties or groups that are opposed to a government.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The main opposition parties boycotted the election, saying it would not be conducted
                  fairly.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="opposition_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In a country's parliament or legislature, <strong>the</strong> <strong>opposition</strong> refers to the politicians or political parties that form part of the parliament or
               legislature, but are not the government.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the Leader of the Opposition.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="opposition_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>The</strong> <strong>opposition</strong> is the person or team you are competing against in a sports event.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Poland provide the opposition for the Scots' last warm-up match at home.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="pale_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">pale<span class="pron">(p<span class="underline">e</span>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pale" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/384/38457/38457.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">paler</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pale" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/384/38460/38460.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">palest</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pale" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/384/38462/38462.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">pales</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pale" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/384/38461/38461.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">paling</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pale" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/384/38472/38472.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">paled</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pale" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/384/38458/38458.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="pale_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something is <strong>pale</strong>, it is very light in colour or almost white.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Migrating birds filled the pale sky.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  As we age, our skin becomes paler.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Pale</strong> is also a combining form.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a pale-blue sailor dress.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone looks <strong>pale</strong>, their face looks a lighter colour than usual, usually because they are ill, frightened,
            or shocked.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She looked pale and tired.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">paleness</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/384/38459/38459.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [oft with poss]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...his paleness when he realized that he was bleeding.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="pale_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If one thing <strong>pales</strong> in comparison with another, it is made to seem much less important, serious, or good
               by it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  When someone you love has a life-threatening illness, everything else pales in comparison.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a soap opera against which other soaps pale into insignificance.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pale_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you think that someone's actions or behaviour are not acceptable, you can say that
               they are <strong>beyond the pale</strong>.</span><span class="orth"><q>  This sort of thing really is quite beyond the pale.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also +  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="parliament_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">parliament<span class="pron">(p<span class="underline"></span>lmnt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for parliament" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/388/38817/38817.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span><em class="italics"> or </em> Parliament
</h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">parliaments</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for parliament" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/388/38821/38821.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="parliament_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span>, <span class="pos">1. proper noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>parliament</strong> of some countries, for example Britain, is the group of people who make or change
               its laws, and decide what policies the country should follow.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Parliament today approved the policy, but it has not yet become law.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="parliament_1.3" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="houses-of-parliament#houses-of-parliament_1">Houses of Parliament</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="member-of-parliament#member-of-parliament_1">Member of Parliament</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="parliament_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A particular <strong>parliament</strong> is a particular period of time in which a parliament is doing its work, between two
               elections or between two periods of holiday.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The legislation is expected to be passed in the next parliament.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="mid-_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">mid-<span class="pron">(m<span class="underline"></span>d-<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for mid-" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/340/34092/34092.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="mid-_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">prefix</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Mid-</strong> is used to form nouns or adjectives that refer to the middle part of a particular
               period of time, or the middle point of a particular place.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the mid-eighteenth century.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Davis is in her mid-thirties.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the mid-west of America.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="passage_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">passage<span class="pron">(p<span class="underline"></span>sd<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for passage" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/389/38966/38966.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">passages</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for passage" data-src-mp3="/sounds/3/389/38967/38967.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="passage_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>passage</strong> is a long narrow space with walls or fences on both sides, which connects one place
               or room with another.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Harry stepped into the passage and closed the door behind him.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="passage_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>passage</strong> in a book, speech, or piece of music is a section of it that you are considering
               separately from the rest.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">from</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He reads a passage from Milton.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the passage in which Blake spoke of the world of imagination.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="passage_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>passage</strong> is a long narrow hole or tube in your body, which air or liquid can pass along.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...blocked nasal passages.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="passage_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>passage</strong> <strong>through</strong> a crowd of people or things is an empty space that allows you to move through them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">through</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He cleared a passage for himself through the crammed streets.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="passage_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>passage</strong> of someone or something is their movement from one place to another.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Germany had not requested Franco's consent for the passage of troops through Spain.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="passage_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>passage</strong> of someone or something is their progress from one situation or one stage in their
               development to another.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">from/to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the passage from school to college.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="passage_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>The passage of</strong> a period of time is its passing.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...an asset that increases in value with the passage of time.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="passage_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>passage</strong> is a journey by ship.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">from</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  We'd arrived the day before after a 10-hour passage from Swansea.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="passage_1.18" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are granted <strong>passage</strong> through a country or area of land, you are given permission to go through it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to/from</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Mr Thomas would be given safe passage to and from Jaffna.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="philosophy_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">philosophy<span class="pron">(fl<span class="underline"></span>sfi<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for philosophy" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/400/40065/40065.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">philosophies</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for philosophy" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/400/40060/40060.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="philosophy_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Philosophy</strong> is the study or creation of theories about basic things such as the nature of existence,
               knowledge, and thought, or about how people should live.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He studied philosophy and psychology at Cambridge.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...traditional Chinese philosophy.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="philosophy_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>philosophy</strong> is a particular set of ideas that a philosopher has.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the philosophies of Socrates, Plato, and Aristotle.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="philosophy_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>philosophy</strong> is a particular theory that someone has about how to live or how to deal with a particular
               situation.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The best philosophy is to change your food habits to a low-sugar, high-fibre diet.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also +  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="pile_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">pile<span class="pron">(p<span class="underline">a</span>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pile" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/403/40344/40344.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">piles</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pile" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/403/40347/40347.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">piling</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pile" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/403/40358/40358.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">piled</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pile" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/403/40346/40346.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="pile_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>pile of</strong> things is a mass of them that is high in the middle and has sloping sides.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a pile of sand.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The leaves had been swept into huge piles.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pile_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>pile of</strong> things is a quantity of things that have been put neatly somewhere so that each thing
               is on top of the one below.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a pile of boxes.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The clothes were folded in a neat pile.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pile_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>pile</strong> things somewhere, you put them there so that they form a pile.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He was piling clothes into the suitcase.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A few newspapers and magazines were piled on a table.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pile_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>is piled with</strong> things, it is covered or filled with piles of things.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Tables were piled high with local produce.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pile_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. quantifier</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you talk about a <strong>pile of</strong> something or <strong>piles of</strong> something, you mean a large amount of it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  ...a whole pile of disasters.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pile_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a group of people <strong>pile into</strong> or <strong>out of</strong> a vehicle, they all get into it or out of it in a disorganized way.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">into/out of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They all piled into Jerrold's car.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>  <em class="hi">in/out</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A fleet of police cars suddenly arrived. Dozens of officers piled out.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pile_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can refer to a large impressive building as a <strong>pile</strong>, especially when it is the home of a rich important person.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...some stately pile in the country.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pile_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Piles</strong> are wooden, concrete, or metal posts which are pushed into the ground and on which
               buildings or bridges are built. Piles are often used in very wet areas so that the
               buildings do not flood.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...settlements of wooden houses, set on piles along the shore.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pile_1.21" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. plural noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Piles</strong> are painful swellings that can appear in the veins inside a person's anus.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pile_1.22" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>pile</strong> of a carpet or of a fabric such as velvet is its soft surface. It consists of a lot
               of little threads standing on end.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the carpet's thick pile.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pile_1.24" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone who is <strong>at the bottom of the pile</strong> is low down in society or low down in an organization. Someone who is <strong>at the top of the pile</strong> is high up in society or high up in an organization.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="pile-up#pile-up_1">pile up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="pin_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">pin<span class="pron">(p<span class="underline"></span>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pin" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/404/40408/40408.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">pins</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pin" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/404/40482/40482.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">pinning</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pin" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/404/40474/40474.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">pinned</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pin" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/404/40472/40472.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="pin_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Pins</strong> are very small thin pointed pieces of metal. They are used in sewing to fasten pieces
               of material together until they have been sewn.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...needles and pins.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pin_1.3" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>pin</strong> something <strong>on</strong> or <strong>to</strong> something, you attach it with a pin, a drawing pin, or a safety pin.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They pinned a notice to the door.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n with adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He had pinned up a map of Finland.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pin_1.6" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>pins</strong> you to something, they press you against a surface so that you cannot move.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I pinned him against the wall.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She fought at the bulk that pinned her.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pin_1.9" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>pin</strong> is any long narrow piece of metal or wood that is not sharp, especially one that
               is used to fasten two things together.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the 18-inch steel pin holding his left leg together.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pin_1.11" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone tries to <strong>pin</strong> something <strong>on</strong> you or to <strong>pin the blame on</strong> you, they say, often unfairly, that you were responsible for something bad or illegal.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The trade unions are pinning the blame for the violence on the government.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pin_1.13" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>pin</strong> your hopes <strong>on</strong> something or <strong>pin</strong> your faith <strong>on</strong> something, you hope very much that it will produce the result you want.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The Democrats are pinning their hopes on the next election.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pin_1.15" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>pins</strong> their <strong>hair</strong> up or <strong>pins</strong> their <strong>hair</strong> back, they arrange their hair away from their face using hair pins.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n with adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Cleanse your face thoroughly and pin back your hair.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  In an effort to look older she has pinned her fair hair into a French pleat.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pin_1.18" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>pin</strong> is something worn on your clothing, for example as jewellery, which is fastened with
               a pointed piece of metal.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">US</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  ...necklaces, bracelets, and pins.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pin_1.20" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="drawing-pin#drawing-pin_1">drawing pin</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="pins-and-needles#pins-and-needles_1">pins and needles</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="rolling-pin#rolling-pin_1">rolling pin</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="safety-pin#safety-pin_1">safety pin</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="pin-down#pin-down_1">pin down</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="pin_2"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">PIN<span class="pron">(p<span class="underline"></span>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for PIN" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/404/40407/40407.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="pin_2.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">singular noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone's <strong>PIN</strong> or <strong>PIN number</strong> is a secret number which they can use, for example, with a bank card to withdraw
               money from a cash machine or ATM. <strong>PIN</strong> is an abbreviation for 'personal identification number'.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="crave_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">crave<span class="pron">(kr<span class="underline">e</span>v<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for crave" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/128/12863/12863.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">craves</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for crave" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/128/12866/12866.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">craving</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for crave" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/128/12867/12867.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">craved</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for crave" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/128/12864/12864.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>crave</strong> something, you want to have it very much.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  There may be certain times of day when smokers crave their cigarette.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  You may be craving for some fresh air.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> to-inf]</span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">craving</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/128/12867/12867.mp3"></a>
</span> ( <span class="infl">cravings</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for craving" data-src-mp3="/sounds/1/128/12868/12868.mp3"></a>
</span>)<span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">countable noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a craving for sugar.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...her craving to be loved.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="pint_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">pint<span class="pron">(p<span class="underline">a</span>nt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pint" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/404/40487/40487.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">pints</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pint" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/404/40488/40488.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="pint_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>pint</strong> is a unit of measurement for liquids. In Britain, it is equal to 568 cubic centimetres
               or one eighth of an imperial gallon. In America, it is equal to 473 cubic centimetres
               or one eighth of an American gallon.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a pint of milk.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The military requested 6,000 pints of blood from the American Red Cross.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pint_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you go for a <strong>pint</strong>, you go to the pub to drink a pint of beer or more.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>)
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="pole_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">pole<span class="pron">(p<span class="underline">o</span>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pole" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/411/41177/41177.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">poles</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pole" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/411/41192/41192.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="pole_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>pole</strong> is a long thin piece of wood or metal, used especially for supporting things.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The truck crashed into a telegraph pole.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  He reached up with a hooked pole to roll down the metal shutter.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pole_1.4" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The earth's <strong>poles</strong> are the two opposite ends of its axis, its most northern and southern points.</span><span class="orth"><q>  For six months of the year, there is hardly any light at the poles.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pole_1.6" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="north-pole#north-pole_1">North Pole</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="south-pole#south-pole_1">South Pole</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="pole_1.7" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The two <strong>poles</strong> of a range of qualities, opinions, or beliefs are the completely opposite qualities,
               opinions, or beliefs at either end of the range.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The two politicians represent opposite poles of the political spectrum.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pole_1.9" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that two people or things are <strong>poles apart</strong>, you mean that they have completely different beliefs, opinions, or qualities.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="pole_2"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">Pole<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/411/41176/41176.mp3"></a>
</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">Poles</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for Pole" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/411/41191/41191.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="pole_2.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>Pole</strong> is a person who comes from Poland.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="polish_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">polish<span class="pron">(p<span class="underline"></span>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for polish" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/412/41223/41223.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">polishes</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for polish" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/412/41227/41227.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">polishing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for polish" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/412/41228/41228.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">polished</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for polish" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/412/41226/41226.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="polish_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. variable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Polish</strong> is a substance that you put on the surface of an object in order to clean it, protect
               it, and make it shine.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The still air smelt faintly of furniture polish.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...soap powders, detergents, and polishes.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
   </h4>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>polish</strong> something, you put polish on it or rub it with a cloth to make it shine.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Each morning he shaved and polished his shoes.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Polish</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He gave his counter a polish with a soft duster.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">polished</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/412/41226/41226.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adjective</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a highly polished floor.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="polish_1.9" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. uncount noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone has <strong>polish</strong>, you mean that they show confidence and know how to behave socially.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">approval</span>)
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="polish_1.10" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. uncount noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that a performance or piece of work has <strong>polish</strong>, you mean that it is of a very high standard.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">approval</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  The opera lacks the polish of his later work.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="polish_1.12" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>polish</strong> your technique, performance, or skill at doing something, you work on improving it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They just need to polish their technique.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Polish up</strong> means the same as  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="polish#polish_1">polish</a></span></span>.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> <span class="smallcaps">P</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Polish up your writing skills on a one-week professional course.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n <span class="smallcaps">P</span>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="polish_1.15" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="polished#polished_1">polished</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="french-polish#french-polish_1">French polish</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="nail-polish#nail-polish_1">nail polish</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="polish-off#polish-off_1">polish off</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="polish-up#polish-up_1">polish up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="polish_2"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">Polish<span class="pron">(p<span class="underline">o</span>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for Polish" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/412/41222/41222.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="polish_2.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Polish</strong> means belonging or relating to Poland, or to its people, language, or culture.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="polish_2.2" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. uncount noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Polish</strong> is the language spoken in Poland.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

    <a id="preserve_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">preserve<span class="pron">(prz<span class="underline"></span>v<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for preserve" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/421/42165/42165.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">preserves</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for preserve" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/421/42167/42167.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">preserving</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for preserve" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/421/42168/42168.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">preserved</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for preserve" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/421/42166/42166.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>preserve</strong> a situation or condition, you make sure that it remains as it is, and does not change
            or end.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  We will do everything to preserve peace.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...an effort to fit in more students while preserving standards.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">preservation</span> <span class="orth"><span class="pron">(pr<span class="underline">e</span>zv<span class="underline">e</span><sup></sup>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/421/42158/42158.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the preservation of the status quo.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>preserve</strong> something, you take action to save it or protect it from damage or decay.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  We need to preserve the forest.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...perfectly preserved medieval houses.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">preservation</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/421/42158/42158.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the preservation of buildings of architectural or historic interest.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="preserve_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>preserve</strong> food, you treat it in order to prevent it from decaying so that you can store it
               for a long time.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I like to make puree, using only enough sugar to preserve the plums.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...preserved ginger in syrup.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="preserve_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. plural noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Preserves</strong> are foods such as jam that are made by cooking fruit with a large amount of sugar
               so that they can be stored for a long time.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="preserve_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that a job or activity is the <strong>preserve of</strong> a particular person or group of people, you mean that they are the only ones who
               take part in it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The conduct of foreign policy is largely the preserve of the president.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="preserve_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A nature <strong>preserve</strong> is an area of land or water where animals are protected from hunters.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">US</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  ...Pantanal, one of the world's great wildlife preserves.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="presumably_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">adverb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that something is <strong>presumably</strong> the case, you mean that you think it is very likely to be the case, although you
               are not certain.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">vagueness</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  He had gone to the reception desk, presumably to check out.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
