    <a id="priest_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">priest<span class="pron">(pr<span class="underline">i</span>st<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for priest" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/423/42334/42334.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">priests</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for priest" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/423/42339/42339.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="priest_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>priest</strong> is a member of the Christian clergy in the Catholic, Anglican, or Orthodox church.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He had trained to be a Catholic priest.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="priest_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In many non-Christian religions a <strong>priest</strong> is a man who has particular duties and responsibilities in a place where people worship.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="priest_1.4" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="high-priest#high-priest_1">high priest</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="prior_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">prior<span class="pron">(pr<span class="underline">a</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for prior" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/424/42419/42419.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="prior_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You use <strong>prior</strong> to indicate that something has already happened, or must happen, before another event
               takes place.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He claimed he had no prior knowledge of the protest.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The Constitution requires the president to seek the prior approval of Congress for
                  military action.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="prior_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>prior</strong> claim or duty is more important than other claims or duties and needs to be dealt
               with first.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The firm I wanted to use had prior commitments.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="prior_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span>, <span class="pos">3. title noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>prior</strong> is a monk who is in charge of a priory or a monk who is the second most important
               person in a monastery.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="prior_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something happens <strong>prior to</strong> a particular time or event, it happens before that time or event.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  Prior to his Japan trip, he went to New York.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="prompt_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">prompt<span class="pron">(pr<span class="underline"></span>mpt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for prompt" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/427/42765/42765.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">prompts</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for prompt" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/427/42770/42770.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">prompting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for prompt" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/427/42767/42767.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">prompted</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for prompt" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/427/42766/42766.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="prompt_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>prompt</strong> someone <strong>to</strong> do something means to make them decide to do it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n to-inf]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Japan's recession has prompted consumers to cut back on buying cars.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The need for villagers to control their own destinies has prompted a new plan.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="prompt_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>prompt</strong> someone when they stop speaking, you encourage or help them to continue. If you <strong>prompt</strong> an actor, you tell them what their next line is when they have forgotten what comes
               next.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> with quote]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  'Go on,' the therapist prompted him.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  How exactly did he prompt her, Mr Markham?</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="prompt_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>prompt</strong> action is done without any delay.</span><span class="orth"><q>  It is not too late, but prompt action is needed.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="prompt_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are <strong>prompt</strong> to do something, you do it without delay or you are not late.</span><span class="orth"><q>  You have been so prompt in carrying out all these commissions.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="prospect_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">prospect</h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">prospects</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">prospecting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for prospect" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/429/42915/42915.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">prospected</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for prospect" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/429/42914/42914.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">The noun is pronounced <span class="pron">(pr<span class="underline"></span>spekt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/640/64094/64094.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span><span class="pron">(<span class="lbl geo">US</span> pr<span class="underline"></span>-<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/7/704/70463/70463.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span>. The verb is pronounced <span class="pron">(prsp<span class="underline">e</span>kt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/640/64096/64096.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span><span class="pron">(<span class="lbl geo">US</span> pr<span class="underline"></span>spekt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/7/704/70464/70464.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span> and is hyphenated pro+spect.
   </div>
   <div id="prospect_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If there is some <strong>prospect</strong> <strong>of</strong> something happening, there is a possibility that it will happen.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Unfortunately, there is little prospect of seeing these big questions answered.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The prospects for peace in the country's eight-year civil war are becoming brighter.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  There is a real prospect that the bill will be defeated in parliament.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="prospect_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A particular <strong>prospect</strong> is something that you expect or know is going to happen.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They now face the prospect of having to wear a cycling helmet by law.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="prospect_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. plural noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone's <strong>prospects</strong> are their chances of being successful, especially in their career.</span><span class="orth"><q>  I chose to work abroad to improve my career prospects.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When people <strong>prospect for</strong> oil, gold, or some other valuable substance, they look for it in the ground or under
            the sea.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He had prospected for minerals everywhere from the Gobi Desert to the Transvaal.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  In fact, the oil companies are already prospecting not far from here.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">prospecting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/429/42915/42915.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  He was involved in oil, zinc and lead prospecting.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">prospector</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/429/42917/42917.mp3"></a>
</span> ( <span class="infl">prospectors</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for prospector" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/429/42918/42918.mp3"></a>
</span>)<span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">countable noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  The discovery of gold brought a flood of prospectors into the Territories.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="protest_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">protest</h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">protests</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">protesting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for protest" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/429/42975/42975.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">protested</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for protest" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/429/42972/42972.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">The verb is pronounced <span class="pron">(prt<span class="underline">e</span>st<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/641/64100/64100.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span>. The noun is pronounced <span class="pron">(pr<span class="underline">o</span>test<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/641/64102/64102.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span>.
   </div>
   <div id="protest_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>protest</strong> <strong>against</strong> something or <strong>about</strong> something, you say or show publicly that you object to it. In American English, you
               usually say that you <strong>protest</strong> it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">about/against/at</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Groups of women took to the streets to protest against the arrests.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">about/against/at</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The students were protesting at overcrowding in the university hostels.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They were protesting soaring prices.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He picked up the cat before Rosa could protest.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="protest_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>protest</strong> is the act of saying or showing publicly that you object to something.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">against</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The opposition now seems too weak to stage any serious protests against the government.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">at</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The unions called a two-hour strike in protest at the railway authority's announcement.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a protest march.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also +  <em class="hi">about</em>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="protest_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>protest</strong> <strong>that</strong> something is the case, you insist that it is the case, when other people think that
               it may not be.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> that]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  When we tried to protest that Mo was beaten up they didn't believe us.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> with quote]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  'I never said any of that to her,' he protested.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He has always protested his innocence.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="publicity_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">publicity<span class="pron">(pbl<span class="underline"></span>sti<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for publicity" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/431/43192/43192.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="publicity_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Publicity</strong> is information or actions that are intended to attract the public's attention to
               someone or something.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Much advance publicity was given to the talks.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  It was all a publicity stunt.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="publicity_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When the news media and the public show a lot of interest in something, you can say
               that it is receiving <strong>publicity</strong>.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The case has generated enormous publicity in Brazil.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the renewed publicity over the Casey affair.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

    <a id="pursue_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">pursue<span class="pron">(psj<span class="underline">u</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pursue" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/434/43478/43478.mp3"></a>
</span></span><span class="pron">; -s<span class="underline">u</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">pursues</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pursue" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/434/43482/43482.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">pursuing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pursue" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/434/43483/43483.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">pursued</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pursue" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/434/43479/43479.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="pursue_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>pursue</strong> an activity, interest, or plan, you carry it out or follow it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He said Japan would continue to pursue the policies laid down at the London summit.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She had come to England to pursue an acting career.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pursue_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>pursue</strong> a particular aim or result, you make efforts to achieve it, often over a long period
               of time.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Mr. Menendez has aggressively pursued new business.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pursue_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>pursue</strong> a particular topic, you try to find out more about it by asking questions.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  If your original request is denied, don't be afraid to pursue the matter.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pursue_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>pursue</strong> a person, vehicle, or animal, you follow them, usually in order to catch them.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She pursued the man who had stolen a woman's bag.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="rail_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">rail<span class="pron">(r<span class="underline">e</span>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rail" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/440/44060/44060.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">rails</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rail" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/440/44070/44070.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">railing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rail" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/440/44064/44064.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">railed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rail" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/440/44063/44063.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="rail_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>rail</strong> is a horizontal bar attached to posts or fixed round the edge of something as a fence
               or support.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She gripped the hand rail in the lift.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rail_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>rail</strong> is a horizontal bar that you hang things on.</span><span class="orth"><q>  This pair of curtains will fit a rail up to 7ft 6in wide.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rail_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Rails</strong> are the steel bars which trains run on.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The train left the rails but somehow forced its way back onto the line.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rail_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you travel or send something <strong>by</strong> <strong>rail</strong>, you travel or send it on a train.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The president traveled by rail to his home town.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rail_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>rail</strong> against something, you criticize it loudly and angrily.</span> (<span class="lbl register">written</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">against/at</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He railed against hypocrisy and greed.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rail_1.11" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="railing#railing_1">railing</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="rail_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something is <strong>back on the rails</strong>, it is beginning to be successful again after a period when it almost failed.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">journalism</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  They are keen to get the negotiating process back on the rails.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rail_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>goes off the rails</strong>, they start to behave in a way that other people think is unacceptable or very strange,
               for example they start taking drugs or breaking the law.</span><span class="orth"><q>  They've got to do something about these children because clearly they've gone off
                  the rails.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="raw_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">raw<span class="pron">(r<span class="underline"></span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for raw" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/443/44393/44393.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">rawer</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for raw" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/443/44394/44394.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">rawest</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for raw" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/443/44395/44395.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="raw_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Raw</strong> materials or substances are in their natural state before being processed or used
               in manufacturing.</span><span class="orth"><q>  We import raw materials and energy and export mainly industrial products.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...two ships carrying raw sugar from Cuba.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="raw_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Raw</strong> food is food that is eaten uncooked, that has not yet been cooked, or that has not
               been cooked enough.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a popular dish made of raw fish.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  This versatile vegetable can be eaten raw or cooked.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="raw_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a part of your body is <strong>raw</strong>, it is red and painful, perhaps because the skin has come off or has been burnt.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the drag of the rope against the raw flesh of my shoulders.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="raw_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Raw</strong> emotions are strong basic feelings or responses which are not weakened by other influences.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Her grief was still raw and he did not know how to help her.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="raw_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you describe something as <strong>raw</strong>, you mean that it is simple, powerful, and real.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the raw power of instinct.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="raw_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Raw</strong> data is facts or information that has not yet been sorted, analysed, or prepared
               for use.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Analyses were conducted on the raw data.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="raw_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you describe someone in a new job as <strong>raw</strong>, or as a <strong>raw</strong> recruit, you mean that they lack experience in that job.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...replacing experienced men with raw recruits.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="raw_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Raw</strong> weather feels unpleasantly cold.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a raw December morning.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="raw_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Raw</strong> sewage is sewage that has not been treated to make it cleaner.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...contamination of bathing water by raw sewage.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="raw_1.21" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that you are getting <strong>a raw deal</strong>, you mean that you are being treated unfairly.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  I think women have a raw deal.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="raw_1.23" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="nerve#nerve_1">touch a raw nerve</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="rear_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">rear<span class="pron">(r<span class="underline"></span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rear" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/445/44546/44546.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">rears</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rear" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/445/44568/44568.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">rearing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rear" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/445/44556/44556.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">reared</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rear" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/445/44550/44550.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="rear_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>rear</strong> of something such as a building or vehicle is the back part of it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He settled back in the rear of the taxi.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a stairway in the rear of the building.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Rear</strong> is also an adjective.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Manufacturers have been obliged to fit rear seat belts in all new cars.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rear_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are at the <strong>rear</strong> of a moving line of people, you are the last person in it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Musicians played at the front and rear of the procession.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rear_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Your <strong>rear</strong> is the part of your body that you sit on.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  I turned away from the phone to see Lewis pat a waitress on her rear.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rear_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>rear</strong> children, you look after them until they are old enough to look after themselves.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She reared sixteen children, six her own and ten her husband's.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rear_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>rear</strong> a young animal, you keep and look after it until it is old enough to be used for
               work or food, or until it can look after itself.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">mainly British</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She spends a lot of time rearing animals.</q></span><div class="semantic">in AM, usually use <strong>raise</strong></div>
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rear_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When a horse <strong>rears</strong>, it moves the front part of its body upwards, so that its front legs are high in
               the air and it is standing on its back legs.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The horse reared and threw off its rider.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rear_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that something such as a building or mountain <strong>rears</strong> above you, you mean that is very tall and close to you.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The exhibition hall reared above me behind a high fence.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rear_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a person or vehicle <strong>is</strong> <strong>bringing up the rear</strong>, they are the last person or vehicle in a moving line of them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...police motorcyclists bringing up the rear of the procession.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rear_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something unpleasant <strong>rears its head</strong> or <strong>rears its ugly head</strong>, it becomes visible or noticeable.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The threat of strikes reared its head again this summer.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="pill_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">pill<span class="pron">(p<span class="underline"></span>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pill" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/403/40360/40360.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">pills</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for pill" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/403/40387/40387.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="pill_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Pills</strong> are small solid round masses of medicine or vitamins that you swallow without chewing.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Why do I have to take all these pills?</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...sleeping pills.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pill_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a woman is <strong>on</strong> <strong>the pill</strong>, she takes a special pill that prevents her from becoming pregnant.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She had been on the pill for three years.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pill_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a person or group has to accept a failure or an unpleasant piece of news, you can
               say that it was <strong>a bitter pill</strong> or <strong>a bitter pill to swallow</strong>.</span><span class="orth"><q>  You're too old to be given a job. That's a bitter pill to swallow.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="pill_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone does something to <strong>sweeten the pill</strong> or <strong>sugar the pill</strong>, they do it to make some unpleasant news or an unpleasant measure more acceptable.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He sweetened the pill by increasing wages, although by slightly less than he raised
                  prices.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="premise_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">premise<span class="pron">(pr<span class="underline">e</span>ms<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for premise" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/420/42065/42065.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">premises</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for premise" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/420/42067/42067.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">The spelling <strong>premiss</strong> is also used in British English for meaning  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="premise#premise_1">2</a></span></span>.
   </div>
   <div id="premise_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. plural noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>premises</strong> of a business or an institution are all the buildings and land that it occupies in
               one place.</span><span class="orth"><q>  There is a kitchen on the premises.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The business moved to premises in Brompton Road.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="premise_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>premise</strong> is something that you suppose is true and that you use as a basis for developing
               an idea.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  The premise is that schools will work harder to improve if they must compete.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="refer_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">refer<span class="pron">(rf<span class="underline"></span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for refer" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/451/45124/45124.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">refers</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for refer" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/451/45142/45142.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">referring</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for refer" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/451/45141/45141.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">referred</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for refer" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/451/45140/45140.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="refer_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>refer</strong> <strong>to</strong> a particular subject or person, you talk about them or mention them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  In his speech, he referred to a recent trip to Canada.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="refer_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>refer</strong> <strong>to</strong> someone or something <strong>as</strong> a particular thing, you use a particular word, expression, or name to mention or
               describe them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Marcia had referred to him as a dear friend.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="refer_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a word <strong>refers</strong> <strong>to</strong> a particular thing, situation, or idea, it describes it in some way.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The term electronics refers to electrically-induced action.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="refer_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a person who is ill <strong>is referred</strong> <strong>to</strong> a hospital or a specialist, they are sent there by a doctor in order to be treated.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Patients are mostly referred to hospital by their general practitioners.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The patient should be referred for tests immediately.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="refer_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>refer</strong> a task or a problem <strong>to</strong> a person or an organization, you formally tell them about it, so that they can deal
               with it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He could refer the matter to the high court.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="refer_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>refer</strong> someone <strong>to</strong> a person or organization, you send them there for the help they need.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Now and then I referred a client to him.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="refer_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>refer</strong> <strong>to</strong> a book or other source of information, you look at it in order to find something
               out.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He referred briefly to his notebook.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="refer_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>refer</strong> someone <strong>to</strong> a source of information, you tell them the place where they will find the information
               which they need or which you think will interest them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Mr Bryan also referred me to a book by the American journalist Anthony Scaduto.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="realistic_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">realistic<span class="pron">(r<span class="underline">i</span>l<span class="underline"></span>stk<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for realistic" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/445/44504/44504.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are <strong>realistic</strong> about a situation, you recognize and accept its true nature and try to deal with
            it in a practical way.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">about</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Police have to be realistic about violent crime.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  It's only realistic to acknowledge that something, some time, will go wrong.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">realistically</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/445/44505/44505.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [usu <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v</span><span class="lbl syntax">, oft <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  As an adult, you can assess the situation realistically.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="realistic_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Something such as a goal or target that is <strong>realistic</strong> is one which you can sensibly expect to achieve.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Establish deadlines that are more realistic.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You say that a painting, story, or film is <strong>realistic</strong> when the people and things in it are like people and things in real life.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...extraordinarily realistic paintings of Indians.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">realistically</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/445/44505/44505.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [usu <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  The film starts off realistically and then develops into a ridiculous fantasy.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
</div></div>

</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">reformed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for reform" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/452/45200/45200.mp3"></a>

<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="reform_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. variable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Reform</strong> consists of changes and improvements to a law, social system, or institution. A <strong>reform</strong> is an instance of such a change or improvement.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The party embarked on a programme of economic reform.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The Socialists introduced fairly radical reforms.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="reform_1.4" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>reforms</strong> something such as a law, social system, or institution, they change or improve it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...his plans to reform the country's economy.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A reformed party would have to win the approval of the people.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
   </h4>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When someone <strong>reforms</strong> or when something <strong>reforms</strong> them, they stop doing things that society does not approve of, such as breaking the
            law or drinking too much alcohol.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  When his court case was coming up, James promised to reform.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  We will try to reform him within the community.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">reformed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/452/45200/45200.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adjective</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [usu <span class="smallcaps">ADJ</span> n]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a reformed alcoholic.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="reform_1.12" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="re-form#re-form_1">re-form</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="re-form_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">re-form<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/451/45196/45196.mp3"></a>
</span><em class="italics"> or </em> reform
</h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">re-forms</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for re-form" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/452/45208/45208.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">re-forming</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for re-form" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/452/45203/45203.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">re-formed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for re-form" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/451/45199/45199.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="re-form_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When an organization, group, or shape <strong>re-forms</strong>, or when someone <strong>re-forms</strong> it, it is created again after a period during which it did not exist or existed in
               a different form.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The official trades union council voted to disband itself and re-form as a confederation.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The 40-year-old singer reformed his band.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="refusal_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone's <strong>refusal</strong> <strong>to</strong> do something is the fact of them showing or saying that they will not do it, allow
               it, or accept it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...her refusal to accept change.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="refusal_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone has <strong>first refusal</strong> on something that is being sold or offered, they have the right to decide whether
               or not to buy it or take it before it is offered to anyone else.</span><span class="orth"><q>  A tenant may have a right of first refusal if a property is offered for sale.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

   <div class="semantic">The verb is pronounced <span class="pron">(rfj<span class="underline">u</span>z<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/641/64146/64146.mp3"></a>

   <div id="refuse_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>refuse</strong> <strong>to</strong> do something, you deliberately do not do it, or you say firmly that you will not
               do it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> to-inf]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He refused to comment after the trial.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He expects me to stay on here and I can hardly refuse.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="refuse_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>refuses</strong> you something, they do not give it to you or do not allow you to have it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The United States has refused him a visa.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The town council had refused permission for the march.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="refuse_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>refuse</strong> something that is offered to you, you do not accept it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The patient has the right to refuse treatment.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="refuse_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Refuse</strong> consists of the rubbish and all the things that are not wanted in a house, shop,
               or factory, and that are regularly thrown away; used mainly in official language.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The District Council made a weekly collection of refuse.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>

</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">resisted</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for resist" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/461/46100/46100.mp3"></a>

<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="resist_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>resist</strong> something such as a change, you refuse to accept it and try to prevent it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n/v-ing]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She says she will resist a single European currency being imposed.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They resisted our attempts to modernize the distribution of books.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="resist_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>resist</strong> someone or <strong>resist</strong> an attack by them, you fight back against them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The man was shot outside his house as he tried to resist arrest.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  When she had attempted to cut his nails he resisted.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="resist_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>resist</strong> doing something, or <strong>resist</strong> the temptation to do it, you stop yourself from doing it although you would like
               to do it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Students should resist the temptation to focus on exams alone.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> v-ing]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="resist_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone or something <strong>resists</strong> damage of some kind, they are not damaged.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...bodies trained and toughened to resist the cold.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>resolve</strong> a problem, argument, or difficulty means to find a solution to it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  We must find a way to resolve these problems before it's too late.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="resolve_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>resolve</strong> <strong>to</strong> do something, you make a firm decision to do it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> to-inf]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She resolved to report the matter to the hospital's nursing manager.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> that]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She resolved that, if Mimi forgot this promise, she would remind her.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="resolve_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Resolve</strong> is determination to do what you have decided to do.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  This will strengthen the American public's resolve to go to war.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

    <a id="resort_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">resort<span class="pron">(rz<span class="underline"></span>t<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for resort" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/461/46125/46125.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">resorts</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for resort" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/461/46128/46128.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">resorting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for resort" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/461/46127/46127.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">resorted</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for resort" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/461/46126/46126.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="resort_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>resort</strong> <strong>to</strong> a course of action that you do not really approve of, you adopt it because you cannot
               see any other way of achieving what you want.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His punishing work schedule had made him resort to drugs.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="resort_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you achieve something without <strong>resort</strong> <strong>to</strong> a particular course of action, you succeed without carrying out that action. To have
               <strong>resort</strong> <strong>to</strong> a particular course of action means to have to do that action in order to achieve
               something.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Congress has a responsibility to ensure that all peaceful options are exhausted before
                  resort to war.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="resort_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>resort</strong> is a place where a lot of people spend their holidays.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the ski resorts.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="resort_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you do something <strong>as a last resort</strong>, you do it because you can find no other way of getting out of a difficult situation
               or of solving a problem.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Nuclear weapons should be used only as a last resort.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="resort_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You use <strong>in the last resort</strong> when stating the most basic or important fact that will still be true in a situation
               whatever else happens.</span><span class="orth"><q>  They would in the last resort support their friends whatever they did.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">retaining</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for retain" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/462/46278/46278.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">retained</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for retain" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/462/46275/46275.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="retain_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>retain</strong> something means to continue to have that thing.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The interior of the shop still retains a nineteenth-century atmosphere.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="retain_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>retain</strong> a lawyer, you pay him or her a fee to make sure that he or she will represent you
               when your case comes before the court.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">law</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He decided to retain him for the trial.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">reservations</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for reservation" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/460/46041/46041.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="reservation_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you have <strong>reservations</strong> <strong>about</strong> something, you are not sure that it is entirely good or right.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">about</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I told him my main reservation about his film was the ending.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="reservation_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you make a <strong>reservation</strong>, you arrange for something such as a table in a restaurant or a room in a hotel to
               be kept for you.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He went to the desk to make a reservation.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="reservation_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>reservation</strong> is an area of land that is kept separate for a particular group of people to live
               in.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Seventeen thousand Indians live in Arizona on a reservation.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="reservation_1.7" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="central-reservation#central-reservation_1">central reservation</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
