<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">reveals</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for reveal" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/464/46439/46439.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">revealing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for reveal" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/464/46437/46437.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">revealed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for reveal" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/464/46436/46436.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="reveal_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>reveal</strong> something means to make people aware of it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She has refused to reveal the whereabouts of her daughter.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> that]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A survey of the British diet has revealed that a growing number of people are overweight.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> wh]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  No test will reveal how much of the drug was taken.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also  <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed  <em class="hi">as</em> n]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="reveal_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>reveal</strong> something that has been out of sight, you uncover it so that people can see it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A grey carpet was removed to reveal the original pine floor.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

    <a id="revise_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">revise<span class="pron">(rv<span class="underline">a</span>z<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for revise" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/465/46509/46509.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">revises</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for revise" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/465/46511/46511.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">revising</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for revise" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/465/46512/46512.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">revised</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for revise" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/465/46510/46510.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="revise_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>revise</strong> the way you think about something, you adjust your thoughts, usually in order to
               make them better or more suited to how things are.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He soon came to revise his opinion of the profession.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="revise_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>revise</strong> a price, amount, or estimate, you change it to make it more fair, realistic, or accurate.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They realised that some of their prices were higher than their competitors' and revised
                  prices accordingly.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="revise_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>revise</strong> an article, a book, a law, or a piece of music, you change it in order to improve
               it, make it more modern, or make it more suitable for a particular purpose.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Three editors handled the work of revising the articles for publication.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The staff should work together to revise the school curriculum.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="revise_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>revise</strong> <strong>for</strong> an examination, you read things again and make notes in order to be prepared for
               the examination.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I have to revise for maths.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I'd better skip the party and stay at home to revise.</q></span><div class="semantic">in AM, use <strong>review</strong></div>
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

    <a id="rid_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">rid<span class="pron">(r<span class="underline"></span>d<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rid" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/466/46679/46679.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">rids</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rid" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/467/46705/46705.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">ridding</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rid" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/466/46683/46683.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">The form <strong>rid</strong> is used in the present tense and is the past tense and past participle of the verb.
   </div>
   <div id="rid_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>get rid of</strong> something that you do not want or do not like, you take action so that you no longer
               have it or suffer from it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The owner needs to get rid of the car for financial reasons.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rid_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>get rid of</strong> someone who is causing problems for you or who you do not like, you do something
               to prevent them affecting you any more, for example by making them leave.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He believed that his manager wanted to get rid of him for personal reasons.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rid_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>rid</strong> a place or person <strong>of</strong> something undesirable or unwanted, you succeed in removing it completely from that
               place or person.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The proposals are an attempt to rid the country of political corruption.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rid_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>rid</strong> <strong>yourself</strong> <strong>of</strong> something you do not want, you take action so that you no longer have it or are no
               longer affected by it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl +  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Why couldn't he ever rid himself of those thoughts, those worries?</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rid_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>are rid of</strong> someone or something that you did not want or that caused problems for you, they
               are no longer with you or causing problems for you.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The family had sought a way to be rid of her and the problems she had caused them.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="ride_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">ride<span class="pron">(r<span class="underline">a</span>d<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for ride" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/466/46689/46689.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">rides</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for ride" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/466/46694/46694.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">riding</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for ride" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/467/46704/46704.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">rode</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for ride" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/470/47033/47033.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">ridden</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for ride" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/466/46682/46682.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="ride_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>ride</strong> a horse, you sit on it and control its movements.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I saw a girl riding a horse.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Can you ride?</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He was riding on his horse looking for the castle.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They still ride around on horses.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="ride_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>ride</strong> a bicycle or a motorcycle, you sit on it, control it, and travel along on it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Riding a bike is great exercise.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Two men riding on motorcycles opened fire on him.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He rode to work on a bicycle.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="ride_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>ride</strong> <strong>in</strong> a vehicle such as a car, you travel in it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">in/on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He prefers travelling on the Tube to riding in a limousine.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I remember the village full of American servicemen riding around in jeeps.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="ride_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>ride</strong> is a journey on a horse or bicycle, or in a vehicle.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Would you like to go for a ride?</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="ride_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In a fairground, a <strong>ride</strong> is a large machine that people ride on for fun.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="ride_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that one thing <strong>is riding on</strong> another, you mean that the first thing depends on the second thing.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Billions of pounds are riding on the outcome of the election.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="ride_1.18" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="riding#riding_1">riding</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="ride_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone or something <strong>is riding high</strong>, you mean that they are popular or successful at the present time.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He was riding high in the public opinion polls.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="ride_1.21" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone faces <strong>a rough ride</strong>, you mean that things are going to be difficult for them because people will criticize
               them a lot or treat them badly.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  The Chancellor could face a rough ride unless the plan works.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="ride_1.23" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone <strong>has been taken for a ride</strong>, you mean that they have been deceived or cheated.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  When he had not returned with my money an hour later I realized that I had been taken
                  for a ride.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="ride_1.25" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="roughshod#roughshod_1">to ride roughshod over</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="ride-out#ride-out_1">ride out</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="ride-up#ride-up_1">ride up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>

    <a id="rival_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">rival<span class="pron">(r<span class="underline">a</span>v<sup></sup>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rival" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/469/46907/46907.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">rivals</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rival" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/469/46912/46912.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">rivalling</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rival" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/469/46909/46909.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">rivalled</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for rival" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/469/46908/46908.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">in AM, use <strong>rivaling</strong>, <strong>rivaled</strong></div>
   <div id="rival_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Your <strong>rival</strong> is a person, business, or organization who you are competing or fighting against
               in the same area or for the same things.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The world champion finished more than two seconds ahead of his nearest rival.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rival_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone or something has <strong>no</strong> <strong>rivals</strong> or is <strong>without</strong> <strong>rival</strong>, you mean that it is best of its type.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a wonderfully fragrant wine which has no rivals in the Rhone.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="rival_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that one thing <strong>rivals</strong> another, you mean that they are both of the same standard or quality.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Cassette recorders cannot rival the sound quality of CDs.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

    <a id="sack_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">sack<span class="pron">(s<span class="underline"></span>k<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sack" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/476/47649/47649.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">sacks</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sack" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/476/47656/47656.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">sacking</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sack" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/476/47654/47654.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">sacked</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sack" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/476/47651/47651.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="sack_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>sack</strong> is a large bag made of rough woven material. Sacks are used to carry or store things
               such as vegetables or coal.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a sack of potatoes.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sack_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If your employers <strong>sack</strong> you, they tell you that you can no longer work for them because you have done something
               that they did not like or because your work was not good enough.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">business</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Earlier today the Prime Minister sacked 18 government officials for corruption.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Sack</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  People who make mistakes can be given the sack the same day.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sack_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Some people refer to bed as <strong>the sack</strong>.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="scare_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">scare<span class="pron">(sk<span class="underline">e</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for scare" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/482/48259/48259.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">scares</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for scare" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/482/48268/48268.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">scaring</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for scare" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/482/48274/48274.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">scared</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for scare" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/482/48266/48266.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="scare_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>scares</strong> you, it frightens or worries you.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  You're scaring me.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n adj]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The prospect of failure scares me rigid.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n to-inf]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  It scared him to realise how close he had come to losing everything.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
      <div id="scare_1.5" class="hom">
         <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">phrase</span> 
         </h3>
         <ol class="sense_list level_0">
            <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you want to emphasize that something scares you a lot, you can say that it <strong>scares the hell out of</strong> you or <strong>scares the life out of</strong> you.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>, <span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)
            </li>
         </ol>
      </div>
   </div>
   <div id="scare_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a sudden unpleasant experience gives you a <strong>scare</strong>, it frightens you.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Don't you realize what a scare you've given us all?</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  We got a bit of a scare.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="scare_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>scare</strong> is a situation in which many people are afraid or worried because they think something
               dangerous is happening which will affect them all.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the doctor at the centre of an Aids scare.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="scare_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A bomb <strong>scare</strong> or a security <strong>scare</strong> is a situation in which there is believed to be a bomb in a place.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Despite many recent bomb scares, no one has yet been hurt.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="scare_1.13" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="scared#scared_1">scared</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="scare-away#scare-away_1">scare away</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="scare-off#scare-off_1">scare off</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="scare-up#scare-up_1">scare up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>

    <a id="secretary_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">secretary<span class="pron">(s<span class="underline">e</span>krtri<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for secretary" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/489/48927/48927.mp3"></a>
</span></span><span class="pron">; <span class="lbl geo">US</span> -teri<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for secretary" data-src-mp3="/sounds/6/699/69949/69949.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">secretaries</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for secretary" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/489/48924/48924.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="secretary_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>secretary</strong> is a person who is employed to do office work, such as typing letters, answering
               phone calls, and arranging meetings.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="secretary_1.2" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>secretary</strong> of an organization such as a trade union, a political party, or a club is its official
               manager.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  My grandfather was secretary of the Scottish Miners' Union.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="secretary_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>secretary</strong> of a company is the person who has the legal duty of keeping the company's records.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="secretary_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span>, <span class="pos">4. title noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Secretary</strong> is used in the titles of ministers and officials who are in charge of main government
               departments.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the British Foreign Secretary.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...Defense Secretary Caspar Weinberger.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="senator_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">countable noun</span>, <span class="pos">title noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>senator</strong> is a member of a political Senate, for example in the United States or Australia.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>

<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="scream_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">scream<span class="pron">(skr<span class="underline">i</span>m<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for scream" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/485/48575/48575.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">screams</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for scream" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/485/48579/48579.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">screaming</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for scream" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/485/48577/48577.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">screamed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for scream" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/485/48576/48576.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="scream_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When someone <strong>screams</strong>, they make a very loud, high-pitched cry, for example because they are in pain or
               are very frightened.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Women were screaming; some of the houses nearest the bridge were on fire.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">in</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He staggered around the playground, screaming in agony.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Scream</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Hilda let out a scream.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...screams of terror.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="scream_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>scream</strong> something, you shout it in a loud, high-pitched voice.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> with quote]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  'Brigid!' she screamed. 'Get up!'</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They started screaming abuse at us.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="scream_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When something makes a loud, high-pitched noise, you can say that it <strong>screams</strong>.</span> (<span class="lbl register">written</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She slammed the car into gear, the tyres screaming as her foot jammed against the
                  accelerator.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  As he talked, an airforce jet screamed over the town.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Scream</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  There was a scream of brakes from the carriageway outside.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="sensible_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">sensible<span class="pron">(s<span class="underline">e</span>nsb<sup></sup>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sensible" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/493/49324/49324.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Sensible</strong> actions or decisions are good because they are based on reasons rather than emotions.</span><span class="orth"><q>  It might be sensible to get a solicitor.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The sensible thing is to leave them alone.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...sensible advice.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">sensibly</span> <span class="orth"><span class="pron">(s<span class="underline">e</span>nsbli<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/493/49325/49325.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  He sensibly decided to lie low for a while.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="sensible_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Sensible</strong> people behave in a sensible way.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She was a sensible girl and did not panic.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">about</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Oh come on, let's be sensible about this.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Sensible</strong> shoes or clothes are practical and strong rather than fashionable and attractive.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Wear loose clothing and sensible footwear.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">sensibly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/493/49325/49325.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> after v</span><span class="lbl syntax">, <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> -ed]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  They were not sensibly dressed.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="servant_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">servant<span class="pron">(s<span class="underline"></span>v<sup></sup>nt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for servant" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/494/49458/49458.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">servants</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for servant" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/494/49459/49459.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="servant_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>servant</strong> is someone who is employed to work at another person's home, for example as a cleaner
               or a gardener.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="servant_1.2" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can use <strong>servant</strong> to refer to someone or something that provides a service for people or can be used
               by them.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The question is whether technology is going to be our servant or our master.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="servant_1.4" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="civil-servant#civil-servant_1">civil servant</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="shot_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">shot<span class="pron">(<span class="underline"></span>t<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for shot" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/501/50119/50119.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">shots</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for shot" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/501/50125/50125.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="shot_1.1" class="hom"><span class="gramGrp"></span><ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Shot</strong> is the past tense and past participle of  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="shoot#shoot_1">shoot</a></span></span>.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shot_1.2" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>shot</strong> is an act of firing a gun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He had murdered Perceval at point blank range with a single shot.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  A man fired a volley of shots at them.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shot_1.5" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone who is a good <strong>shot</strong> can shoot well. Someone who is a bad <strong>shot</strong> cannot shoot well.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He was not a particularly good shot because of his eyesight.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shot_1.7" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In sports such as football, golf, or tennis, a <strong>shot</strong> is an act of kicking, hitting, or throwing the ball, especially in an attempt to
               score a point.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">at</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He had only one shot at goal.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shot_1.9" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>shot</strong> is a photograph or a particular sequence of pictures in a film.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a shot of a fox peering from the bushes.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shot_1.11" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you have a <strong>shot at</strong> something, you attempt to do it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">at</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The heavyweight champion will be given a shot at Holyfield's world title.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shot_1.13" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>shot</strong> <strong>of</strong> a drug is an injection of it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He administered a shot of Nembutal.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shot_1.15" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>shot</strong> <strong>of</strong> a strong alcoholic drink is a small glass of it.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">US</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a shot of vodka.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shot_1.17" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>give</strong> something your <strong>best shot</strong>, you do it as well as you possibly can.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  I don't expect to win. But I am going to give it my best shot.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shot_1.19" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The person who <strong>calls the shots</strong> is in a position to tell others what to do.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The directors call the shots and nothing happens without their say-so.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shot_1.21" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you do something <strong>like a shot</strong>, you do it without any delay or hesitation.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  I heard the key turn in the front door and I was out of bed like a shot.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shot_1.23" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">12. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you describe something as <strong>a</strong> <strong>long shot</strong>, you mean that it is unlikely to succeed, but is worth trying.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The deal was a long shot, but Bagley had little to lose.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shot_1.25" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">13. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> People sometimes use the expression <strong>by a long shot</strong> to emphasize the opinion they are giving.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  The missile-reduction treaty makes sweeping cuts, but the arms race isn't over by
                  a long shot.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shot_1.27" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">14. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>is shot through with</strong> an element or feature, it contains a lot of that element or feature.</span><span class="orth"><q>  This is an argument shot through with inconsistency.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shot_1.29" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="dark#dark_1">a shot in the dark</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="shoot_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">shoot<span class="pron">(<span class="underline">u</span>t<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for shoot" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/500/50009/50009.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">shoots</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for shoot" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/500/50024/50024.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">shooting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for shoot" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/500/50014/50014.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">shot</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for shoot" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/501/50119/50119.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="shoot_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>shoots</strong> a person or an animal, they kill them or injure them by firing a bullet or arrow
               at them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The police had orders to shoot anyone who attacked them.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed with adj]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The man was shot dead by the police during a raid on his house.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">in</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Her father shot himself in the head with a shotgun.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shoot_1.5" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>shoot</strong> means to fire a bullet from a weapon such as a gun.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He taunted armed officers by pointing to his head, as if inviting them to shoot.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">at</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The police came around the corner and they started shooting at us.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She had never been able to shoot straight.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shoot_1.9" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone or something <strong>shoots</strong> in a particular direction, they move in that direction quickly and suddenly.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They had almost reached the boat when a figure shot past them.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shoot_1.11" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>shoot</strong> something somewhere or if it <strong>shoots</strong> somewhere, it moves there quickly and suddenly.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Masters shot a hand across the table and gripped his wrist.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  You'd turn on the water, and it would shoot straight up in the air.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shoot_1.14" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>shoot</strong> a look at someone, you look at them quickly and briefly, often in a way that expresses
               your feelings.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Mary Ann shot him a rueful look.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">at</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The man in the black overcoat shot a penetrating look at the other man.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shoot_1.17" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>shoots</strong> <strong>to</strong> fame, they become famous or successful very quickly.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Alina Reyes shot to fame a few years ago with her extraordinary first novel.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shoot_1.19" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When people <strong>shoot</strong> a film or <strong>shoot</strong> photographs, they make a film or take photographs using a camera.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He'd love to shoot his film in Cuba.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Shoot</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a barn presently being used for a video shoot.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shoot_1.22" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Shoots</strong> are plants that are beginning to grow, or new parts growing from a plant or tree.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shoot_1.23" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In sports such as football or basketball, when someone <strong>shoots</strong>, they try to score by kicking, throwing, or hitting the ball towards the goal.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Spencer scuttled away from Young to shoot wide when he should have scored.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span>, <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shoot_1.25" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="shooting#shooting_1">shooting</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="shot#shot_1">shot</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="shoot_1.26" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>shoot the breeze</strong> or <strong>shoot the bull</strong> <strong>with</strong> someone, you talk to them about things which are not very serious or important.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">mainly US</span>, <span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They expected me to sit up and shoot the breeze with them till one or two in the morning.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  I also met with Pollack again to kind of shoot the bull.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="shoot_1.29" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="hip#hip_1">to shoot from the hip</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="shoot-down#shoot-down_1">shoot down</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="shoot-up#shoot-up_1">shoot up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="sight_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">sight<span class="pron">(s<span class="underline">a</span>t<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sight" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/504/50425/50425.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">sights</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sight" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/504/50433/50433.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">sighting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sight" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/504/50427/50427.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">sighted</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sight" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/504/50426/50426.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="sight_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone's <strong>sight</strong> is their ability to see.</span><span class="orth"><q>  My sight is failing, and I can't see to read any more.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  I use the sense of sound much more than the sense of sight.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sight_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>The sight of</strong> something is the act of seeing it or an occasion on which you see it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I faint at the sight of blood.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The sight of him entering a room could flood her with desire.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sight_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>sight</strong> is something that you see.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  We encountered the pathetic sight of a family packing up its home.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sight_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>sight</strong> someone or something, you suddenly see them, often briefly.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The security forces sighted a group of young men that had crossed the border.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sight_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>sights</strong> of a weapon such as a rifle are the part which helps you aim it more accurately.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sight_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. plural noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>The</strong> <strong>sights</strong> are the places that are interesting to see and that are often visited by tourists.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I am going to show you the sights of our wonderful city.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sight_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. adverb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can use <strong>a sight</strong> to mean a lot. For example, if you say that something is <strong>a sight</strong> worse than it was before, you are emphasizing that it is much worse than it was.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>, <span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  She's been no more difficult than most daughters and a sight better than some I could
                  mention.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sight_1.16" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="sighted#sighted_1">sighted</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="sighting#sighting_1">sighting</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="sight_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>catch sight of</strong> someone, you suddenly see them, often briefly.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Then he caught sight of her small black velvet hat in the crowd.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sight_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that something seems to have certain characteristics <strong>at first sight</strong>, you mean that it appears to have the features you describe when you first see it
               but later it is found to be different.</span><span class="orth"><q>  It promised to be a more difficult undertaking than might appear at first sight.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sight_1.21" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something is <strong>in sight</strong> or <strong>within sight</strong>, you can see it. If it is <strong>out of sight</strong>, you cannot see it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The Atlantic coast is within sight of the hotel.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  My companion suggested that we park out of sight of passing traffic to avoid attracting
                  attention.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sight_1.24" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">12. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a result or a decision is <strong>in sight</strong> or <strong>within sight</strong>, it is likely to happen within a short time.</span><span class="orth"><q>  An agreement on many aspects of trade policy was in sight.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sight_1.26" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">13. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>lose sight of</strong> an important aspect of something, you no longer pay attention to it because you are
               worrying about less important things.</span><span class="orth"><q>  In some cases, U.S. industry has lost sight of customer needs in designing products.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sight_1.28" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">14. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone is ordered to do something <strong>on sight</strong>, they have to do it without delay, as soon as a person or thing is seen.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Troops shot anyone suspicious on sight.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sight_1.30" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">15. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>set</strong> your <strong>sights on</strong> something, you decide that you want it and try hard to get it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  They have set their sights on the world record.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="sleeve_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">sleeve<span class="pron">(sl<span class="underline">i</span>v<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sleeve" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/511/51109/51109.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">sleeves</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sleeve" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/511/51114/51114.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="sleeve_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>sleeves</strong> of a coat, shirt, or other item of clothing are the parts that cover your arms.</span><span class="orth"><q>  His sleeves were rolled up to his elbows.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He wore a black band on the left sleeve of his jacket.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sleeve_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A record <strong>sleeve</strong> is the stiff envelope in which a record is kept.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">mainly British</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  There are to be no pictures of him on the sleeve of the new record.</q></span><div class="semantic">in AM, usually use <strong>jacket</strong></div>
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sleeve_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you have something <strong>up</strong> your <strong>sleeve</strong>, you have an idea or plan which you have not told anyone about. You can also say
               that someone has <strong>an ace, card,</strong> or <strong>trick up</strong> their <strong>sleeve</strong>.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He wondered what Shearson had up his sleeve.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="screw_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">screw<span class="pron">(skr<span class="underline">u</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for screw" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/486/48600/48600.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">screws</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for screw" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/486/48608/48608.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">screwing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for screw" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/486/48607/48607.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">screwed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for screw" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/486/48605/48605.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="screw_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>screw</strong> is a metal object similar to a nail, with a raised spiral line around it. You turn
               a screw using a screwdriver so that it goes through two things, for example two pieces
               of wood, and fastens them together.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Each bracket is fixed to the wall with just three screws.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="screw_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>screw</strong> something somewhere or if it <strong>screws</strong> somewhere, you fix it in place by means of a screw or screws.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I had screwed the shelf on the wall myself.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n with adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Screw down any loose floorboards.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I particularly like the type of shelving that screws to the wall.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="screw_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>screw</strong> lid or fitting is one that has a raised spiral line on the inside or outside of it,
               so that it can be fixed in place by twisting.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...an ordinary jam jar with a screw lid.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="screw_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>screw</strong> something somewhere or if it <strong>screws</strong> somewhere, you fix it in place by twisting it round and round.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Kelly screwed the silencer onto the pistol.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n with adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Screw down the lid fairly tightly.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...several aluminium poles that screw together to give a maximum length of 10 yards.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="screw_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>screw</strong> something such as a piece of paper <strong>into</strong> a ball, you squeeze it or twist it tightly so that it is in the shape of a ball.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">into</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He screwed the paper into a ball and tossed it into the fire.</q></span><div class="semantic">in AM, use <strong>crush</strong></div>
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="screw_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>screw</strong> your face or your eyes <strong>into</strong> a particular expression, you tighten the muscles of your face to form that expression,
               for example because you are in pain or because the light is too bright.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">into</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He screwed his face into an expression of mock pain.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="screw_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>screws</strong> someone else or if two people <strong>screw</strong>, they have sex together.</span> (<span class="lbl register">rude</span>)
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="screw_1.18" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Some people use <strong>screw</strong> in expressions such as <strong>screw you</strong> or <strong>screw that</strong> to show that they are not concerned about someone or something or that they feel
               contempt for them.</span> (<span class="lbl register">rude</span>, <span class="lbl pragmatics">feelings</span>)
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="screw_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone says that they <strong>have been screwed</strong>, they mean that someone else has cheated them, especially by getting money from them
               dishonestly.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>, <span class="lbl register">rude</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They haven't given us accurate information. We've been screwed.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="screw_1.21" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>screws</strong> something, especially money, <strong>out of</strong> you, they get it from you by putting pressure on you.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">mainly British</span>, <span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">out of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  For decades rich nations have been screwing money out of poor nations.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="screw_1.23" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>turn</strong> or <strong>tighten the screw</strong> <strong>on</strong> someone, you increase the pressure which is already on them, for example by using
               threats, in order to force them to do a particular thing.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Parisian taxi drivers are threatening to mount a blockade to turn the screw on the
                  government.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
