      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="screw-up#screw-up_1">screw up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="sore_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">sore<span class="pron">(s<span class="underline"></span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sore" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/521/52123/52123.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">sorer</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sore" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/521/52126/52126.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">sorest</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sore" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/521/52128/52128.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">sores</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sore" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/521/52127/52127.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If part of your body is <strong>sore</strong>, it causes you pain and discomfort.</span><span class="orth"><q>  It's years since I've had a sore throat like I did last night.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  My chest is still sore from the surgery.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">soreness</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/521/52125/52125.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  The soreness lasted for about six weeks.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="sore_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are <strong>sore</strong> about something, you are angry and upset about it.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">mainly US</span>, <span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">at/about</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The result is that they are now all feeling very sore at you.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sore_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>sore</strong> is a painful place on the body where the skin is infected.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sore_1.9" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="cold-sore#cold-sore_1">cold sore</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="sore_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something is <strong>a sore point</strong> <strong>with</strong> someone, it is likely to make them angry or embarrassed if you try to discuss it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">with/for/between</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The continuing presence of American troops on Korean soil remains a very sore point
                  with these students.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sore_1.12" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="thumb#thumb_1">stick out like a sore thumb</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="slide_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">slide<span class="pron">(sl<span class="underline">a</span>d<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for slide" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/511/51143/51143.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">slides</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for slide" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/511/51146/51146.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">sliding</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for slide" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/511/51147/51147.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">slid</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for slide" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/511/51142/51142.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="slide_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When something <strong>slides</strong> somewhere or when you <strong>slide</strong> it there, it moves there smoothly over or against something.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n with adj]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She slid the door open.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I slid the wallet into his pocket.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Tears were sliding down his cheeks.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slide_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>slide</strong> somewhere, you move there smoothly and quietly.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He slid into the driver's seat.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slide_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>slide into</strong> a particular mood, attitude, or situation means to gradually start to have that mood,
               attitude, or situation often without intending to.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">into</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She had slid into a depression.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slide_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If currencies or prices <strong>slide</strong>, they gradually become worse or lower in value.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">journalism</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The U.S. dollar continued to slide.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> amount]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Shares slid 11p to 293p after brokers downgraded their profit estimates.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Slide</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">in</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the dangerous slide in oil prices.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slide_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>slide</strong> is a small piece of photographic film which you project onto a screen so that you
               can see the picture.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a slide show.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slide_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>slide</strong> is a piece of glass on which you put something that you want to examine through a
               microscope.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slide_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>slide</strong> is a piece of playground equipment that has a steep slope for children to go down
               for fun.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slide_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>let</strong> something <strong>slide</strong>, you allow it to get into a worse state or condition by not attending to it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The company had let environmental standards slide.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="sour_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">sour<span class="pron">(s<span class="underline">a</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sour" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/522/52218/52218.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">sours</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sour" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/522/52227/52227.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">souring</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sour" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/522/52225/52225.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">soured</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sour" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/522/52224/52224.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="sour_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Something that is <strong>sour</strong> has a sharp, unpleasant taste like the taste of a lemon.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The stewed apple was sour even with honey.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sour_1.3" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="sweet-and-sour#sweet-and-sour_1">sweet and sour</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="sour_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Sour</strong> milk is milk that has an unpleasant taste because it is no longer fresh.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Someone who is <strong>sour</strong> is bad-tempered and unfriendly.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She made a sour face in his direction.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">sourly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/522/52226/52226.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  'Leave my mother out of it,' he said sourly.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="sour_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a situation or relationship <strong>turns</strong> <strong>sour</strong> or <strong>goes</strong> <strong>sour</strong>, it stops being enjoyable or satisfactory.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Even the European dream is beginning to turn sour.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Their songs are filled with tales of love gone sour.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sour_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a friendship, situation, or attitude <strong>sours</strong> or if something <strong>sours</strong> it, it becomes less friendly, enjoyable, or hopeful.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  If anything sours the relationship, it is likely to be real differences in their world-views.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Her mood soured a little.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sour_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you refer to someone's attitude as <strong>sour grapes</strong>, you mean that they say that something is worthless or undesirable because they want
               it themselves but cannot have it.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">disapproval</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  Page's response to the suggestion that this might be sour grapes because his company
                  lost the bid is: 'Life's too short for that.'</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="senate_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">Senate<span class="pron">(s<span class="underline">e</span>nt<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for Senate" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/492/49268/49268.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">Senates</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for Senate" data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/492/49269/49269.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="senate_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. proper noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>The Senate</strong> is the smaller and more important of the two parts of the parliament in some countries,
               for example the United States and Australia.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The Senate is expected to pass the bill shortly.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a Senate committee.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="senate_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. proper noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Senate</strong> or <strong>the Senate</strong> is the governing council at some universities.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The new bill would remove student representation from the university Senate.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="seal-off_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">seal off<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/4/487/48779/48779.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="lbl misc"> (closing)</span></h1>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="seal-off_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. phrasal verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If one object or area <strong>is sealed off</strong> from another, there is a physical barrier between them, so that nothing can pass
               between them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed <span class="smallcaps">P</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Windows are usually sealed off.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> <span class="smallcaps">P</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the anti-personnel door that sealed off the chamber.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n <span class="smallcaps">P</span>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="seal-off_1.4" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="seal#seal_1">seal<sup>1</sup>7</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="xr hom-subsec">  See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="seal#seal_1">seal<sup>1</sup></a></span></div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="spoil_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">spoil<span class="pron">(sp<span class="underline"></span>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for spoil" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/527/52719/52719.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">spoils</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for spoil" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/527/52726/52726.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">spoiling</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for spoil" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/527/52725/52725.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">spoiled</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for spoil" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/527/52722/52722.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">spoilt</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for spoil" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/527/52729/52729.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">American English uses the form <strong>spoiled</strong> as the past tense and past participle. British English uses either <strong>spoiled</strong> or <strong>spoilt</strong>.
   </div>
   <div id="spoil_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>spoil</strong> something, you prevent it from being successful or satisfactory.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  It's important not to let mistakes spoil your life.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Peaceful summer evenings can be spoilt by mosquitoes.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>spoil</strong> children, you give them everything they want or ask for. This is considered to have
            a bad effect on a child's character.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Grandparents are often tempted to spoil their grandchildren whenever they come to
               visit.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">spoilt, spoiled</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/527/52729/52729.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/527/52722/52722.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adjective</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  A spoilt child is rarely popular with other children.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Oh, that child. He's so spoiled.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="spoil_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>spoil</strong> <strong>yourself</strong> or <strong>spoil</strong> another person, you give yourself or them something nice as a treat or do something
               special for them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Spoil yourself with a new perfume this summer.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Perhaps I could employ someone to iron his shirts, but I wanted to spoil him. He was
                  my man.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="spoil_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If food <strong>spoils</strong> or if it <strong>is spoilt</strong>, it is no longer fit to be eaten.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  We all know that fats spoil by becoming rancid.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Some organisms are responsible for spoiling food and cause food poisoning.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="spoil_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>spoils</strong> their vote, they write something illegal on their voting paper, usually as a protest
               about the election, and their vote is not accepted.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They had broadcast calls for voters to spoil their ballot papers.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="spoil_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. plural noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>spoils</strong> <strong>of</strong> something are things that people get as a result of winning a battle or of doing
               something successfully.</span><span class="orth"><q>  True to military tradition, the victors are now treating themselves to the spoils
                  of war.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="spoil_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that someone is <strong>spoilt for choice</strong> or <strong>spoiled for choice</strong>, you mean that they have a great many things of the same type to choose from.</span><span class="orth"><q>  At lunchtime, MPs are spoilt for choice in 26 restaurants and bars.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="spoil-for#spoil-for_1">spoil for</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="slope_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">slope<span class="pron">(sl<span class="underline">o</span>p<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for slope" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/512/51239/51239.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">slopes</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for slope" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/512/51241/51241.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">sloping</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for slope" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/512/51242/51242.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">sloped</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for slope" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/512/51240/51240.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="slope_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>slope</strong> is the side of a mountain, hill, or valley.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Saint-Christo is perched on a mountain slope.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the lower slopes of the Himalayas.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slope_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>slope</strong> is a surface that is at an angle, so that one end is higher than the other.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The street must have been on a slope.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a surface <strong>slopes</strong>, it is at an angle, so that one end is higher than the other.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The bank sloped down sharply to the river.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The garden sloped quite steeply.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">sloping</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/512/51242/51242.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adjective</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a brick building, with a sloping roof.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the gently sloping beach.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="slope_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>slopes</strong>, it leans to the right or to the left rather than being upright.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The writing sloped backwards.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slope_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>slope</strong> of something is the angle at which it slopes.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The slope increases as you go up the curve.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a slope of ten degrees.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slope_1.17" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="ski-slope#ski-slope_1">ski slope</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="slope_1.18" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="slippery#slippery_1">slippery slope</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="spray_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">spray<span class="pron">(spr<span class="underline">e</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for spray" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/528/52848/52848.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">sprays</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for spray" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/528/52857/52857.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">spraying</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for spray" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/528/52856/52856.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">sprayed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for spray" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/528/52853/52853.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="spray_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Spray</strong> is a lot of small drops of water which are being thrown into the air.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">from/of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The moon was casting a rainbow through the spray from the waterfall.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="spray_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>spray</strong> is a liquid kept under pressure in a can or other container, which you can force
               out in very small drops.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...hair spray.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a can of insect spray.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="spray_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>spray</strong> a liquid somewhere or if it <strong>sprays</strong> somewhere, drops of the liquid cover a place or shower someone.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A sprayer hooked to a tractor can spray five gallons onto ten acres.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Two inmates hurled slates at prison officers spraying them with a hose.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Drops of blood sprayed across the room.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="spray_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a lot of small things <strong>spray</strong> somewhere or if something <strong>sprays</strong> them, they are scattered somewhere with a lot of force.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A shower of mustard seeds sprayed into the air and fell into the grass.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The intensity of the blaze shattered windows, spraying glass on the streets below.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The bullet slammed into the ceiling, spraying them with bits of plaster.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="spray_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>sprays</strong> bullets somewhere, they fire a lot of bullets at a group of people or things.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He ran to the top of the building spraying bullets into shoppers below.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The army lorries were sprayed with machine gun fire from guerrillas in the woods.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="spray_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>is sprayed</strong>, it is painted using paint kept under pressure in a container.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The bare metal was sprayed with several coats of primer.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="spray_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When someone <strong>sprays</strong> against insects, they cover plants or crops with a chemical which prevents insects
               feeding on them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">against</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He doesn't spray against pests or diseases.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Confine the use of insecticides to the evening and do not spray plants that are in
                  flower.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Because of the immunity of the immature insects, it's important to spray regularly.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="spray_1.23" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>spray</strong> is a piece of equipment for spraying water or another liquid, especially over growing
               plants.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="spray_1.24" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>spray of</strong> flowers or leaves is a number of flowers or leaves on one stem or branch.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a small spray of freesias.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

    <a id="steep_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">steep<span class="pron">(st<span class="underline">i</span>p<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for steep" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/535/53525/53525.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">steeper</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for steep" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/535/53527/53527.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">steepest</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for steep" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/535/53528/53528.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>steep</strong> slope rises at a very sharp angle and is difficult to go up.</span><span class="orth"><q>  San Francisco is built on 40 hills and some are very steep.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a narrow, steep-sided valley.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">steeply</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/535/53534/53534.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  The road climbs steeply, with good views of Orvieto through the trees.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...steeply terraced valleys.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...houses with steeply sloping roofs.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>steep</strong> increase or decrease in something is a very big increase or decrease.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Consumers are rebelling at steep price increases.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">steeply</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/535/53534/53534.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  Unemployment is rising steeply.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="steep_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that the price of something is <strong>steep</strong>, you mean that it is expensive.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  The annual premium can be a little steep, but will be well worth it if your dog is
                  injured.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="steer_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">steer<span class="pron">(st<span class="underline"></span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for steer" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/535/53536/53536.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">steers</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for steer" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/535/53543/53543.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">steering</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for steer" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/535/53538/53538.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">steered</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for steer" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/535/53537/53537.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="steer_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>steer</strong> a car, boat, or plane, you control it so that it goes in the direction that you want.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  What is it like to steer a ship this size?</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  When I was a kid, about six or seven, she would often let me steer the car along our
                  driveway.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="steer_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>steer</strong> people towards a particular course of action or attitude, you try to lead them gently
               in that direction.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The new government is seen as one that will steer the country in the right direction.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="steer_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>steer</strong> someone in a particular direction, you guide them there.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Nick steered them into the nearest seats.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="steer_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>steer</strong> a particular <strong>course</strong>, you take a particular line of action.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Prime Minister Hun Sen has sought to steer a course between the two groups.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="steer_1.10" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="steering#steering_1">steering</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="steer_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>steer clear</strong> <strong>of</strong> someone or something, you deliberately avoid them.</span><span class="orth"><q>  I think a lot of people, women in particular, steer clear of these sensitive issues.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="stiff_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">stiff<span class="pron">(st<span class="underline"></span>f<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stiff" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/536/53663/53663.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">stiffer</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stiff" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/536/53669/53669.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">stiffest</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stiff" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/536/53670/53670.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Something that is <strong>stiff</strong> is firm or does not bend easily.</span><span class="orth"><q>  His waterproof trousers were brand new and stiff.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Clean the mussels with a stiff brush under cold running water.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">stiffly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/536/53671/53671.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj</span><span class="lbl syntax">, <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  Moira sat stiffly upright in her straight-backed chair.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="stiff_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Something such as a door or drawer that is <strong>stiff</strong> does not move as easily as it should.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Train doors have handles on the inside. They are stiff so that they cannot be opened
                  accidentally.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are <strong>stiff</strong>, your muscles or joints hurt when you move, because of illness or because of too
            much exercise.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The Mud Bath is particularly recommended for relieving tension and stiff muscles.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  I'm stiff all over right nowI hope I can recover for tomorrow's race.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">stiffly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/536/53671/53671.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  He climbed stiffly from the Volkswagen.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Stiff</strong> behaviour is rather formal and not very friendly or relaxed.</span><span class="orth"><q>  They always seemed a little awkward with each other, a bit stiff and formal.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">stiffly</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/536/53671/53671.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v</span><span class="lbl syntax">, <span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> adj]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  'Why don't you borrow your sister's car?' said Cassandra stiffly.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a stiffly worded letter of complaint.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="stiff_1.18" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Stiff</strong> can be used to mean difficult or severe.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The film faces stiff competition for the Best Film nomination.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Under Greece's stiff anti-drugs laws they could face twenty years in jail.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stiff_1.21" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>stiff</strong> drink is a large amount of a strong alcoholic drink.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a stiff whisky.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stiff_1.23" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. adverb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are bored <strong>stiff</strong>, worried <strong>stiff</strong>, or scared <strong>stiff</strong>, you are extremely bored, worried, or scared.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>, <span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  Anna tried to look interested. Actually, she was bored stiff.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="slip_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">slip<span class="pron">(sl<span class="underline"></span>p<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for slip" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/511/51183/51183.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">slips</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for slip" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/512/51200/51200.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">slipping</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for slip" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/511/51199/51199.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">slipped</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for slip" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/511/51193/51193.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="slip_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>slip</strong>, you accidentally slide and lose your balance.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He had slipped on an icy pavement.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Be careful not to slip.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slip_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>slips</strong>, it slides out of place or out of your hand.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His glasses had slipped.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The hammer slipped out of her grasp.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slip_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>slip</strong> somewhere, you go there quickly and quietly.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Amy slipped downstairs and out of the house.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slip_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>slip</strong> something somewhere, you put it there quickly in a way that does not attract attention.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I slipped a note under Louise's door.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n with adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Just slip in a piece of paper.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slip_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>slip</strong> something <strong>to</strong> someone, you give it to them secretly.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Robert had slipped her a note in school.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She looked round before pulling out a package and slipping it to the man.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slip_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>slip into</strong> a particular state or situation means to pass gradually into it, in a way that is
               hardly noticed.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">into</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  It amazed him how easily one could slip into a routine.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slip_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>slips</strong> <strong>to</strong> a lower level or standard, it falls to that level or standard.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to/from/by</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Shares slipped to 117p.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> amount]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  In June, producer prices slipped 0.1% from May.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Overall business activity is slipping.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Slip</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">in</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a slip in consumer confidence.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slip_1.22" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>slip</strong> <strong>into</strong> or <strong>out of</strong> clothes or shoes, you put them on or take them off quickly and easily.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">into/out of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She slipped out of the jacket and tossed it on the couch.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n with  <em class="hi">on/off</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I slipped off my woollen gloves.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slip_1.25" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>slip</strong> is a small or unimportant mistake.</span><span class="orth"><q>  We must be well prepared, there must be no slips.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slip_1.27" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>slip</strong> <strong>of</strong> paper is a small piece of paper.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...little slips of paper he had torn from a notebook.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  I put her name on the slip.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slip_1.30" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>slip</strong> is a thin piece of clothing that a woman wears under her dress or skirt.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slip_1.31" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="freudian-slip#freudian-slip_1">Freudian slip</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="slip_1.32" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">13. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>give</strong> someone <strong>the slip</strong>, you escape from them when they are following you or watching you.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  He gave reporters the slip by leaving at midnight.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slip_1.34" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">14. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>let slip</strong> information, you accidentally tell it to someone, when you wanted to keep it secret.</span><span class="orth"><q>  I bet he let slip that I'd gone to America.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slip_1.36" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">15. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>slips</strong> your <strong>mind</strong>, you forget about it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The reason for my visit had obviously slipped his mind.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="slip_1.38" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="finger#finger_1">to slip through your fingers</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="slip_1.39" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="tongue#tongue_1">slip of the tongue</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="slip-in#slip-in_1">slip in</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="slip-through#slip-through_1">slip through</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="slip-up#slip-up_1">slip up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="sting_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">sting<span class="pron">(st<span class="underline"></span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sting" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/537/53714/53714.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">stings</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sting" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/537/53720/53720.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">stinging</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sting" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/537/53717/53717.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">stung</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sting" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/543/54314/54314.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="sting_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a plant, animal, or insect <strong>stings</strong> you, a sharp part of it, usually covered with poison, is pushed into your skin so
               that you feel a sharp pain.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The nettles stung their legs.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  This type of bee rarely stings.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sting_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>sting</strong> of an insect or animal is the part that stings you.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Remove the bee sting with tweezers.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sting_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you feel a <strong>sting</strong>, you feel a sharp pain in your skin or other part of your body.</span><span class="orth"><q>  This won't hurtyou will just feel a little sting.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sting_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a part of your body <strong>stings</strong>, or if a substance <strong>stings</strong> it, you feel a sharp pain there.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His cheeks were stinging from the icy wind.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Sprays can sting sensitive skin.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sting_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone's remarks <strong>sting</strong> you, they make you feel hurt and annoyed.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He's a sensitive lad and some of the criticism has stung him.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="stir_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">stir<span class="pron">(st<span class="underline"></span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stir" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/537/53742/53742.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">stirs</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stir" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/537/53755/53755.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">stirring</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stir" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/537/53751/53751.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">stirred</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stir" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/537/53748/53748.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="stir_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>stir</strong> a liquid or other substance, you move it around or mix it in a container using something
               such as a spoon.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Stir the soup for a few seconds.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">into</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  There was Mrs Bellingham, stirring sugar into her tea.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n with  <em class="hi">in</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  You don't add the peanut butter until after you've stirred in the honey.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stir_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>stir</strong>, you move slightly, for example because you are uncomfortable or beginning to wake
               up.</span> (<span class="lbl register">written</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Eileen shook him, and he started to stir.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The two women lay on their backs, not stirring.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stir_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you do not <strong>stir</strong> <strong>from</strong> a place, you do not move from it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">written</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">from</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She had not stirred from the house that evening.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stir_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>stirs</strong> or if the wind <strong>stirs</strong> it, it moves gently in the wind.</span> (<span class="lbl register">written</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Palm trees stir in the soft Pacific breeze.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Not a breath of fresh air stirred the long white curtains.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stir_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a particular memory, feeling, or mood <strong>stirs</strong> or <strong>is stirred</strong> <strong>in</strong> you, you begin to think about it or feel it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">written</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">in</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Then a memory stirs in you and you start feeling anxious.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">in</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Amy remembered the anger he had stirred in her.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Deep inside the awareness was stirring that something was about to happen.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stir_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If an event causes a <strong>stir</strong>, it causes great excitement, shock, or anger among people.</span><span class="orth"><q>  His film has caused a stir in America.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stir_1.19" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="stirring#stirring_1">stirring</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="stir-up#stir-up_1">stir up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="strain_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">strain<span class="pron">(str<span class="underline">e</span>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for strain" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/539/53977/53977.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">strains</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for strain" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/539/53982/53982.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">straining</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for strain" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/539/53981/53981.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">strained</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for strain" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/539/53978/53978.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="strain_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If <strong>strain</strong> is put <strong>on</strong> an organization or system, it has to do more than it is able to do.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The prison service is already under considerable strain.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">on</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The vast expansion in secondary education is putting an enormous strain on the system.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strain_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>strain</strong> something means to make it do more than it is able to do.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The volume of scheduled flights is straining the air traffic control system.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strain_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Strain</strong> is a state of worry and tension caused by a difficult situation.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She was tired and under great strain.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the stresses and strains of a busy and demanding career.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strain_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that a situation is <strong>a strain</strong>, you mean that it makes you worried and tense.</span><span class="orth"><q>  I sometimes find it a strain to be responsible for the mortgage.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strain_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Strain</strong> is a force that pushes, pulls, or stretches something in a way that may damage it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Place your hands under your buttocks to take some of the strain off your back.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strain_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Strain</strong> is an injury to a muscle in your body, caused by using the muscle too much or twisting
               it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Avoid muscle strain by warming up with slow jogging.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strain_1.15" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>strain</strong> a muscle, you injure it by using it too much or twisting it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He strained his back during a practice session.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strain_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>strain</strong> <strong>to</strong> do something, you make a great effort to do it when it is difficult to do.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> to-inf]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I had to strain to hear.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They strained their eyes, but saw nothing.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strain_1.20" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>strain</strong> food, you separate the liquid part of it from the solid parts.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Strain the stock and put it back into the pan.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strain_1.22" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
