         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can use <strong>strain</strong> to refer to a particular quality in someone's character, remarks, or work.</span><span class="orth"><q>  There was a strain of bitterness in his voice.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...this cynical strain in the book.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strain_1.25" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>strain</strong> <strong>of</strong> a germ, plant, or other organism is a particular type of it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Every year new strains of influenza develop.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strain_1.27" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="eye-strain#eye-strain_1">eye strain</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="repetitive-strain-injury#repetitive-strain-injury_1">repetitive strain injury</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="strike_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">strike<span class="pron">(str<span class="underline">a</span>k<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for strike" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54123/54123.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">strikes</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for strike" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54133/54133.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">striking</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for strike" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54134/54134.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">struck</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for strike" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/542/54223/54223.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">stricken</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for strike" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54108/54108.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">The form <strong>struck</strong> is the past tense and past participle. The form <strong>stricken</strong> can also be used as the past participle for meanings  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="strike#strike_1">6</a></span></span> and  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="strike#strike_1">17</a></span></span>.
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When there is a <strong>strike</strong>, workers stop doing their work for a period of time, usually in order to try to get
               better pay or conditions for themselves.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">business</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  French air traffic controllers have begun a three-day strike in a dispute over pay.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Staff at the hospital went on strike in protest at the incidents.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a call for strike action.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When workers <strong>strike</strong>, they go on strike.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">business</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...their recognition of the workers' right to strike.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They shouldn't be striking for more money.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ing]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The government agreed not to sack any of the striking workers.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">striker</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54131/54131.mp3"></a>
</span> ( <span class="infl">strikers</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for striker" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54132/54132.mp3"></a>
</span>)<span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">countable noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  The strikers want higher wages, which state governments say they can't afford.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="strike_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>strike</strong> someone or something, you deliberately hit them.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She took two quick steps forward and struck him across the mouth.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  It is impossible to say who struck the fatal blow.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something that is falling or moving <strong>strikes</strong> something, it hits it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His head struck the bottom when he dived into the 6ft end of the pool.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  One 16-inch shell struck the control tower.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.17" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>strike</strong> one thing against another, or if one thing <strong>strikes</strong> against another, the first thing hits the second thing.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">on/against</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Wilde fell and struck his head on the stone floor.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">against</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  My right toe struck against a submerged rock.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.20" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something such as an illness or disaster <strong>strikes</strong>, it suddenly happens.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Bank of England officials continued to insist that the pound would soon return to
                  stability but disaster struck.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A powerful earthquake struck the Italian island of Sicily early this morning.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.23" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>strike</strong> means to attack someone or something quickly and violently.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The attacker struck as she was walking near a housing estate at Monacurra.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.25" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A military <strong>strike</strong> is a military attack, especially an air attack.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a punitive air strike.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a nuclear strike.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also +  <em class="hi">against</em>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.28" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>strikes at</strong> the heart or root of something, it attacks or conflicts with the basic elements or
               principles of that thing.</span> (<span class="lbl register">literary</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">at</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a rejection of her core beliefs and values, which strikes at the very heart of
                  her being.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.30" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If an idea or thought <strong>strikes</strong> you, it suddenly comes into your mind.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A thought struck her. Was she jealous of her mother, then?</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n that]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  At this point, it suddenly struck me that I was wasting my time.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.33" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>strikes</strong> you <strong>as</strong> being a particular thing, it gives you the impression of being that thing.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">as</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He struck me as a very serious but friendly person.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">as</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  You've always struck me as being an angry man.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.36" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">12. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>are struck</strong> by something, you think it is very impressive, noticeable, or interesting.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">by/with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She was struck by his simple, spellbinding eloquence.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  What struck me about the firm is how genuinely friendly and informal it is.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.39" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">13. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>strike</strong> a deal or a bargain with someone, you come to an agreement with them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They struck a deal with their paper supplier, getting two years of newsprint on credit.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The two struck a deal in which Rendell took half of what a manager would.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He insists he has struck no bargains for their release.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.43" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">14. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>strike</strong> a balance, you do something that is halfway between two extremes.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  At times like that you have to strike a balance between sleep and homework.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.45" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">15. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>strike</strong> a pose or attitude, you put yourself in a particular position, for example when someone
               is taking your photograph.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She struck a pose, one hand on her hip and the other waving an imaginary cigarette.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.47" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">16. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>strikes</strong> fear <strong>into</strong> people, it makes them very frightened or anxious.</span> (<span class="lbl register">literary</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">in/into</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  If there is a single subject guaranteed to strike fear in the hearts of parents, it
                  is drugs.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.49" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">17. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>are struck</strong> dumb or blind, you suddenly become unable to speak or to see.</span> (<span class="lbl register">written</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I was struck dumb by this and had to think it over for a moment.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.51" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">18. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When a clock <strong>strikes</strong>, its bells make a sound to indicate what the time is.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The clock struck nine.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Finally, the clock strikes.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.54" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">19. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>strike</strong> words <strong>from</strong> a document or an official record, you remove them.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">from</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Strike that from the minutes.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Strike out</strong> means the same as  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="strike#strike_1">strike</a></span></span>.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> <span class="smallcaps">P</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The censor struck out the next two lines.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n <span class="smallcaps">P</span>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.57" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">20. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>strike</strong> a match, you make it produce a flame by moving it quickly against something rough.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Robina struck a match and held it to the crumpled newspaper in the grate.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.59" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">21. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>strikes</strong> oil or gold, they discover it in the ground as a result of mining or drilling.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Hamilton Oil announced that it had struck oil in the Liverpool Bay area of the Irish
                  Sea.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.61" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">22. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When a coin or medal <strong>is struck</strong>, it is made.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Another medal was specially struck for him.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.63" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="stricken#stricken_1">stricken</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="striking#striking_1">striking</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="hunger-strike#hunger-strike_1">hunger strike</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="strike_1.64" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">24. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>strike gold</strong>, you find, do, or produce something that brings you a lot of money or success.</span> (<span class="lbl subj">journalism</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  The company has struck gold with its new holiday development, Center Parcs.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.66" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">25. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>strike it rich</strong>, you make a lot of money, especially in a short time.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  He hoped to strike it rich by investing in ginseng.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strike_1.68" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="chord#chord_1">to strike a chord</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="strike_1.69" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="home#home_1">strike home</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="strike_1.70" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="lucky#lucky_1">to strike it lucky</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="strike_1.71" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="medium#medium_1">to strike a happy medium</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="strike-back#strike-back_1">strike back</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="strike-down#strike-down_1">strike down</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="strike-off#strike-off_1">strike off</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="strike-out#strike-out_1">strike out</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="strike-up#strike-up_1">strike up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="strip_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">strip<span class="pron">(str<span class="underline"></span>p<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for strip" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54158/54158.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">strips</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for strip" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54184/54184.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">stripping</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for strip" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54183/54183.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">stripped</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for strip" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54180/54180.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="strip_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>strip</strong> <strong>of</strong> something such as paper, cloth, or food is a long, narrow piece of it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a new kind of manufactured wood made by pressing strips of wood together and baking
                  them.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Serve dish with strips of fresh raw vegetables.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strip_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>strip</strong> <strong>of</strong> land or water is a long narrow area of it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The coastal cities of Liguria sit on narrow strips of land lying under steep mountains.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a short boat ride across a narrow strip of water.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strip_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>strip</strong> is a long street in a city or town, where there are a lot of stores, restaurants,
               and hotels.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">US</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  ...Goff's Charcoal Hamburgers on Lover's Lane, a busy commercial strip in North Dallas.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strip_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>strip</strong>, you take off your clothes.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They stripped completely, and lay in the damp grass.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adj]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Women residents stripped naked in protest.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Strip off</strong> means the same as  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="strip#strip_1">strip</a></span></span>.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> <span class="smallcaps">P</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The children were brazenly stripping off and leaping into the sea.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strip_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>is stripped</strong>, their clothes are taken off by another person, for example in order to search for
               hidden or illegal things.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  One prisoner claimed he'd been dragged to a cell, stripped and beaten.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strip_1.15" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="stripsearch#stripsearch_1">strip-search</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="strip_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>strip</strong> something means to remove everything that covers it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  After Mike left for work I stripped the beds and vacuumed the carpets.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The floorboards in both this room and the dining room have been stripped, sanded and
                  sealed.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strip_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>strip</strong> an engine or a piece of equipment, you take it to pieces so that it can be cleaned
               or repaired.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Volvo's three-man team stripped the car and restored it.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Strip down</strong> means the same as  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="strip#strip_1">strip</a></span></span>.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n <span class="smallcaps">P</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  In five years I had to strip the water pump down four times.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> <span class="smallcaps">P</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I stripped down the two SU carburettors, cleaned and polished the pieces and rebuilt
                  the units.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strip_1.23" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> To <strong>strip</strong> someone <strong>of</strong> their property, rights, or titles means to take those things away from them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed +  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A senior official was stripped of all his privileges for publicly criticising his
                  employer.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strip_1.25" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In a newspaper or magazine, a <strong>strip</strong> is a series of drawings which tell a story. The words spoken by the characters are
               often written on the drawings.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">US</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  ...the Doonesbury strip.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="strip_1.27" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="landing-strip#landing-strip_1">landing strip</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="strip-away#strip-away_1">strip away</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="strip-down#strip-down_1">strip down</a></span></span></li>
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="strip-off#strip-off_1">strip off</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="stripe_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">stripe<span class="pron">(str<span class="underline">a</span>p<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stripe" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54174/54174.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">stripes</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stripe" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54176/54176.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="stripe_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>stripe</strong> is a long line which is a different colour from the areas next to it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She wore a bright green jogging suit with a white stripe down the sides.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  The walls in the front bedroom are painted with broad, pale blue and white stripes.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stripe_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In the armed forces or the police, <strong>stripes</strong> are V-shaped bands of material sewn onto a uniform to indicate the rank of corporal
               or sergeant. In the United States, <strong>stripes</strong> can also show the length of time that a person has served in an organization.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a soldier with a corporal's stripes on his arms.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="stare_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">stare<span class="pron">(st<span class="underline">e</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stare" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/533/53314/53314.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">stares</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stare" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/533/53317/53317.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">staring</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stare" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/533/53322/53322.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">stared</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stare" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/533/53316/53316.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="stare_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>stare</strong> <strong>at</strong> someone or something, you look at them for a long time.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Tamara stared at him in disbelief, shaking her head.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Mahoney tried not to stare.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Stare</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Hlasek gave him a long, cold stare.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stare_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a situation or the answer to a problem <strong>is staring</strong> you <strong>in the face</strong>, it is very obvious, although you may not be immediately aware of it.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  Then the answer hit me. It had been staring me in the face ever since Lullington.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="stare-out#stare-out_1">stare out</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="stroke_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">stroke<span class="pron">(str<span class="underline">o</span>k<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stroke" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54198/54198.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">strokes</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stroke" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/542/54200/54200.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">stroking</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stroke" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/542/54201/54201.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">stroked</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stroke" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54199/54199.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="stroke_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>stroke</strong> someone or something, you move your hand slowly and gently over them.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Carla, curled up on the sofa, was smoking a cigarette and stroking her cat.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She walked forward and embraced him and stroked his tousled white hair.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stroke_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone has a <strong>stroke</strong>, a blood vessel in their brain bursts or becomes blocked, which may kill them or
               make them unable to move one side of their body.</span><span class="orth"><q>  He had a minor stroke in 1987, which left him partly paralysed.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stroke_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>strokes</strong> of a pen or brush are the movements or marks that you make with it when you are writing
               or painting.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Fill in gaps by using short, upward strokes of the pencil.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stroke_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you are swimming or rowing, your <strong>strokes</strong> are the repeated movements that you make with your arms or the oars.</span><span class="orth"><q>  I turned and swam a few strokes further out to sea.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stroke_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A swimming <strong>stroke</strong> is a particular style or method of swimming.</span><span class="orth"><q>  She spent hours practising the breast stroke.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stroke_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>strokes</strong> of a clock are the sounds that indicate each hour.</span><span class="orth"><q>  On the stroke of 12, fireworks suddenly exploded into the night.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stroke_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In sports such as tennis, baseball, cricket, and golf, a <strong>stroke</strong> is the action of hitting the ball.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Compton was sending the ball here, there, and everywhere with each stroke.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stroke_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>A stroke of</strong> luck or good fortune is something lucky that happens.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  It didn't rain, which turned out to be a stroke of luck.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stroke_1.18" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. singular noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>A stroke of</strong> genius or inspiration is a very good idea that someone suddenly has.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  At the time, his appointment seemed a stroke of genius.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stroke_1.20" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something happens <strong>at a stroke</strong> or <strong>in one stroke</strong>, it happens suddenly and completely because of one single action.</span><span class="orth"><q>  The disease wiped out 40 million rabbits at a stroke.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  How can Britain reduce its prison population in one stroke?</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stroke_1.23" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone does not <strong>do a stroke</strong> <strong>of</strong> work, they are very lazy and do no work at all.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>, <span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  I never did a stroke of work at college.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="suited_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">suited<span class="pron">(s<span class="underline">u</span>td<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for suited" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/547/54712/54712.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="suited_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">adjective</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something is well <strong>suited</strong> <strong>to</strong> a particular purpose, it is right or appropriate for that purpose. If someone is
               well <strong>suited</strong> <strong>to</strong> a particular job, they are right or appropriate for that job.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The area is well suited to road cycling as well as off-road riding.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Satellites are uniquely suited to provide this information.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="suit_1"></a><h2 class="orth h1_entry">suit<span class="pron">(s<span class="underline">u</span>t<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for suit" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/547/54705/54705.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h2>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">suits</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for suit" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/547/54718/54718.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">suiting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for suit" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/547/54714/54714.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">suited</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for suit" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/547/54712/54712.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div id="suit_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A man's <strong>suit</strong> consists of a jacket, trousers, and sometimes a waistcoat, all made from the same
               fabric.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a dark pin-striped business suit.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a smart suit and tie.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="suit_1.4" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A woman's <strong>suit</strong> consists of a jacket and skirt, or sometimes trousers, made from the same fabric.</span><span class="orth"><q>  I was wearing my tweed suit.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="suit_1.6" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A particular type of <strong>suit</strong> is a piece of clothing that you wear for a particular activity.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a completely revolutionary atmospheric diving suit.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="suit_1.8" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>suits</strong> you, it is convenient for you or is the best thing for you in the circumstances.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They will only release information if it suits them.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They should be able to find you the best package to suit your needs.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="suit_1.11" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>suits</strong> you, you like it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I don't think a sedentary life would altogether suit me.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="suit_1.13" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a piece of clothing or a particular style or colour <strong>suits</strong> you, it makes you look attractive.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Green suits you.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="suit_1.15" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>suit</strong> <strong>yourself</strong>, you do something just because you want to do it, without bothering to consider other
               people.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  These large institutions makeand changethe rules to suit themselves.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He made a dismissive gesture. 'Suit yourself.'</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="suit_1.18" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In a court of law, a <strong>suit</strong> is a case in which someone tries to get a legal decision against a person or company,
               often so that the person or company will have to pay them money for having done something
               wrong to them.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Up to 2,000 former employees have filed personal injury suits against the company.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In American English, you can say that someone <strong>files</strong> or <strong>brings</strong> <strong>suit</strong> <strong>against</strong> another person.</span><span class="orth"><q>  One insurance company has already filed suit against the city of Chicago.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="suit_1.21" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. countable noun</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>suit</strong> is one of the four types of card in a set of playing cards. These are hearts, diamonds,
               clubs, and spades.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="suit_1.22" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="bathing-suit#bathing-suit_1">bathing suit</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="birthday-suit#birthday-suit_1">birthday suit</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="boiler-suit#boiler-suit_1">boiler suit</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="trouser-suit#trouser-suit_1">trouser suit</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="suit_1.23" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. phrase</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If people <strong>follow suit</strong>, they do the same thing that someone else has just done.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Efforts to persuade the remainder to follow suit have continued.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="substitute_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">substitute<span class="pron">(s<span class="underline"></span>bsttjut<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for substitute" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/545/54534/54534.mp3"></a>
</span></span><span class="pron">; <span class="lbl geo">US</span> -tut<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for substitute" data-src-mp3="/sounds/7/701/70110/70110.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">substitutes</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for substitute" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/545/54536/54536.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">substituting</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for substitute" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/545/54537/54537.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">substituted</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for substitute" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/545/54535/54535.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>substitute</strong> one thing <strong>for</strong> another, or if one thing <strong>substitutes</strong> <strong>for</strong> another, it takes the place or performs the function of the other thing.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They were substituting violence for dialogue.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  You could always substitute a low-fat soft cheese.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Would phone conversations substitute for cosy chats over lunch or in the pub after
               work?</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He was substituting for the injured William Wales.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">substitution</span> <span class="orth"><span class="pron">(s<span class="underline"></span>bsttj<span class="underline">u</span><sup></sup>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/545/54538/54538.mp3"></a>
</span></span><span class="pron">; <span class="lbl geo">US</span> -t<span class="underline">u</span>-)</span></span> ( <span class="infl">substitutions</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for substitution" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/545/54539/54539.mp3"></a>
</span>)<span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">variable noun</span></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  In my experience a straight substitution of carob for chocolate doesn't work.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="substitute_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>substitute</strong> is something that you have or use instead of something else.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...tests on humans to find a blood substitute made from animal blood.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="substitute_1.10" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that one thing is no <strong>substitute</strong> <strong>for</strong> another, you mean that it does not have certain desirable features that the other
               thing has, and is therefore unsatisfactory. If you say that there is no <strong>substitute</strong> <strong>for</strong> something, you mean that it is the only thing which is really satisfactory.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The printed word is no substitute for personal discussion with a great thinker.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">for</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  There is no substitute for practical experience.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="substitute_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> In team games such as football, a <strong>substitute</strong> is a player who is brought into a match to replace another player.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Coming on as a substitute, he scored four crucial goals for Cameroon.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>

    <a id="steep_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">steep<span class="pron">(st<span class="underline">i</span>p<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for steep" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/535/53525/53525.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">steeper</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for steep" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/535/53527/53527.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">steepest</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for steep" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/535/53528/53528.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>steep</strong> slope rises at a very sharp angle and is difficult to go up.</span><span class="orth"><q>  San Francisco is built on 40 hills and some are very steep.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a narrow, steep-sided valley.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">steeply</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/535/53534/53534.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  The road climbs steeply, with good views of Orvieto through the trees.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...steeply terraced valleys.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...houses with steeply sloping roofs.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. adjective</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>steep</strong> increase or decrease in something is a very big increase or decrease.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Consumers are rebelling at steep price increases.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">steeply</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/535/53534/53534.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">adverb</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">ADV</span> with v]</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  Unemployment is rising steeply.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="steep_1.12" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that the price of something is <strong>steep</strong>, you mean that it is expensive.</span> (<span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  The annual premium can be a little steep, but will be well worth it if your dog is
                  injured.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
