    <a id="sweep_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">sweep<span class="pron">(sw<span class="underline">i</span>p<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sweep" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/552/55263/55263.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">sweeps</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sweep" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/552/55268/55268.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">sweeping</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sweep" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/552/55267/55267.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">swept</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for sweep" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/553/55317/55317.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="sweep_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>sweep</strong> an area of floor or ground, you push dirt or rubbish off it using a brush with a
               long handle.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The owner of the store was sweeping his floor when I walked in.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She was in the kitchen sweeping crumbs into a dust pan.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Norma picked up the broom and began sweeping.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sweep_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>sweep</strong> things off something, you push them off with a quick smooth movement of your arm.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  With a gesture of frustration, she swept the cards from the table.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  'Thanks friend,' he said, while sweeping the money into his pocket.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sweep_1.8" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone with long hair <strong>sweeps</strong> their hair into a particular style, they put it into that style.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...stylish ways of sweeping your hair off your face.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Her long, fine hair was swept back in a ponytail.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sweep_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If your arm or hand <strong>sweeps</strong> in a particular direction, or if you <strong>sweep</strong> it there, it moves quickly and smoothly in that direction.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His arm swept around the room.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Daniels swept his arm over his friend's shoulder.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ing]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the long sweeping arm movements of a violinist.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Sweep</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  With one sweep of her hand she threw back the sheets.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sweep_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If wind, a stormy sea, or another strong force <strong>sweeps</strong> someone or something along, it moves them quickly along.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...landslides that buried homes and swept cars into the sea.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Suddenly, she was swept along by the crowd.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sweep_1.19" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>are swept</strong> somewhere, you are taken there very quickly.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The visitors were swept past various monuments.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A limousine swept her along the busy freeway to the airport.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sweep_1.22" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>sweeps</strong> from one place to another, it moves there extremely quickly.</span> (<span class="lbl register">written</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  An icy wind swept through the streets.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The car swept past the gate house.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sweep_1.25" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If events, ideas, or beliefs <strong>sweep</strong> through a place, they spread quickly through it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">through/across</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  A flu epidemic is sweeping through Moscow.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...the wave of patriotism sweeping the country.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sweep_1.28" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>sweeps</strong> into a place, they walk into it in a proud, confident way, often when they are angry.</span> (<span class="lbl register">written</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She swept into the conference room.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Scarlet with rage, she swept past her employer and stormed up the stairs.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The Chief turned and swept out.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sweep_1.32" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a person or group <strong>sweeps</strong> an election or <strong>sweeps</strong> <strong>to</strong> victory, they win the election easily.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a man who's promised to make radical changes to benefit the poor has swept the
                  election.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  In both republics, centre-right parties swept to power.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sweep_1.35" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone makes a <strong>sweep</strong> <strong>of</strong> a place, they search it, usually because they are looking for people who are hiding
               or for an illegal activity.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Two of the soldiers swiftly began making a sweep of the premises.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sweep_1.37" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="sweeping#sweeping_1">sweeping</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="chimney-sweep#chimney-sweep_1">chimney sweep</a></span></span></div>
   <div id="sweep_1.38" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">13. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>sweeps</strong> something bad or wrong <strong>under the carpet</strong>, or if they <strong>sweep</strong> it <strong>under the rug</strong>, they try to prevent people from hearing about it.</span><span class="orth"><q>  For a long time this problem has been swept under the carpet.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sweep_1.40" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">14. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>make</strong> <strong>a clean sweep</strong> <strong>of</strong> something such as a series of games or tournaments, you win them all.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...the first club to make a clean sweep of all three trophies.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="sweep_1.42" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="board#board_1">sweep the board</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="sweep-up#sweep-up_1">sweep up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="stretch_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">stretch<span class="pron">(str<span class="underline">e</span>t<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stretch" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/540/54091/54091.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">stretches</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stretch" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/540/54098/54098.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">stretching</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stretch" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54101/54101.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">stretched</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for stretch" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/540/54094/54094.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="stretch_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> Something that <strong>stretches</strong> over an area or distance covers or exists in the whole of that area or distance.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The procession stretched for several miles.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...an artificial reef stretching the length of the coast.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stretch_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>stretch</strong> <strong>of</strong> road, water, or land is a length or area of it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  It's a very dangerous stretch of road.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
   </h3>
   <ol class="sense_list level_0">
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When you <strong>stretch</strong>, you put your arms or legs out straight and tighten your muscles.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  He yawned and stretched.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Try stretching your legs and pulling your toes upwards.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She arched her back and stretched herself.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Stretch</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  At the end of a workout spend time cooling down with some slow stretches.</q></span></li>
      <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"> <span class="drv">stretching</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for " data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/541/54101/54101.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="gramGrp"> <span class="pos">uncount noun</span></span><span class="orth"><q>  Make sure no awkward stretching is required.</q></span></li>
   </ol>
   <div id="stretch_1.13" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>stretch</strong> <strong>of</strong> time is a period of time.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...after an 18-month stretch in the army.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  He would study for eight to ten hours at a stretch.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stretch_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>stretches</strong> <strong>from</strong> one time <strong>to</strong> another, it begins at the first time and ends at the second, which is longer than
               expected.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>  <em class="hi">from</em> n  <em class="hi">to</em> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a working day that stretches from seven in the morning to eight at night.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stretch_1.18" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a group of things <strong>stretch</strong> <strong>from</strong> one type of thing <strong>to</strong> another, the group includes a wide range of things.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>  <em class="hi">from</em> n  <em class="hi">to</em> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  ...a trading empire, with interests that stretched from chemicals to sugar.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stretch_1.20" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> When something soft or elastic <strong>stretches</strong> or <strong>is stretched</strong>, it becomes longer or bigger as well as thinner, usually because it is pulled.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The cables are designed not to stretch.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Ease the pastry into the corners of the tin, making sure you don't stretch it.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stretch_1.23" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Stretch</strong> fabric is soft and elastic and stretches easily.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...stretch fabrics such as Lycra.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...stretch cotton swimsuits.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stretch_1.26" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>stretch</strong> an amount of something or if it <strong>stretches</strong>, you make it last longer than it usually would by being careful and not wasting any
               of it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They're used to stretching their budgets.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  During his senior year his earnings stretched far enough to buy an old car.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stretch_1.29" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If your resources can <strong>stretch to</strong> something, you can just afford to do it.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She suggested to me that I might like to start regular savings and I said Well, I
                  don't know whether I can stretch to that.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stretch_1.31" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>stretches</strong> your money or resources, it uses them up so you have hardly enough for your needs.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The drought there is stretching American resources.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Public expenditure was being stretched to the limit by having to support 3 million
                  unemployed people.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stretch_1.34" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">12. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that a job or task <strong>stretches</strong> you, you mean that you like it because it makes you work hard and use all your energy
               and skills so that you do not become bored or achieve less than you should.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">approval</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I'm trying to move on and stretch myself with something different.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [ <em class="hi">be</em> <span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ed]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  They criticised the quality of teaching, claiming pupils were not stretched enough.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stretch_1.37" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">13. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you are <strong>at full stretch</strong>, you are using the maximum amount of effort or energy.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Everyone would be working at full stretch.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stretch_1.39" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">14. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that something is not true or possible <strong>by any stretch of the imagination</strong>, you are emphasizing that it is completely untrue or absolutely impossible.</span> (<span class="lbl pragmatics">emphasis</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  Her husband was not a womaniser by any stretch of the imagination.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="stretch_1.41" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">15. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>stretch</strong> your <strong>legs</strong>, you go for a short walk, usually after you have been sitting down for a long time.</span><span class="orth"><q>  I stopped at the square and got out to stretch my legs.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="stretch-out#stretch-out_1">stretch out</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="swell_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">swell<span class="pron">(sw<span class="underline">e</span>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for swell" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/553/55307/55307.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">swells</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for swell" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/553/55312/55312.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">swelling</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for swell" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/553/55310/55310.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">swelled</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for swell" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/553/55309/55309.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">swollen</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for swell" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/554/55406/55406.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div class="semantic">The forms <strong>swelled</strong> and <strong>swollen</strong> are both used as the past participle.
   </div>
   <div id="swell_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If the amount or size of something <strong>swells</strong> or if something <strong>swells</strong> it, it becomes larger than it was before.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The human population swelled, at least temporarily, as migrants moved south.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to/by</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His bank balance has swelled by 222,000 in the last three weeks.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Offers from other countries should swell the force to 35,000.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swell_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something such as a part of your body <strong>swells</strong>, it becomes larger and rounder than normal.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Do your ankles swell at night?</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The limbs swell to an enormous size.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Swell up</strong> means the same as  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="swell#swell_1">swell</a></span></span>.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> <span class="smallcaps">P</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  When you develop a throat infection or catch a cold the glands in the neck swell up.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swell_1.9" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>swell</strong> <strong>with</strong> a feeling, you are suddenly full of that feeling.</span> (<span class="lbl register">literary</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She could see her two sons swell with pride.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swell_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. adjective</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can describe something as <strong>swell</strong> if you think it is really nice.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">US</span>, <span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  I've had a swell time.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swell_1.13" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="swelling#swelling_1">swelling</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="swollen#swollen_1">swollen</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="groundswell#groundswell_1">groundswell</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="swell-up#swell-up_1">swell up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>

         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>swelling</strong> is a raised, curved shape on the surface of your body which appears as a result of
               an injury or an illness.</span><span class="orth"><q>  His eye was partly closed, and there was a swelling over his lid.</q></span></li>

</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">swelling</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for swell" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/553/55310/55310.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">swelled</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for swell" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/553/55309/55309.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">swollen</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for swell" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/554/55406/55406.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h3 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h3>
   <div class="semantic">The forms <strong>swelled</strong> and <strong>swollen</strong> are both used as the past participle.
   </div>
   <div id="swell_1.1" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If the amount or size of something <strong>swells</strong> or if something <strong>swells</strong> it, it becomes larger than it was before.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The human population swelled, at least temporarily, as migrants moved south.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to/by</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His bank balance has swelled by 222,000 in the last three weeks.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Offers from other countries should swell the force to 35,000.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swell_1.5" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something such as a part of your body <strong>swells</strong>, it becomes larger and rounder than normal.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Do your ankles swell at night?</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The limbs swell to an enormous size.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Swell up</strong> means the same as  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="swell#swell_1">swell</a></span></span>.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> <span class="smallcaps">P</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  When you develop a throat infection or catch a cold the glands in the neck swell up.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swell_1.9" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>swell</strong> <strong>with</strong> a feeling, you are suddenly full of that feeling.</span> (<span class="lbl register">literary</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She could see her two sons swell with pride.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swell_1.11" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. adjective</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can describe something as <strong>swell</strong> if you think it is really nice.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">US</span>, <span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  I've had a swell time.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swell_1.13" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="swelling#swelling_1">swelling</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="swollen#swollen_1">swollen</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="groundswell#groundswell_1">groundswell</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="swell-up#swell-up_1">swell up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="swing_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">swing<span class="pron">(sw<span class="underline"></span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for swing" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/553/55362/55362.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">swings</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for swing" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/553/55369/55369.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">swinging</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for swing" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/553/55368/55368.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">swung</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for swing" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/554/55429/55429.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="swing_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>swings</strong> or if you <strong>swing</strong> it, it moves repeatedly backwards and forwards or from side to side from a fixed
               point.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The sail of the little boat swung crazily from one side to the other.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She was swinging a bottle of wine by its neck.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>-ing]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Ian lit a cigarette and sat on the end of the table, one leg swinging.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Swing</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  ...a woman in a tight red dress, walking with a slight swing to her hips.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swing_1.6" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something <strong>swings</strong> in a particular direction or if you <strong>swing</strong> it in that direction, it moves in that direction with a smooth, curving movement.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The torchlight swung across the little beach and out over the water, searching.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The canoe found the current and swung around.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Roy swung his legs carefully off the couch and sat up.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Swing</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  When he's not on the tennis court, you'll find him practising his golf swing.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swing_1.11" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If a vehicle <strong>swings</strong> in a particular direction, or if the driver <strong>swings</strong> it in a particular direction, they turn suddenly in that direction.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Joanna swung back on to the main approach and headed for the airport.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n prep/adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The tyres dug into the grit as he swung the car off the road.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swing_1.14" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If someone <strong>swings</strong> <strong>around</strong>, they turn around quickly, usually because they are surprised.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She swung around to him, spilling her tea without noticing it.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swing_1.16" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">5. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>swing</strong> <strong>at</strong> a person or thing, you try to hit them with your arm or with something that you are
               holding.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">at</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Blanche swung at her but she moved her head back and Blanche missed.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">at</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  I picked up his baseball bat and swung at the man's head.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n  <em class="hi">at</em> n]</span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Swing</strong> is also a noun.</span><span class="orth"><q>  I often want to take a swing at someone to relieve my feelings.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swing_1.20" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">6. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>swing</strong> is a seat hanging by two ropes or chains from a metal frame or from the branch of
               a tree. You can sit on the seat and move forwards and backwards through the air.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swing_1.21" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">7. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Swing</strong> is a style of jazz dance music that was popular in the 1930's. It was played by big
               bands.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swing_1.22" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">8. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>swing</strong> in people's opinions, attitudes, or feelings is a change in them, especially a sudden
               or big change.</span><span class="orth"><q>  There was a massive twenty per cent swing away from the Conservatives to the Liberal
                  Democrats.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  Dieters suffer from violent mood swings.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swing_1.25" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">9. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If people's opinions, attitudes, or feelings <strong>swing</strong>, they change, especially in a sudden or extreme way.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  In two years' time there is a presidential election, and the voters could swing again.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> adv/prep]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The mood amongst Tory MPs seems to be swinging away from their leader.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swing_1.28" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">10. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something is <strong>in full swing</strong>, it is operating fully and is no longer in its early stages.</span><span class="orth"><q>  When we returned, the party was in full swing and the dance floor was crowded.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swing_1.30" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">11. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>get into the swing of</strong> something, you become very involved in it and enjoy what you are doing.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Everyone understood how hard it was to get back into the swing of things after such
                  a long absence.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swing_1.32" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">12. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you say that a situation is <strong>swings and roundabouts</strong>, you mean that there are as many gains as there are losses.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">British</span>)
         </li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swing_1.33" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="cat#cat_1">no room to swing a cat</a></span></span></div>
</div></div>

</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">swelling</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for swell" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/553/55310/55310.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">swelled</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for swell" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/553/55309/55309.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">swollen</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for swell" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/554/55406/55406.mp3"></a>

<div class="definitions hom-subsec">

   <div class="semantic">The forms <strong>swelled</strong> and <strong>swollen</strong> are both used as the past participle.
   </div>
   <div id="swell_1.1" class="hom">

      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If the amount or size of something <strong>swells</strong> or if something <strong>swells</strong> it, it becomes larger than it was before.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The human population swelled, at least temporarily, as migrants moved south.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to/by</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  His bank balance has swelled by 222,000 in the last three weeks.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> n +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Offers from other countries should swell the force to 35,000.</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [Also <span class="smallcaps">V</span> n]</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swell_1.5" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If something such as a part of your body <strong>swells</strong>, it becomes larger and rounder than normal.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Do your ankles swell at night?</q></span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">to</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The limbs swell to an enormous size.</q></span></li>
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Swell up</strong> means the same as  <span class="xr"> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="swell#swell_1">swell</a></span></span>.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> <span class="smallcaps">P</span>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  When you develop a throat infection or catch a cold the glands in the neck swell up.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swell_1.9" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. verb</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>swell</strong> <strong>with</strong> a feeling, you are suddenly full of that feeling.</span> (<span class="lbl register">literary</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> +  <em class="hi">with</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  She could see her two sons swell with pride.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swell_1.11" class="hom">
      <h4 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. adjective</span> 
      </h4>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> You can describe something as <strong>swell</strong> if you think it is really nice.</span> (<span class="lbl geo">US</span>, <span class="lbl register">informal</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  I've had a swell time.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="swell_1.13" class="hom"> <span class="xr"> <span class="lbl">see also</span> <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="swelling#swelling_1">swelling</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="swollen#swollen_1">swollen</a></span>, <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="groundswell#groundswell_1">groundswell</a></span></span></div>
</div>
<div class="re hom-subsec">
   <ul class="sense_list level_1">
      <li> <span class="xr"> See  <span class="xr_ref"><a class="xr_ref_link" href="swell-up#swell-up_1">swell up</a></span></span></li>
   </ul>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="symptom_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">symptom<span class="pron">(s<span class="underline"></span>mptm<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for symptom" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/554/55476/55476.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">symptoms</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for symptom" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/554/55478/55478.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="symptom_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>symptom</strong> of an illness is something wrong with your body or mind that is a sign of the illness.</span><span class="orth"><q>  One of the most common symptoms of schizophrenia is hearing imaginary voices.</q></span><span class="orth"><q>  ...patients with flu symptoms.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="symptom_1.4" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. countable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> A <strong>symptom</strong> <strong>of</strong> a bad situation is something that happens which is considered to be a sign of this
               situation.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Your problem with keeping boyfriends is just a symptom of a larger problem: making
                  and keeping friends.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="avail_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">avail<span class="pron">(v<span class="underline">e</span>l<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for avail" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/032/03209/03209.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">avails</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for avail" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/032/03214/03214.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">availing</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for avail" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/032/03213/03213.mp3"></a>
</span><span class="infl">,</span><span class="infl">availed</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for avail" data-src-mp3="/sounds/0/032/03212/03212.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="avail_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. phrase</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you do something <strong>to no avail</strong> or <strong>to little avail</strong>, what you do fails to achieve what you want.</span> (<span class="lbl register">written</span>)<span class="orth"><q>  His efforts were to no avail.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="avail_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. verb</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If you <strong>avail</strong> <strong>yourself of</strong> an offer or an opportunity, you accept the offer or make use of the opportunity.</span> (<span class="lbl register">formal</span>)<span class="lbl syntax"> [<span class="smallcaps">V</span> pron-refl +  <em class="hi">of</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  Guests should feel at liberty to avail themselves of your facilities.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html><html><body><div class="homograph-entry">    
    <a id="tension_1"></a><h1 class="orth h1_entry">tension<span class="pron">(t<span class="underline">e</span>n<sup></sup>n<span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for tension" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/563/56357/56357.mp3"></a>
</span>)</span></h1>
<div class="inflected_forms"><span class="var">Word forms:</span> <span class="infl">tensions</span><span class="hwd_sound">    <a class="hwd_sound sound audio_play_button" title="Pronunciation for tension" data-src-mp3="/sounds/5/563/56358/56358.mp3"></a>
</span></div>
<div class="definitions hom-subsec">
   <h2 class="h2_entry">Definitions</h2>
   <div id="tension_1.1" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">1. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Tension</strong> is the feeling that is produced in a situation when people are anxious and do not
               trust each other, and when there is a possibility of sudden violence or conflict.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">between</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The tension between the two countries is likely to remain.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="tension_1.3" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">2. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> <strong>Tension</strong> is a feeling of worry and anxiety which makes it difficult for you to relax.</span><span class="orth"><q>  Smiling and laughing has actually been shown to relieve tension and stress.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="tension_1.5" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">3. variable noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> If there is a <strong>tension</strong> between forces, arguments, or influences, there are differences between them that
               cause difficulties.</span><span class="lbl syntax"> [+  <em class="hi">between</em>]</span> <span class="orth"><q>  The film explored the tension between public duty and personal affections.</q></span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
   <div id="tension_1.7" class="hom">
      <h3 class="gramGrp h3_entry"><span class="pos">4. uncount noun</span> 
      </h3>
      <ol class="sense_list level_0">
         <li class="sense_list_item level_1" style="list-style-type: none"><span class="def"> The <strong>tension</strong> in something such as a rope or wire is the extent to which it is stretched tight.</span></li>
      </ol>
   </div>
</div></div>
<//body><//html>
